buginformation.summary: Still OOM problems with current release 2014.04.30
buginformation.description: Looking on the PlayStore console, it became better than in the previous release but still a high occurence of OOM related crashes. Here are some stacktraces: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

buginformation.summary: NumberFormatException on loading GK
buginformation.description: 2015.03.30-NB1: Open GKC241 Gk is shown but log contains a NumberFormatException 22:23:20.651 Debug cgeo 28799 [network-6] GeokretyConnector.searchTrackable: gkid=49729

buginformation.summary: Missing log type

buginformation.summary: Backup failing
buginformation.description: With 2013.08.22-NB1 I cant backup my DB. @mucek4 has details on that

buginformation.summary: Translate is opening browser instead of translate app
buginformation.description: When I select translate for cache description or logs I see the following: Initially the Google Translate app is opened for a split of a second The app is closed again and I am redirected to the web translate tools of google I am quite sure this problem came in with 501fd91 as it is used to work normal just before. @Buuhuu Can you take a look ?

buginformation.summary: Missing log type
buginformation.description: One more log type was found missing: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC4D 12, Unarchive

buginformation.summary: Cache description not loading
buginformation.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: Open GC-code GC2H71J Result: The description is shown empty. For other caches the description is shown, but I am quite sure the description for this one was shown normal before recent site changes.

buginformation.summary: Archive message is shown as note
buginformation.description: I am not sure, whether this is a limitation of the API or a bug: Looking at an archive message in an OC-logbook it is shown as empty note. Example: OC5FEE Market version 2014.02.04

buginformation.summary: Personal note not parsed
buginformation.description: The personal note is not parsed when opening cache details. I have a cache with personal notes but it is not showing up with 2013.08.22-NB4.

buginformation.summary: use cache icon in logging activity
buginformation.description: Use the cache icon instead of the normal icon for the logging activity. Requested during an event. There might be more activities where this would be useful.

buginformation.summary: Not possible to search for GeoKrety code by scanning QR code from GK label
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Use case 1 Tap search box on front page of c:geo Enter GeoKret Reference Number, i.e. GKE830, into search box Use case 2 Select 'Scan geocode' from droplet menu on frontpage Scan QR code from GeoKret label Test label available here, just hit OK button on linked page. Use case 3 Scan QR code of GeoKret label with external app, e.g. Barcode Scanner Test label available here, just hit OK button on linked page. Tap scanned link in Barcode Scanner, and select 'Open with c:geo' Actual behavior after performing these steps: Use case 1 Toast displaying the tracking code and the text 'Loading trackable details' Opening details page for GeoKret trackable Use case 2 Toast displaying the text Didn't find any geocodes in the scan result. http://geokrety.org/m/qr.php?nr=X534GL OK Use case 3 Toast displaying tracking code of GK, and the text 'Loading trackable details...' Return to scanning app. Toast displaying 'c:geo can't find that trackable' Expected behavior after performing these steps: Use case 1 This is the expected behaviour Use case 2 Should behave similar to use case 1 Use case 3 Should behave similar to use case 1 Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Device: D5503 (D5503, Sony)

buginformation.summary: Cache note not removed after deleting at gc.com
buginformation.description: If you have a cache in the database with a cache note loaded from gc.com and if you remove it at gc.com it won't be removed in the c:geo-database.

I tried https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/wiki/Send-log-to-developers but it doesn't generate any log output. Just some few lines about an activity starting: --------- beginning of /dev/log/main

buginformation.description: If you run a search for caches, then all caches which are already stored on your device should have "Offline" in the line with the small cache attributes. This got lost somehow.

Yes System information: --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Waypoint Note edit defect
buginformation.description: If a Waypoint creat by use and some Text is sored in note (last field in editor) it is save correct ant show correct, but when edit this Waypoint again ne note lost formating e.g. save A=1/n B=2/n C=3 /n is new line then it is load in editor as A=1 B=2 C=2 This is bad if the layout is needed

buginformation.summary: have number of caches after "load more caches"
buginformation.description: The button to load more caches after a search is currently labeled "load more caches...". Instead it should be something like "load more caches (123 currently)". Otherwise there is no easy way to see how much the list already contains, if the title label is long.

buginformation.summary: NPE when exporting invalid cache
buginformation.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: rotation of log screen leads to "loading page"
buginformation.description: If the screen of the logging activity is rotated, the button for logging becomes "loading log page" again and can no longer be used.

buginformation.summary: No current position since the last update.
buginformation.description: After the last update (2014.12.12) c:geo doesn´t display the current Position with the blue marker. C:geo show a wrong position far from the correct one. Moreover the blue aim and the map are stuck even if you move. Samsung Galaxy Tab7

buginformation.summary: Attribute filter does not list all attributes
buginformation.description: Only attributes listed in res/values/cache_attributes.xml are shown, but there are more attributes defined in src/cgeo/geocaching/enumerations/CacheAttribute.java (e.g. OC only).

buginformation.summary: Support Spoiler Sync
buginformation.description: Spoiler Sync (http://www.anode.plus.com/spoilersync/) downloads spoiler-images for offline use. There's someone who would love to have support for Spoiler Sync in c:geo. http://www.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=897807#p897807

buginformation.summary: Showcaseview crashes on Android 2.3.x
buginformation.description: It looks like Android 2.3.x crashes on the release. We have had three reports on Google Play in a few minutes: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: android.animation.ObjectAnimator

buginformation.summary: invalid OSM Offline Map notification and disable
buginformation.description: Some weeks ago I installed an OSM map to save some traffic. I had the feeling that it does not work correctly, but did not check that. When I investigated today I realized that I was correct. I switched data network off on my phone and no maps were loaded.

buginformation.summary: Possibility to filter caches with no "found" logs in an offline list
buginformation.description: I did not see this filter in an offline list : considering and filtering caches with zero found log (as possible FTF to do). Of course, this is the cache state according to the last refresh, but it's user responsibility to update it. I know this has been already asked with a marker on a map, but the cache details are not downloaded in this case, so it has no sense. But in an offline list, we have these logs. The filter would just check if there is at least one "found" log. What do you think about it ?

buginformation.summary: Have a link to Project-GC for challenge caches
buginformation.description: Idea: If cache type is Mystery, platform is GC and title contains "Challenge" have a menu item "Search challenge checker" which directs to http://project-gc.com/Challenges/GCCODE

buginformation.summary: Geokrety support for OC no longer working
buginformation.description: This one is difficult to describe: I am very sure, that in the past it was possible to open an OC-cache and have an inventory page shown with the listed geokrets. It was also possible to click on the inventory and see the details of the geokret. Today with 2014.06.03-NB I have seen that this is obviously no longer working. I continued and tested it with the last market release 2014.05.14, but even there it seems not to work anymore. I am unsure whether it stopped working some time before that, or it is a problem of the API or it is a problem of switching to the new API. @rsudev Possibly you are the right one to answer that. Example: OCB92E which has a virtual geokret always logged into that cache

buginformation.summary: Owner information not shown for OC.de caches
buginformation.description: As discussed with @rsudev on IRC: Currently the owner name is not shown for OC.de caches. Either the owner information is not provided by the API or it is not parsed yet.

buginformation.summary: User name settings accepts multi line input
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: live map + no internet crash
buginformation.description: Hi, this is my first issue, I hope it will help. In the Nightly build (a221f3a) if you try to open the live map but without internet connection the app crashes. Greats

buginformation.summary: Bug: Suggestion to delete filtered list with empty result
buginformation.description: Small glitch in the implementation for #5226: If I have a filtered list (e.g. 'Status -found') and I remove the caches that are in the result (e.g. moving those to another list or deleting them), I get the suggestion to delete this allegedly empty list in spite of the number of filtered out caches still present on it.

buginformation.summary: Archived caches shown as active on map

buginformation.summary: move cache from dynamic list shall not refresh
buginformation.description: Expected behavior and actual behaviour: cgeo refreshes the current list after moving the cache to another list. For dynamic lists this leads to an empty list after the move operation. Steps to reproduce the problem: search nearest, with some of the results already being stored move a stored cache from the results to another list via context menu

buginformation.summary: Found Caches not marked
buginformation.description: In the saved caches list, the found caches aren't marked green anymore. In the details view of a cache the point that i found this one is missing too. This problem exists since a few days. I've installed the latest update of c:geo today but this didn't change anything.

buginformation.summary: Ask before drop
buginformation.description: On offline map (stored, show on map) in popup, "more details" and "drop" are really close together. Drop should ask "are you sure"? Caching 4h of walk from nearest GSM signal and if you press "drop" in a long walk there.

buginformation.summary: Enable live not working from wp map
buginformation.description: 2014.06.21-NB: This scenario was working in the past and I used it quite a lot: Open a cache which has saved waypoints Open map for a waypoint Select "Enable live" on the map Expectation: Map is working as live map now (showing saved caches as well as loading live caches) Result: No loading, no caches shown

buginformation.summary: Hide Export menu on list of unsaved caches
buginformation.description: 2016.02.03: Have no caches stored Search nearby caches Select Export -> GPX The resulting GPX is empty as non of the caches on that list has data in our database. Thus the export menu should only be available on saved lists but not on search results if technically possible.

buginformation.summary: No error handling for add/remove favorite failure
buginformation.description: If you have no network connection and try to Add or Remove a cache as a favorite, you get stuck with an endless dialog. I'll submit a PR and then rework as necessary as it affects same code as in #2331.

buginformation.summary: Usage of Mytery instead of Unknown in GPX exports
buginformation.description: From support mail: I'm using export from cgeo and import to Locus. I noticed this issue Mystery vs Unknown C:geo exports mystery caches with Geocache| groundspeak:typeMystery Cache/groundspeak:type Locus expects Geocache|Unknown Cache groundspeak:type/groundspeak:type At http://www.geocaching.com/about/guidelines.aspx#mystery I found this information: Note: Cache owners creating a mystery/puzzle cache will select "" from the cache types on the cache submission form http://www.geocaching.com/hide/cachebasics.aspx. I think "Unknown Cache" is the correct cache type.

buginformation.summary: Crash when deleting cache from lists
buginformation.description: With the current NB 2012.06.20-NB-7aec736 I tried cleaning up my lists by deleting already found cache. On several (but not all) tries to delete cache I got a crash. What I did: Open list (default list in my case) Sort by log-date Open a found cache Select delete in cache-details Here is the log (but is this the correct log ?!): W/dalvikvm(23330): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x4001e578)

buginformation.summary: Wrong GC TB inventory
buginformation.description: With 2015.03.28-NB1 (incl. Geokrety PR) I see the following problem: Each cache does only list one TB in the inventory list independently if GK connector is active or not. For example: GC3TCGP contains 2 TBs (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB shown in inventory Another example (with mixed TB/GK): GC3FJ5F contains 2 TB and 1 GK (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB and one GK shown in inventory It seems that now only 1 TB is shown

buginformation.summary: Better url for Google Translatebgiving mobile version

buginformation.summary: Navigation tools are both compass after reinstallation
buginformation.description: Uninstall c:geo and re-install. Both navigation tools are set to compass, but the secondary should be map.

buginformation.summary: Out of memory in images when downloading
buginformation.description: I think I found an easy solution for the out of memory issue when downloading caches. That code creates bitmaps which are not used afterwards. Mainly I wanted to change something else in cgHtmlImg, so this was merely a side effect (but that's why my commit will include some other refactorings).

buginformation.summary: Delay just after selecting "Refresh all"
buginformation.description: With version 2015.01.07-RC I can see a new behavior: When selecting Menu - "Refresh all" I experience a short delay before the refresh starts and the progress window is shown. Subjectively (I have to test) it rises with the amount of caches on the list to be refreshed. For a list of 100 caches it is a noticeable delay of approx. 1 second.

buginformation.summary: MapViews can only be created inside instances of MapActivity

buginformation.summary: Different log types and order before/after log page loading for owned caches
buginformation.description: Edit Lineflyer: Topic changed to reflect issue. When I want to log a 'performed maintenance', the type on geocaching.com will be 'need maintenance'. The options are not switched because 'need maintenance' will become 'need maintenance' also.

buginformation.summary: Settings: search for map file screen has wrong title
buginformation.description: The activity screen shown while c:geo scans for potential map files currently says in its title that it isa looking for gpx files. This seems to be a reuse issue of the import activity.

buginformation.summary: Found caches not hidden for basic members
buginformation.description: Edit: Update title to match the remaining issue With NB2802 - b2d7a2b I had the following problem: Some caches (not all) I have already found where not marked with the smiley-icon on the live map. When clicking on the icon the popup shows it as "Found", so the information seems to be available but not used in the live-map. It is not reproducible, meaning if I open the live-map again the situation changes or even the problem disappears. The rate is approx. 1 out of 30 for me which is not marked.

buginformation.summary: Child waypoints of exported GPX missing on reimport
buginformation.description: I got several independent users on FB and support who report, that they export a GPX from c:geo for caches with waypoints and some (or all) of these waypoints are missing when reimporting it on another c:geo installation. Both versions 2015.06.19 Did not have time to retest this yet.

buginformation.summary: multiple runs of firstLogin
buginformation.description: If you are on slow connection login can take up to 10 seconds or even more. If user turns off display and turn it back on a new login thread is started.

buginformation.summary: NPE when trying to edit WP coords
buginformation.description: 2014.10.09-NB: Open cache Create new WP in WP-tab or edit an existing WP Click on coord field to start editing Crash Log: 15:15:58.528 Debug cgeo 13063 LocationProvider: requesting low-power locations

buginformation.summary: Allow adding favpoint in logging activity
buginformation.description: From support mail: Right now I have to first log the cache and afterwards add it to my favorites on another page of c:geo. It would be better to have the option to add it, right on the logging screen like it is realized on the website (and in c:geo for voting on gcvote). It somehow makes sense, to decide about favoriting the cache while logging it, rather than having to do it manually afterwards.

buginformation.summary: Filter Smiley's from image tab
buginformation.description: We should suppress all images from the image tab, which have only the size of a typical smiley. Example cache http://coord.info/GC5DHMW

buginformation.summary: mapsforge zoom-controls placement
buginformation.description: Try to align mapsforge zoom-controls with google zoom-controls or vice versa.

buginformation.summary: refactor "parseSearch" to use BaseUtils matching routines
buginformation.description: parseSearch() still has the same problems that we already fixed in parseCache(), namely that it holds the complete webpage of every cache from the search results in memory. I'll apply a short term fix for this memory leak by adding a String constructor call, but we should really refactor that method to use the BaseUtil mechanisms.

Also trying manual in settings only reports that gc.com is not reachable It was working with older versions, but howeverI have none to test it. Using my phone with Android 2.3 everything is OK, same network, same version, same time. Can someone please doublecheck with a tablet ? Regards, Lineflyer

buginformation.description: When updating a stored OC.de cache, the content of the cache description is doubled.

buginformation.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: Cache names are mising

buginformation.summary: GK description truncated (geokretymap.org)
buginformation.description: 2015.03.30-NB: Enable Geokrety and cached loading from geokretymap.org Open GKC240 The trackable description is shown as Bitte ignorieren. which is truncated. The xml result of geokretymap.org contains the complete description:

buginformation.summary: Ability to copy only a part of the description
buginformation.description: I often want to copy only a part of the description to use in other apps. It might be a coord, a word that I want to google, a cipher in a mystery cache that I want to decipher etc. But when I long press the description there are only an option to copy all of the description. I would love if there was a possibility to select and copy a part of the description or part of the hint. Suggestion: Add a "Select text" option in the longpress menu Use standard text selection to select a part of the text. Like in the mockup below.

buginformation.summary: Have "status" filter for "Found within the last 30 days"
buginformation.description: From FB: Within the status filters it would be good to have an option to show only caches which have any found logs within the last 30 days.

buginformation.summary: Quicker change of OSM offline maps
buginformation.description: One from support email: I live in Holland near the Belgium and German border. So I often go looking for geocaches her. But outside my own country I don't have an internet connection on my Android phone. So I use offline maps (open street maps). Every time I want select an other map (country) I have to go in c:geo back to the main menu and to preferences and scroll all the way down. Is it possible to make it quicker to change offline maps? Or is it even possible to show all the downloaded maps at once? So I don't have to choose a map anymore.

buginformation.summary: TrackableActivity has not refresh button
buginformation.description: It would be cool to have a button to refresh a displayed trackable in the TrackableActivity.

buginformation.summary: Improve color markers in TB logbook
buginformation.description: Currently the log type "Discovered", "Visited", "Grabbed" and "Retrieved" have a green marker. The log type "Placed" and "Write note" have a grey marker. I suggest to keep the green marker for "Discovered" and "Visited" and use another green tone (maybe brighter green) for the types "Placed", "Retrieved" and "Grabbed" as these logs indicate a "real progress". Only "Write note" should stay with the grey marker.

buginformation.summary: FC in coordinate input
buginformation.description: Following scenario: New installation try to enter coordinates the first time. Format selection is PLAIN, controls shown are degree,minutes,seconds switch input style to something else -> FC Essentially this is an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception in the coordinate parser when trying to parse an empty string. This is due to the plain text controls being empty, even if trying to workaround this situation by entering some coordinates. Only workaround is to pre-fill the dialog with own coordinates (if available) version: 1a961ab

buginformation.summary: GK requests to GC
buginformation.description: Looking at the debug logs I saved yesterday (2015.03.29-NB) I have now seen requests like this http://www.geocaching.com/track/details.aspx?tracker=GKA301 in the c:geo log in parallel to the correct request to geokrety.org. Today 2015.03.30-NB1 I cannot reproduce this anymore. @kumy Was that solved by recent changes or an unreproducible behaviour?

buginformation.summary: Download of already stored caches on external call
buginformation.description: When I'm using my mobile phone in offline modus and I open c:geo with an other app by clicking on the URL to a cache, it tries to reload the cache, instead of using the stored one. I imported a PQ to c:geo and Locus, cause I only have offline maps for czech rep in Locus. When I click on a cache in Locus, there is a link to the Cache on Geocaching.com, which I can catch with c:geo. But then I get the message, that the download went wrong. So, when catching the gc.com-url, maybe check, if the cache is already stored. PS: Is there a way to see cache-description in locus?

buginformation.summary: Use status.cgeo.org instead of the Heroku address
buginformation.description: Heroku now lets us use a SSL certificate for our custom domain (status.cgeo.org). We got one from StartSSL and installed it for API calls. In order to be able to migrate away from Heroku to a hosted server, we now need to replace API calls from https://cgeo-status.herokuapp.com to https://status.cgeo.org. After this, we can freely move status.cgeo.org to another host. Note that older installations using the Heroku address will be able to be redirected using the Free plan since they will not use our custom domain when talking to Heroku.

buginformation.summary: "Scan QR code" doesn't work anymore
buginformation.description: Using the menu "Scan QR code" from the main screen doesn't work right now. Seems like the SearchActivity can no longer handle coord.info URLs.

buginformation.description: Decrypt function (like clicking on a log) for waypoint notes would be very nice.

buginformation.summary: Handle missing calendar add-on
buginformation.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.

buginformation.summary: Crash at startup with Android 1.5
buginformation.description: I/cgeo ( 803): Starting cgeo.geocaching 20110916 a.k.a 16.09.2011...

buginformation.summary: Selection on Cache description does not provide "translation" menu
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open cache GC5ZZZZ Slide to description tab Long press to activate selection Contextual Popup menu appear Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The contextual menu display "copy/share/select all" Expected behaviour after performing these steps: The contextual menu should propose "Share / Translate to English / ... [-> "copy/share/select all"]" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.06 Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Allow user to clear all saved logs (field note export related)
buginformation.description: When a user goes through the new field now export feature in cgeo in order to upload her or his logs there is an important difference to the existing online log function. In the latter case, cgeo automatically clears a saved log after it has been commuted to gc.com. In the case of export there is no automatic clearing. In consequence, cgeo will reexport old log entries with the next export. While gc.com will sort old entries based on date, the export files will grow as will the internal database. I would like to suggest that the user can clear saved logs from the history or the stored lists. But maybe someone other has a better idea?

buginformation.summary: trackables can be stored multiple times in database
buginformation.description: Browsing our database I can see that one trackable is stored twice. I assume this might happen if it is searched from the search page AND stored as inventory of a cache.

buginformation.summary: Add Smilies when logging
buginformation.description: The gc.com logs are supporting various smilies with codes like [:)]; [:D] Full list on gc.com logpage "Insert Smilies". It would be a nice feature if c:geo would support these smilies as well via menu. This could be located in the menu of the logging-view "Insert"/"Smilies" / Scrollist of smilies. I dont know, if the icons used on gc.com are under some copyright, if not they could be used in that menu to visualize the smiley.

buginformation.summary: TB search broken
buginformation.description: With current NB when trying to look up a TB with secret code in search menu it immediately returns an error message. Searchung for public code seems to work.

buginformation.summary: Last zoom not remembered
buginformation.description: 2014.10.18-NB Open map Zoom in to e.g. 100m per unit Close live map Open live map again Zoom is reset to a higher value

buginformation.summary: Add filter "With personal data - with own waypoints"
buginformation.description: Please add personal filter "with own waypoints". Now there are "with personal note", "with modified coordinates" but no possibility to find the cache with additional custom waypoints

buginformation.summary: Target display lost when turning the phone
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: select a target cache the target cache name is displayed in the upper left turn the phone, lock and unlock it, open cache details from pop-up and return to map, ... Actual behavior after performing these steps: the target display vanishes (but the cache is still selected as target) Expected behavior after performing these steps: target cache name still displayed Version of c:geo used: developer version 20160509

buginformation.summary: Add geochecker link also for gc-apps.com
buginformation.description: Curently we provide a menu item "Open Geochecker" if the cache listing contains a checker link. Since some months there is a new officially allowed checker of www.gc-apps.com We should also scan for their links and make the menu item working for that. Example: GC3EQ4W

buginformation.summary: Attributes not update correct..
buginformation.description: ... if no one is the new state. I had a cache with NM Attribute after maintenance the attribute is gone and the cache have no attribute, but c:geo not merge it correct the NM is staying and will not go until I change the attributes and minimum one is there.

buginformation.summary: Manage lists button not working
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Disable the setting -> Offline-Data - Ask for list Open saved list Open cache details of a cache Click on "Manage" Actual behavior after performing these steps: If the cache is not on the standard list it will be moved to standard list. No list selection dialog is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The "Ask for list" setting should not have any influence on the "Manage" function but should always open the list selection dialog Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Error 500 on default.aspx
buginformation.description: Got form some log: 500 (1036 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/default.aspx Got it just after login.

buginformation.summary: Sort order lost if negative sorting is active
buginformation.description: When viewing my list of stored caches, if I select to sort by "Date stored on device" this works, and shows the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. If I then choose the menu option again to sort by "Date stored on device" the list is reversed, so that the most recently stored cache as as the top of the list (which I find more useful). However, if I then drop a cache from this list, the sort order is lost - specifically, the caches are sorted again with the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. Please allow my preference of having the most recently stored cache at the top of the list to be remembered.

buginformation.summary: field note export exports all (non GC) logs
buginformation.description: I just did a field note export after an offline OC log. That is uploaded to the GC website without further notice.

buginformation.summary: Multiple distance
buginformation.description: Hello first, sorry for my bad english and sorry too if my post is not an issue and if it's not in the good section. I don't know if i can write it here. I have a problem with distances with a smartphone zopo with android : all caches have several distances for the same point. I saw this in the FAQ : The distance to a cache is fluctuating heavily For some users the distance to a cache in a list of caches or in the compass is jumping between some meters to some kilometers. You are probably running Cyanogenmod ROM. This is a known bug in Cyanogenmod 10. More information can be found here: http://code.google.com/p/cyanogenmod/issues/detail?id=6883 So you either have to wait for a fix for this ROM or change to another ROM. The link doesn't work. i'm not using a cyanogen ROM. Do you now if there is an issue for this problem ? Thanks for your answer

buginformation.summary: Static maps not updated
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce Update final coordinates in gc.com website Open c:geo, go to the saved caches, go to the one you just modified Press update, and wait for it to finish Press Menu, Navigate, Static maps Expected result Static map of new coordinates Actual result Static map of old coordinates Notes I'm using nightly build from this morning. Also, I tired to delete the cache, and save it again, and then, when I tried to display static maps, I get a Toast message saying it can't find them. Then, I pressed the back button, to show the list of saved caches, and the cache I just downloaded wasn't there, so I guess there is also something broken.

buginformation.summary: Crash when host name is null
buginformation.description: From 2014.07.27 (store): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Host name may not be null

buginformation.summary: Filter out stored caches
buginformation.description: From support mail: I would appreciate having a possibility to filter out stored caches e.g. in search results. Usually I have several caches stored and use the search function to find new caches which are not already stored on my device.

buginformation.summary: Search result count wrong on load button
buginformation.description: Found with NB2012.10.31: Perform search for location (e.g. Cologne) Scroll down to the bottom, the load more button shows "Currently:20" Load more results and scroll down again The bar still shows "Currently:20" whereas the header correctly shows 40 From this time on the count is always 20 behindwhen loading more results

buginformation.summary: NPE when performing backup
buginformation.description: From GooglePlay with 2014.12.22: Device: AlcatelOneTouch 603 Android 4.1 User message: Attempting backup Stacktrace: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. Add `onError` handling.

buginformation.summary: Attributes on opencaching.pl
buginformation.description: From support mail (did not have time to verify this yet): I think there is some problem with cache attributes (considering opencaching.pl). Before August update I could see the attributes (not sure if all) in text form just below cache description. Now, in new version only few attributes are displayed as icons (changing into text after touching) below cache main details screen. Most of attributes are skipped. Why?

buginformation.summary: Search for owner returns caches without coords
buginformation.description: I am currently unsure if there is any limitation from server side in this scenario, but I do not remember that this happend before. 2014.12.17.-NB Premium member Search for caches owned by "sr510" The result contains active and archived caches, some contain coords (i.e. distance and direction arrow shown) but some not. Can not anaylze this problem in detail right now, as I am currently on vacation. Will probably provide more analysis later, however maybe someone here can reproduce the problem.

buginformation.summary: Crash in search
buginformation.description: With the current release candidate, on Facebook: I tried to searching out of the menu-bar the Cache "VDE 08/15“. When I pushed the Enter-Button IT says: "Leider wurde c.geo beendet". The Same Problem after a Restart. The cache was not stored on the device.

buginformation.summary: Load Favorite Points when importing GSAK gpx
buginformation.description: GSAK (Geocaching Swiss Army Knife) gpx export format supports Favorite Point counts. For big geocache lists this feature would be a very fast alternative to list refreshes. (I volunteer myself to develop this feature.)

buginformation.summary: NPE in live map without network
buginformation.description: When not connected, a NPE occurs when opening the live map in the searchByViewport code. The bitmap is not checked for null before its size is checked.

buginformation.summary: Default trackable-log type
buginformation.description: When you write a new log for a trackable, its initial type is "Found it".

buginformation.summary: History not working reliably
buginformation.description: This is more or less a reminder to myself (and others who would like to test): Some user reports for the current RC version (2016.11.28-RC) tell, that there are problems in the history: Offline logged caches not visible History cannot be emptied History is emptied but cache count in title bar still shows x caches on list I cannot reproduce any of them right now, but as we had a change in this area I think there might be some leftover bug under special conditions. I will try to gather more information from users and try to test some things myself. 👍 1

buginformation.summary: Have number of caches in dialogs
buginformation.description: When asking for deletion or moving of caches we should always display the number of affected caches in the confirmation dialog. That makes it more easy to be sure what will happen if filters are active and one chooses to "delete all".

buginformation.summary: Upload of Personal Note fails, but says it did
buginformation.description: If one tries to upload a personal note, despite not connected to the internet, one still get a success message "Personal note uploaded". reproducable: always occurs since: quite a while ago Device/Android: HTC One m7, Android 5.1 (Google Play Edition)

buginformation.summary: Search result filter
buginformation.description: I can't use filter to searched results it always return me to saved cache instead of search results. Steps to reproduce: Open c:geo Click search Type ex. Warszawa in address Display results Use filter Result: Filtered stored cache not searched cache --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.16-NB-bab02fe Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (Disabled by default: no) geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Basic Member System language: pl_PL Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

buginformation.summary: Direction line not shown
buginformation.description: Beta feedback on Play: Direction line to cache is no longer shown Will ask for more details.

buginformation.summary: Crashing when trying to add cache to watchlist
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: go to cache details press button "add to watchlist" Actual behaviour after performing these steps: C:geo restarts and return to home page Cache is not added to watchlist Expected behaviour after performing these steps: Cache should be added to watchlist Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Error when trying to authorize c:geo for Twitter
buginformation.description: Hello, I migrated to cgeo (old version) to cgeo opensource, and then, I'm not able to authorize c:geo to use twitter. I have following message: "Sorry, c:geo failed to initalize authorization process." c:geo version is 22.08.2011. twitter worked correctly on last version. Thanks. Regards,

buginformation.summary: Improve date-parsing
buginformation.description: Our current cgBase.parseDate()-method isn't good, I'll improve it. This will also fix some bugs with date-parsing.

buginformation.summary: NaN in import progress dialog
buginformation.description: At the Mega, someone had "NaN" in the progress dialog during import when we tried importing via blutooth. @mucek4 @Lineflyer @rsudev Anyone remembering details?

buginformation.summary: Add trackable brand to activity
buginformation.description: Right now it is impossible to tell if a trackable opened from search is either travel bug or geokrety or geolutin. As far as I can see the "type" line might distinguish coins (if travel bug connector), books (if geokrety) and similar, but it does not tell which company/website manages this trackable. As there are users which don't want to register at all sites, we should make it possible to recognize very easily to which site/brand this trackable belongs. @kumy maybe this is of interest for you, since you changed a lot around trackables?

buginformation.summary: High battery use with compass
buginformation.description: The compass seems to drain the battery faster than anything else in the app. Today I left the app running on compass with display switched off and an hour later my battery was nearly empty. It had not been completely full before. Looking at the power consumption graph on the device, I have never seen such a fast decrease of the battery power before.

buginformation.summary: Out of memory error with OSM and Google Maps
buginformation.description: Reproducable error with FC. I want to save some 100 or more caches offline in a row. I go to the Live Map and wait until caches are displayed. Then I choose "save for offline usage" from the menu. Some caches get downloaded but after a while an FC occurs and I find myself on the main page again. E/WindowManager(30324): Activity cgeo.geocaching.maps.mapsforge.MapsforgeMapActivity has leaked window com.android.inte

buginformation.summary: Locally changed coords replaced by listing coords on refresh
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a saved cache Create a waypoint, select to change coords locally to listing coords Refresh the cache Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The local change is lost and replaced again by the listing coords retrieved during refresh Expected behaviour after performing these steps: As the user defined change was done, it is not correct that this data is lost by refreshing. Not all users will understand this in beforehand and loss of data will appear. Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.23-RC Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Not relevant Other comments and remarks: Follow up of #5439 Comment by @blochi79: Now we have a follow problem. ;-( The local header coordinates are overwritten if the cache is refreshed. The method for refreshing a cache needs also to be adapted for the case that the local header coordinates have been corrected. Then the original coordinates in waypoints must be updated with the Listing coordinates instead of the header coordinates. [...] I often perform bulk refresh of mixed lists that contains also traditional caches. In this case I don't want to lose the corrected coordinates of letterbox or Wherigo caches. I did not know that it is the default behavior of c:geo to overwrite the local corrected coordinates with the listing coordinates. I think the current issue can be closed and the behavior of overwriting corrected coordinates while refreshing a cache may be discussed as subject of another issue. Sorry for the confusion.

buginformation.summary: Crash when the long-clicking on a value string
buginformation.description: With release 2014.04.01. java.lang.ClassCastException: android.text.SpannableString cannot be cast to java.lang.String

buginformation.summary: Parse PNG in Live Map for cache type
buginformation.description: The new interface to the Live Map does only deliver very little informations about a cache. In addition it is required to request the corresponding tile as a bitmap before ! This bitmap contains the information which cache type a cache is. If the bitmap would be "parsed" the cache type could be extracted.

buginformation.summary: NPE in rx code
buginformation.description: Sometimes I see exceptions occur in rx code. I believe this is the status fragment, but I'm not sure, as I did not yet catch the exception in the debugger... See ReactiveX/RxJava#1354

buginformation.summary: Support of Multi Window / Split Screen
buginformation.description: From support mail: It would be a useful feature if c:geo would be usable in Androids multi-window mode. This could enable running c:geo and e.g. google maps or other helpful apps in parallel. I have no idea what needs to be done to have c:geo available for multi-window...but I am sure someone will know.

buginformation.summary: Import GPX is cancelled by any touch
buginformation.description: With nightly 20120627 I experienced that a running GPX-import is also cancelled if I touch the screen at any position (not only "Cancel" button). I think this i not desireabl, in my case I touched the screen to keep it alive.

buginformation.summary: existing gcvote not shown during logging
buginformation.description: If a user has already voted, this is not shown when creating another log entry. The stars should be "pre-filled" then.

buginformation.summary: cache type "unknown"
buginformation.description: As discussed in 00a58e7, we need an additional cache type "unknown" including a set of icons for that type. Implementation of the code is easy, I need someone to create those icons.

buginformation.summary: Edit note doesn't open keyboard
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Also load short description in an AsyncTask
buginformation.description: Also the short description can contain html (with images). It should be loaded with an AsyncTask like the long description.

buginformation.summary: Long HTML text does not show
buginformation.description: If a cache has a really long description it's not parsed correctly. The example is GC2WKX2

buginformation.summary: Readability improvement for Cache Description
buginformation.description: For GC288FW the cache-description is in blue color. Nevertheless the readability improvement (change of background color) is not working here. For my opinion descriptions with this color should also be improved for readability by c:geo.

buginformation.summary: NPE in parseCache
buginformation.description: Probably after a timeout in the communication: E/cgeo (32388): Geocache.storeCache

buginformation.summary: Recommended app "Bluetooth GPS" not found
buginformation.description: A user made me aware of that: If you click on "Bluetooth GPS" in the list of recommended apps you will get an error from Playstore that his app is not existing. I never tried this, thus I do not know to what app this should refer at all.

buginformation.summary: Save for offline not possible on live map
buginformation.description: From FB for market version 30.10. and verified on my device: Open live map Wait until fully loaded Select "Save for offline" MEssage appears "Nothing to save" If you select "Show as list" the "Save for offline is working"

buginformation.summary: Allow a stored cache to belong to multiple lists
buginformation.description: I have a suggestion. My caches are organized in lists like To Do, Events, My Hides, etc. Every time I import a new GPX file that contains a cache that is in one of my other lists, it pulls that cache out of the list and places it into the Stored list along with the others from that GPX. Would it be possible to allow importing of a GPX without affecting other stored lists? Thanks much! :-D

buginformation.summary: cgeo should be able to read trackable URI from NFC
buginformation.description: I have written a URL for a trackable to an NFC tag but when I scan it I only get the option to open it in one of my two browsers. If I click the same link in for example an email I get the option to also open it in c:geo. As I understand this is because Android doesn't detect c:geo as capable of opening NFC url:s. I also tried writing the URL for a geocache to a NFC tag with the same result, I only get to chose one of my two browser for opening it when scanned. (I would be really neat to have this feature since the NFC tag in question is implanted in my hand and I want people to be able to log it easily with c:geo when scanning it) I found something related to this issue here: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/84173/how-to-set-default-browser-used-by-nfc

buginformation.summary: Got FC with latest build version
buginformation.description: Hi, With latest NB, I get FC after a couple of seconds after the launch of cgeo. Latest known working version was ver. 1205 Log here: http://pastebin.com/1mWkbj95

buginformation.summary: Twitter placeholder not working
buginformation.description: In the twitter message template you can include these placeholders: [DATE]

buginformation.summary: Support import of GGZ files
buginformation.description: From support mail: Some applications (like GSAK and Garmin tools) support a compressed GPX format named GGZ. While this officially is a propriertary solution for Garmin devices, it seems to be just a zipped GPX with a small folder structure inside (containing a XML file specific to Garmin(?) and a normal GPX). As it seems to be a valid ZIP archive, might it be possible to enable c:geo to import that on the same way as GPX (and zipped GPX). Advantage for the user: Have only one small file valid for his Garmin and c:geo (which is in fact the same device=Monterra). Example file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xbl6ma64f6dcpg2/test.ggz If you just remane that to *.zip you will be able to open it.

buginformation.summary: Properly cancel cancellable operations
buginformation.description: As written in #670, some operations using Progress are marked as cancellable but no handler is called when the user cancel (by going back) the current operation to really cancel the ongoing task. This should be fixed.

buginformation.summary: select "attended" by default, if event cache is expired
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: New map: Filter info missing
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have new map active as default Apply global type filter (e.g. Traditional only) Open live map Actual behavior after performing these steps: No filter info shown below the action bar Expected behavior after performing these steps: The notfication about an active filter should be shown directly below the action bar (compare to old map) Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System)

buginformation.summary: Log-offline-menu doesn't respect cache source
buginformation.description: Enable "Log offline" in settings Open an opencaching cache Press "Log" You'll see all log types that are available for geocaching.com caches. But opencaching has not all of these types. When you open the log form, only suitable types are shown.

buginformation.summary: After closing map-popup a reload is triggered
buginformation.description: In NB0403 I can see the following: Open live-map and wait till loading is finished (progress indicator gone) Click on a cache, the popup appears Use "back"-key to close the popup You will see (at least acc. to the progress indicator) that a reload is done As the map has not been moved a refresh/reload is unnecessary.

buginformation.summary: Link to manual in c:geo opens wrong website
buginformation.description: I appreciate, that the link to the nutshell manual is still included in "About c:geo". However if I click on the line "Benutzung: c:geo Kurzanleitung" it opens http://www.cgeo.org but it should open http://manual.cgeo.org. In the code (strings.xml) the href looks OK: Benutzung: c:geo Kurzanleitung

buginformation.summary: caches can not be watched if imported by GPX
buginformation.description: Watchlisting is not possible if a cache comes from GPX, because the internal ID is missing then. So it must be refreshed online before adding it to the watchlist.

buginformation.summary: When viewing found caches they are added to the history
buginformation.description: When I go geocaching I just save an offline log on the field and then logs online back at home using my computer. The found caches is now listed in the History List så I know in wich order they were found. But as soon as I view the cache page for a cache found for a time ago it is also added to the list. This messes up the current "found but not logged" count and I have missed a planned milestone cache because of this bahavior. I have two possible change suggestions: Only include caches in the list that was found since the History was cleared last time Add a section for each found date in the list. With a counter for each section. ie: Today [2] Cache name no 1 Cache name no 2 2012-01-03 [1] Cache name no 3

buginformation.summary: Support ignoring and watching caches
buginformation.description: It should be possible to watch or ignore OC cache listings with the same UI as for gc.com caches. API: http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/caches/mark.html

buginformation.summary: Export GPX - pass through gpsbabel - import GPX - fail
buginformation.description: I think the XML parser is a bit on the strict side: If I export a GPX run "gpsbabel -i gpx -o gpx -f export.gpx -F import.gpx" try to import the resulting file I get the famous XML parsing error. gpsbabel 1.5.0-3 (Debian Jessie)

buginformation.summary: Close keyboard when starting search
buginformation.description: Search a trackable from the action bar search. The keyboard is still visible while the progress dialog is shown. That looks not so nice.

buginformation.summary: No update of external graphic
buginformation.description: From support mail: When updating the cache GC3Q5WD the picture for the geochecker does not get updated. Test: Open cache details Remember geochecker graphic Click on geochecker and enter invalid coordinates Go back to cache details Update cache The graphic stays the same even if it changed on the website A manual update and deleting and storing again does not help Can we detect the change and redownload the graphic ?

buginformation.summary: Hints are no longer shown
buginformation.description: Current Market version has no hints.

buginformation.summary: Handle missing calendar provider
buginformation.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.

buginformation.summary: Own rating is also saved if placing the vote was not succesful
buginformation.description: 2015.01.08-RC1 Be sure your gcvote password is wrong in settings Open a saved found cache Select Menu - Vote Select a score (in case it already has an own vote, select a scrore different to the existing) and send it An error toast is shown about the wrong password but still the new own rating is saved to the cache

buginformation.summary: Can no longer select text on cache page.
buginformation.description: On my Nexus 7 running 4.1.2 I can no longer select text from the cache page for translation/copying. If I long-press on text in the cache page, nothing happens. However, if I long-press on the hint text, or on log entries, the two blue arrows appear and I can select that text as expected. Note that it works fine on my Xperia Z3 running 5.1.1 Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1 Use a Nexus 7 running 4.1.2 Step 2 Open a cache page Step 3 Long-press on some text on the cache page. Actual behaviour after performing these steps: Nothing. Expected behaviour after performing these steps: I expect to be able to select text for translation / copying. Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.03 Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: missing login should open GC specific preferences
buginformation.description: Due to my restructuring of settings, the "no login data stored" error message leads to opening the screen listing all services, not the preferences screen specific to GC.com. I think it might be useful to directly go into the GC.com settings instead. Other opinions?

buginformation.summary: Amount of favorite points not updated when awarding a favorite point in logging view
buginformation.description: 2015.10.31-NB: Open a cache Select "Log Visit" Post your log and select (the new) checkbox for "Add to your favorites" When returning to the cache details afterwards the state is not updated: The amount of favorite points for the cache is not incremented The button still shows "Add to your favorites" Expectation: If posting the log was OK, the information of the (stored) cache should be updated in cache details accordingly to avoid user confusion. @madankb

buginformation.summary: Not possible to add a picture to log on big screen devices
buginformation.description: Market version: 2014.02.04 On some devices (e.g. on my tablet Asus TF701 and a Galaxy Tab of a friend) c:geo reproducibly crashes when trying to attach an existing picture to a log: Open saved list Open cache Compose log Add picture, existing Select a picture c:geo crashes Log: 01:01:41.863 Error AndroidRuntime 11726 java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

buginformation.summary: Filter Mysteries when solved
buginformation.description: When I refresh a Cache which is solved then a new Waypoint with originally Coordinates is created. I would like to filter/sort by Mysteries which have this Waypoint and are solved.

buginformation.summary: Crash on GPX export
buginformation.description: A user on support mail reported that c:geo crashed when exporting his stored caches. I recevied the DB-backup and can reproduce the issue with 2015.01.25-NB. It crashes after approx. 250 caches and shows this log: 00:03:12.018 Error cgeo 25109 [AsyncTask #3] UncaughtException

buginformation.summary: Wrong location when on "Home coords"
buginformation.description: Concern 2015.01.12 Now I'm located 3000 km from my home ! My coordinates didn't change in geocaching.com so there is a bug for sure. More enoying is the fact that when opening cgeo the map shown is not the one on the screen when closing the app. Better to stay on 2014.12.22 at the moment ;-)

buginformation.summary: Live Map Store Offline not available
buginformation.description: Due to the same logic that causes #1757, often Store Offline in the Live Map is disabled when it should not be. The cause is the check app.hasUnsavedCaches(lastSearchResult) used when checking to disable or not. lastSearchResult could be empty with the new live map, but caches still shown on screen. The check should be made against caches in the viewport. I should be able to tackle this one as well.

buginformation.summary: Log can be sent but doesn't appear on geocaching.com
buginformation.description: I can send a "found"-log, but this log doesn't appear on geoacaching.com same problem for a friend on another device. Maybe groundspeak made a change on the API? (PS: on www.geocaching.com it works...)

buginformation.summary: Login OK even if password wrong
buginformation.description: Ok. I might get down to why so many users have login problems. Go to settings, click check login (Should say OK) Change your username (or password) that login must fail (e.g. Add 1 letter to user) Click Check login You get "Login OK" and wrong password stored in database. I don't have time to check.

buginformation.summary: `Missing` status for GK should be represented
buginformation.description: GK provide the information with the /export.php API (the script is announced as "slow and large volume of data") GKM /export-details.php provide the missing status in standard. We may render the status as: strikethrough the trackable name in the cache inventory list activity. Name could also be strikethrough on the Trackable detail activity

buginformation.summary: TB log type "Marked as missing" not parsed
buginformation.description: See TB29GGQ, logbook entry by user "holler2" from 04.11.2012. The log type is currently shown as "unknown error".

buginformation.summary: NPE with map menu (mapsforge 024)
buginformation.description: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Some caches not loading because of "Cache is Unpublished" text in description
buginformation.description: The following two caches will not load in c:geo GC430FM Cache is Unpublished GC431F2 Needle in a Haystack

buginformation.summary: Lost and Found cache type not parsed
buginformation.description: GC26232 is parsed as "unknown type". AFAIK all of these are archived. The filter is supporting them explicitly. So I think we should either leave it as it is or parse them as normal event caches (like it is done now for GS block party caches) and remove the filter item for "Lost and Found".

buginformation.summary: `SERVICE_INVALID` returned by Play services leads to crash
buginformation.description: From Play store from 2014.12.12 to 2015.01.12. java.lang.IllegalStateException: Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. Add `onError` handling.

buginformation.summary: Store the found-date when importing .gpx
buginformation.description: Right now, the found-date of a logged cache can only be entered manually, using offline-logging. Importing the found-date from .gpx would give the posibility to sort by found-date and see a history for already found caches.

buginformation.summary: Search result is not parsing "found" for owned found caches
buginformation.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: I have an owned caches which is also found by myself (I adopted it after finding it). The search for owner "Lineflyer" lists all my caches but the found one is not marked found in these results. This used to work before.

buginformation.summary: Map title should describe what is shown
buginformation.description: Currently there are several situations where the map title is something like "Map [10]". Instead it should be more descriptive like "GC12345" or "Caches around GC12345 [n]" or "Live Map [n]" or "Berlin [n]" (assuming that we just searched for "Berlin").

buginformation.summary: Error 400 and NPE to all OC-sites
buginformation.description: I get a HTML error 400 and following NPE for all OC-sites supported in c:geo although I have sucesfully authorizes to all of them: All errors look like this: 20:56:18.103 Debug cgeo 3273 GET http://www.opencaching.pl/okapi/services/caches/shortcuts/search_and_retrieve?langpref=de%7Cen&oauth_consumer_key=xxx&oauth_nonce=xxx&oauth_signature_method=HMAC-SHA1&oauth_timestamp=1407351383&oauth_token=xxx&oauth_version=1.0&retr_method=services%2Fcaches%2Fgeocaches&retr_params=%7B%22fields%22%3A+%22code%7Cname%7Clocation%7Ctype%7Cstatus%7Cdifficulty%7Cterrain%7Csize%7Csize2%7Cdate_hidden%7Ctrackables_count%7Cis_found%22%7D&search_method=services%2Fcaches%2Fsearch%2Fbbox&search_params=%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22search_method%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22services%2Fcaches%2Fsearch%2Fbbox%22%7D%5D&wrap=true&oauth_signature=xxx

buginformation.summary: Scale log image for upload
buginformation.description: We scale images on download to fit the display. Can we also scale images for upload to reduce mobile data?

buginformation.summary: Find count is 0
buginformation.description: After removal of challenges on geocaching.com the found cache count at the bottom of the main screen is 0 (at least for PM).

buginformation.summary: Enable live when entering live map
buginformation.description: In a recent commit the luve mode of the map was changed to remember the last setting or something similar. Now I see the following behaviour: Open live map (live is enabled) Close live map and go to lists open a cache and select navigate map Map opens with live mode disabled (which is ok for me) Go back to main screen and go to live map Live mode is now disabled This is a changed behaviou which might users think, that the live map is not working. I suggest to enable live by defaukt if the map is started from main screen. Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: Type filters on live map unreliable
buginformation.description: A user reported that setting the type filter to "Wherigo" shows many different caches on the live map which shouldn't be there. I tested it and made the following observations: Prerequisites: Enable global cache type filter "Wherigo" Choose live map strategy "fast" Do not have any caches in the database for the testing region (e.g. clear data before) Premium member? Observations: All caches are ?? although I zoomed in to "200 m" These ?? include: traditional, multi, unknown, etc. (all cache types?) But not all caches are shown, only a small subset (but with many types) Leave the live map and return to it (maybe unnecessary) Some Wherigo symbols appear. Open one of them and it will change its type to "Earthcache" (also other types?) If you need an area to test it, try Hanover in Germany.

buginformation.summary: WP coord input no longer placed on top of screen
buginformation.description: From facebook and I also see this change of behavior in the nightlies: Create a new WP Tap on coordinate field to open the coordinate input dialog The dialog will appear centered on screen instead of on the top of the screen, thus (depending on the device) overlapping with the keyboard which is now opened Change coord format (e.g. from DDD MM.MMM to DDD MM SS.SSS) Now the input dialog is correctly reinitialized on top of the screen. This was previously also done at first start of this dialog.

buginformation.summary: Problems in mapview switch
buginformation.description: when switching the map view some problems may occur: class cast exceptions WRT GeoPoint IntentReceiver leak when switching from Google to OSM Caches on live map not loaded after switch

buginformation.summary: "delete all and list" should not be enabled when filter is active
buginformation.description: With an active filter, the "delete all and list" action will move the non-visible (filtered) caches into the standard list.

buginformation.summary: Add special color marker in list of stored caches for solved caches
buginformation.description: From facebook: I have a feature suggestion. I like to solve Unknown/mistery caches but usually when solved I don't go there to log for long time (some times I even forget them forever). So I would love an option to filter the Stored caches to easily find the ones I solved, maybe by filtering the ones with custom placed waypoints as I usually store there the final coordinates. Maybe just having an option to custom mark them in the list, something like the orange bar placed beside the caches found but not yet logged or the green one for the solved. Maybe a Blue or Violet bar? I don't really know what's the best way but it will be a very usefull addition anyway :D

buginformation.summary: Keep screen on during GPX-import or "Store for Offline"
buginformation.description: There have been some issue about vanishing of progress dialogs while importing or downloading caches (like #292) Some occurrence of this is related to screen timeout. Just today I had to import some GPX-files and I have seen, that in this case the import is paused if the screen times out and only continued after activating again. For this the progress dialog does not vanish at least. Proposal: For me it would make sense to keep the screen on during these operations, as the user expects that the operation is finished without pausing and also may want to see the progress. Secondly this could avoid any "vanishing" problems of the progress window if there are any of them left.

buginformation.summary: Alignment of icons between live-map and lists/results
buginformation.description: As discussed in #1202 I had the idea to align the icon-overlays between live-map and list/results With "Final defined" it was started to align the cache-symbols/icons between live-map and lists/results. It would only be consistent if we do not use different means for displaying the same thing. In detail I would propose for the display of result-list or stored-list: Instead of having the string "Offline" the cache-icon could get the same disk-symbol on the upper right Instead of showing the "Green bar" for found the cache-icon could get the yellow smiley on the upper left Instead of showing the "Orange bar" for Offline-Log the cache-icon could get the orange smiley on the upper left For caches already stored (or on stored list) also the personal-note and final defined marker could be shown in search result What do you think ? I think it would make the usage and understanding of the symbols easier and more consistent throughout the app. On the other hand (like @Bananeweizen commented in #1202) the overlays make the cache-type icon hard to see and there is more space in the lists to put those markers somewhere else in the cache-row.

buginformation.summary: Disable optional action bar actions by default
buginformation.description: I just imported a cache from mail on my tablet in landscape mode. During the import 2 pencils were visible in the action bar, after the import one of them vanished. Conclusion: In all actions that take more than a tiny amount of time to initialize we should disable optional actions by default (instead of declaring them visible in the XML and then hiding them in the code).

buginformation.summary: Reliable crash when opening a certain cache
buginformation.description: Edit (Lineflyer): Changed topic to reflect the problem I get a crash each time I visit the details/description page of http://coord.info/GC1F2DC This stack trace is from master, but the version from the play store crashes at the same location - and even when just opening the cache. 09-19 06:29:32.132: ERROR/AndroidRuntime(15309): FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: Non-detailed saved caches show wrong saving date
buginformation.description: Not sure if this might be a duplicate...wan't there an issue about saving a non-detailed cache Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map, set strategy to "Fast" Select an orange circled (= non-detailed) cache From the popup select "Log Visit" and store the log offline Actual behavior after performing these steps: In the popup you can now read "Saved on the device 17174 days ago" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The correct saving date should be used Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.28 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
