buginformation.summary: zero caches on live map.
buginformation.description: I've tried everything! Even removed the app and reinstalled it. App worked great for the first two months, now my live map will only show stored caches. Plenty of ways around this, but it still sucks.

buginformation.summary: Feature-Request: Circles on the map only around physical stages
buginformation.description: May I wish for a new feature? Right now if I chose to display circles on the map, a circle is displayed around each and every feature (finals, waypoints, original coordinates). In a densely populated area the map can get rather crowded and it is hard to see which circle belongs to which object, making it difficult to find a free spot to place a new cache. It would be really cool, if the 161m-circles around caches would only be displayed around physical objects like finals (of traditionals and user-entered final coordinates of multis and mysteries) and stages of multicaches, because only with those physical stages the 161m-rule is important. You might add a new option to display circles around everything or only around physical stages.

buginformation.summary: Cache lists not updated after storing new caches
buginformation.description: New caches can be stored from many places (like search, search bar on top and so on). If you then go back to a (previously shown) standard cache list, it is not updated to show the new cache(s).

buginformation.summary: have explicit option for trail on map
buginformation.description: Currently the trail display on maps is always active and can only be disabled via options menu for that session. We should have a normal option for the trail display to not force users to disable it again and again.

buginformation.summary: wheryougo downloads wrong cartridge
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have Wheryougo installed open GC21X0F Select Navigation - Whereyougo Actual behavior after performing these steps: Whereyougo opens, logs in and offers to download a cartridge The downloaded cartridge is not matching to the cache but belongs to another cache (of the same owner?) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Should trigger download of correct cartridge Version of c:geo used: Current nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes for this cache System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System)

buginformation.summary: Refreshing without progress and ANR afterwards
buginformation.description: 2015.01.06-RC1 Open a list of saved caches (50 caches in my case) Select Menu - Refresh all Progress will get stuck at some point, no more messages in the debug log Abort the refresh Trying to open a saved cache afterwards => Stuck on loading cache-details and ANR short after Trying to start another refresh of the list => No progress and ANR short after As discussed on IRC this might be caused by a possible race condition introduced in cdf5c65

buginformation.summary: NB 2013.05.02 crashes at start
buginformation.description: Immediate crash after trying to launch c:geo: 05-02 10:24:53.384 E/AndroidRuntime( 3308): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.MainActivity}: android.support.v4.app.Fragment$InstantiationException: Unable to inject views for cgeo.geocaching.MainActivity@42ae98f0

buginformation.summary: Coords in anywhere menu lost
buginformation.description: Version 2013.08.26 -Enter coords and start navigation -Return to anywhere screen by ending navigation Result: -East coordinate is 0 -North coordinates is way off Expected: -previously entered coords should still be shown

buginformation.summary: Compass does not show direction initially
buginformation.description: Put the phone into a stable position (e.g. I have in my desk charger). Open the compass from a cache. It will point north and not change. Only if you move the phone or if you change the used sensors via menu, then the display is updated.

buginformation.summary: More extras to intent
buginformation.description: Add more extras (for now it is just 'latitude' and 'longitude') to intents like d/t, cachesize, waypoint name and gc-number for own extensions.

buginformation.summary: statics maps not stored with caches
buginformation.description: Hi, When I download the caches, it uses to download and store the statics maps at the same time. Now (02.04.2012 version), maps are not downloaded, I have to open every single cache, call for the statics maps, then they will be available for off-line consulting.

buginformation.summary: Mapsforge 0.6: Several themes not rendering
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: As written also in this comment for me the "New map" kept showing nothing. At the end I found out that some of my installed themes do not work. Have to take a deeper look but a quick test shows that only the predefined "Standard" seems to work. @rsudev Should user defined themes already be supported? Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.11-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Listing not available for GC2PYCW
buginformation.description: Listing of "Vzpominky stareho sklerotika" (http://coord.info/GC2PYCW) is not available in c:geo. The relevant section is missing in cache details.

buginformation.summary: Unsynchronized access to LeastRecentlyUsedSet instances
buginformation.description: It looks like as of commit gf5d5d78 we may modify the caches list in CGeoMap.java in an unsynchronized way (if we move the live map too fast for example, while it is loading). E/AndroidRuntime(21312): java.util.NoSuchElementException

buginformation.summary: Images from logs
buginformation.description: Logs can have images attached. Currently you can't view them with c:geo.

buginformation.summary: Geocache Hint data not exported to Locus
buginformation.description: Cache information can be exported from c:geo into the third party app Locus by either performing a "Navigate" in the "More details" screen of a cache, or in the "Stored" area by selecting "More", "Show on map" and selecting "Locus". In both cases the majority of cache data is transferred over to Locus. However, Hint information is not. To reproduce: Load up c:geo opensource (the version I am using is 08.11.2011) & go to Live Map Find & touch on a cache to bring up the Information dialog Make sure there is a valid hint Select More details -> Menu key-> Navigate -> Locus Locus (the version I am using is Locus Pro 1.5.2) Select the cache Go to the Info screen (second button from the left) Select Key icon (first button on left) You will always get the text "No hint" briefly displayed I have taken this up with menion, the Locus developer, and he has confirmed the problem is that the data is not sent from c:geo and not that Locus is not reading & displaying that information. The thread discussing this issue is here: http://forum.asamm.cz/viewtopic.php?f=10&t=1439

buginformation.summary: NPE in DirChooser on restricted dirs
buginformation.description: User message: Stopped while trying to set gpx folder to external card Version: 2013.04.03 Trace: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: [User] template does always use the GC username
buginformation.description: Later

buginformation.summary: Export / Import GPX
buginformation.description: when i export gpxfile of cache with waypoint and notice and i import this gpxfile on a different device ist this new Cache object in the new device corupt. Many notices are different or lost.

buginformation.summary: Nightly Build: unable to install for days
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: downloaded the nightly build apks for at least 5 days now tried to install these builds installation did not work, I get "App wurde nicht installiert", that's it, no further information visible Version of c:geo used: The current nightly builds, tried for at least 5 days Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Other comments and remarks: all other apps, doesn't matter if from Play Store, F-Droid or manual install with the apk work on my device

buginformation.summary: A few improvements to logging caches
buginformation.description: These should maybe be added as separate issues, but I guess they are small and easy, so they can probably be tracked here. a) Logs should be auto-saved (but ofcourse not posted to gc.com) when pressing "back". One time too many I have written a long log, and accidentally pressed "back" and had to write it all over again. Maybe add a "clear"-button (with prompt) to clear the log field if anyone ever wants to delete everything they have written without having to long press -> select all -> delete. b) Signature should be placed below cursor position. Currently the cursor is placed at the bottom, below the signature, when i start logging which is usually not what at least I expect. c) Logs on cache page does not show all (unicode) characters. I guess this has to do with either the font used, or Android per se, so it might not be an easy fix. You can add a number of unicode-chars to your logs by using the html entities (IE ✐). They show up fine on the web (gc.com), but not on the phone, where they are simply displayed as squares. It would be great if the font used in the app was able to show more of these characters.

buginformation.summary: Somehting is strange with oc autorization
buginformation.description: With 2014.04.13-NB I can see a new settings menu for opencaching services. However If I e.g. active the opencaching.us service I do not see any menu to authenticate to that site. Returning to the main menu I see "Not autorized" on the main page.

buginformation.summary: Error reading pocket query list
buginformation.description: Since this evening i get an error when I try to retrieve a pocket query. Im on 2016.02.23-NB. Am I the only one? Is it gc related, or has it something to do with cgeo?

buginformation.summary: create static maps when importing gpx
buginformation.description: Caches being imported from gpx have no static maps. If you are traveling to somewhere without data roaming, the static maps would be quite helpful with imported caches. I just have that situation. :)

buginformation.summary: Waypoints of multicaches are not longer shown in cache detail->navigate->show on map
buginformation.description: It depends on caches livemap threshold in settings (before this option was present all wpts of multis were showed)

buginformation.summary: Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache
buginformation.description: I was just using cgeo with logcat enabled, and noticed this warning: W/Database( 1101): Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache for database /data/data/cgeo.geocaching/databases/data; i.e., NO space for this sql statement in cache: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude_string, longitude_string, latitude, longitude, note FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = "GC1M3C8" LIMIT 100. Please change your sql statements to use '?' for bindargs, instead of using actual values Probably nothing serious, but I guess using parametrized queries is considered good practice wit databases. See paremeter selectionArgs in query() doc.

buginformation.summary: Concurrent modification exception in dirtyCaches
buginformation.description: From release 2015.11.29, Google play: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: Search results returns mystery caches as ??
buginformation.description: This is a regression bug also happening with current market release. Probably a change on gc.com?! Search nearby caches or perform any other search Mytery returns as ??-type and will only be corrected once you open the cache details

buginformation.summary: Out of memory error while loading caches
buginformation.description: With release 2014.04.01: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

buginformation.summary: Avatar not shown on gc.com login
buginformation.description: Maybe a site change 2014.07.01-NB

buginformation.summary: Have a link to "related webpage" in cache details
buginformation.description: From support mail: GC.com allows naming a related webpage. Sometimes this is used to refer to important cache information or even necessary for solving a mystery. Example: GC3BCT0 Unfortunately the link to the related webpage is not visible in c:geo. It could be added in the hint section like the spoiler-image link.

buginformation.summary: Send2cgeo times out although caches are imported
buginformation.description: From support mail and was also told to me by @SammysHP or @marco-dev : The timer for "Import from web" seems not to be resetted if caches are incoming but times out as if no caches have been received.

buginformation.summary: if static map can't be opened, ask for creating it
buginformation.description: If cgeo can't open the static map, it should not only display this as a toast, but instead ask whether to create the static map now.

buginformation.summary: Can't open owner details of cache when different name is used
buginformation.description: As a cache owner it is possible to let a cache have another visible owner name than the real user name. Cgeo cannot currently open details for the cache owner in this case. Look at my cache GC15593 for an example. Clicking on the user name will open a menu, but it is not displaying the real user name. When I wrote this feature for about a year ago I introduced "ownerReal" in cgCache. This variable was given value from the link "other caches hidden" below the cache description.

buginformation.summary: Copy gc code
buginformation.description: Have some simple possibility to copy the geo code if a cache, maybe from the context menu of the cache details.

buginformation.summary: Crash when opening logbook of certain cache
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC1YX6F Swipe to logbook Actual behavior after performing these steps: Crash Expected behavior after performing these steps: Normal operation Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.09-RC / 2016.12.13-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? No Happend for a user on FB. I can reproduce it on 1 out of 5 devices, sadly only on the one which offers no logging. Can someone reproduce and provide a log?

buginformation.summary: Static Maps download failed for caches not offline
buginformation.description: Set to not automatically store static maps, Choose a cache from map that is not stored for offline. Go to details. Choose maps/store static maps. You get a toast "No static map found". It works fine with caches store for offline usage.

buginformation.summary: Non-detailed caches incorrectly counted for amount of stored caches
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Remember the amount of saved caches on your lists as shown on the mainscreen as X Open live map Click on a non-detailed cache (with orange circle) From the popup select Log Visist Enter log text and press back to save the log Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache icon has now markers for offline logged and saved(?) Saved caches amount on main screen is now x+1 Cache is not visible in lists Cache is visible in history Opening this cache in history will show the non-detailed status: Empty description, Empty logbook Cache details screen shows "Saved on device 11746 days ago" Expected behavior after performing these steps: I don't know enough about the DB structure to judge the best way of fixing this. However from a user perspective: It should show up in the history (as it does) It should not count to the amount of total caches stored in lists as it is not part of any list contained there It should not show up with saved icon on map Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.10-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: This seems to be not caused by the change of @pstorch (ded3fb7) as the behaviour is the same with this fix (fresh RC) and without this fix (current nightly).

buginformation.summary: Nearby list is not working
buginformation.description: Sometimes it loads very long (user from facebook) and on my device: Galaxy S (Android 2.3.4) it's not loading. Just black display.

buginformation.summary: Request to gc.com tile server sent for caches from unknown sources (e.g. lab caches)
buginformation.description: 2015.05.26-NB: Import lab caches from Main GIGA to a new list Open list and select Map icon to show a list Click on one of the lab caches Result: In fact we send a request to the GC.com tile server for it which should not happen because a) The cache is saved and has never been loaded from the server b) It is not even a valid GC-cache c) Live mode is not enabled on a map of stored caches If the stored caches are not lab caches but normal GC-caches I do not see any request. Log: 18:06:36.364 Debug cgeo 16964 [Thread-24861] GET http://tiles.geocaching.com/map.details?i=ALTES+RATHAUS+%28STELE%29-MAINZ+GUTENBERG+2015+-+DAS+IST+GIGA&_=1432656427925&app=cgeo

buginformation.summary: Map is live on next opening although previously live mode was disabled
buginformation.description: From FB: Bugs in NB-76ddb14 On each start of the map "Enable live" is active, independent whether I switched it off before. I will test this later, as I am currently on the RC version and this is fine.

buginformation.summary: LOC Parser stores owner name in wrong variable
buginformation.description: LocParser stores the owner name into ownerDisplayName instead of ownerUserId However, .loc files from gc.com have the real owner name, not the special display name. An example is GCW0KM. Viewing website, the owner shows as 2006 Team CITO, but the .loc file has sillygirl & jrr. The latter is the UserId not DisplayName, therefore it should be stored as such.

buginformation.summary: Support personal note sync
buginformation.description: After implementation of #409 with PR #1741 it is now possible to create/edit the personal note. However synchronization is not yet supported but this should be implemented on short term if possible as the current behavior is not user-friendly. Currently: Notes from gc.com are shown and can be edited A new note can be created On updating the cache details a personal note created in the app is deleted (if empty on website) or overwritten by the personal note from gc.com Desired behaviour (to be discussed): If the personal note on gc.com is empty and local note is existing this note should be uploaded to gc.com. This could be done instantly when creating or (IMHO better) if the cache is updated If personal notes are existing locally and remote there needs to be an alignment in some way (e.g. take the longer one, ask the user, etc.)

buginformation.summary: Context is not an instance of MapActivity
buginformation.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.GoogleMapActivity}: android.view.InflateException: Binary XML file line #39: Error inflating class

buginformation.summary: Got FC with latest build version
buginformation.description: Hi, Again, I got FC with build version. Latest working version is from 0407. First noticed the bug with 0411, and again with 0414. Don't know for versions in between. From a list of stored caches, I select a cache, then when I select an action, I got the FC. You can find the log here: http://pastebin.com/0CTCNv12 I tried to display the map from the list, and got a strange behaviour with many "caches" shown with red point, although they were not corresponding to caches stored on the device. Then I tried again to select a cache and display the map and got FC. That second log is here: http://pastebin.com/pCnkpZvC Regards

buginformation.summary: Log counts not updated
buginformation.description: Gc5w7ag. We have just refreshed this cache on 3 devices. Only on one of them the log counts at the to of the log book were correctly updated.

buginformation.summary: Log password box missing when changing logtype
buginformation.description: If I open a new log window on an oc cache, that requires a log password and it opens as 'note' (because I already found the cache), the box for entering the log password isn't made visible when I change the log type to found. Consequently sending the log will fail. If I close and re-open the (stored) log, the password box is visible correctly.

buginformation.summary: Change log / What's new popup on start
buginformation.description: We could use my project's code: http://code.google.com/p/android-change-log/

buginformation.summary: cache attributes have bad text alignment
buginformation.description: The labels and values of the attributes in the cache details view are aligned at the top. They should be based aligned.

buginformation.summary: OSM:Offline: After selecting new map it is opend at map center but not at the previous location
buginformation.description: Open details of a cache Select Navigate -> Map Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but the cache you want to view is in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so the cache is no longer in view or Open live map Your current position is shown by the marker Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but you are in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so your position is no longer in view After selection of a new map the view should be initialized at your position (live map) respectively the cache coords (cache map)

buginformation.summary: NPE when looking at nearby caches
buginformation.description: Version b489b69 does not work for me, it crashes when querying nearby caches: E/AndroidRuntime( 8495): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-20

buginformation.description: With 2013.06.11-NB-a0284d6: The TB detail page is either empty or black on black.

buginformation.summary: Menu items missing in popup
buginformation.description: Current NB: The menu item Log visit (and others?) Are missing in the overflow menu of the cache popup on map.

buginformation.summary: GPX file name in Import progress dialog
buginformation.description: This is a feature request. Detailed steps causing the problem: import a GPX file there was too little or no feedback when user clicked on GPX file, before import started. User does not know for certain if he/she clicked on the correct file or not. the import progress dialog is shown. This dialog shows a predefined message only. The user does not know which GPX file is currently importing. Expected behavior after performing these steps: the import progress dialog to show the filename of the GPX file being currently imported. Version of c:geo used: 2016-05-09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Direction to cache still displayed in lists although deselected
buginformation.description: The directional arrows are still there, even the option is deselected. There is another option regarding directional arrows for basic members in the "services" - "geocaching.com" section. I deselected this one, too (Why are there two of them?) Still the arrows are there.

buginformation.summary: Refresh captcha boutton doen't refresh...
buginformation.description: Login as Basic member Enable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Tap the refresh icon. Would expect a new captcha to be shown...

buginformation.description: Long tap a log entry to invoke contextual action bar. That already leads to the long text translation warning toast.

buginformation.summary: Freeze in cache details without network
buginformation.description: Enable debug mode Start c:geo and wait for login completion Disable all network connections Open live map Open a saved cache from map Result: App freezes 2016.04.29-NB Edit: Updated steps

buginformation.summary: Search by keyword not working
buginformation.description: At 674e22e + missing break, the search by keyword doesn't work. It doesn't launch a search, and jumps to my stored caches list.

buginformation.summary: Radar named Navigate in Live map cache-menu
buginformation.description: Whats named "Radar" in Cache-Menu is now named "Navigate" in the cache-menu on the live map. So there are two buttons with "navigate". (open live map, select a cache, press menu button then)

buginformation.summary: Add mapsforge copyright notice to 'about'
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: TB: Last activity wrong in case last activity is today
buginformation.description: On the TB-page (yesterday) is displayed although the last relevant log-entry is from the same day Example (at least for today): TB3NY19 I logged it as retrieved today but the header says Lineflyer (yesterday)

buginformation.summary: Log image not added locally
buginformation.description: Yesterday I uploaded a log image. The log entry was added to the logs but the image was not added to the image list.

buginformation.summary: 2014.08.07-NB-f3d487e crashes on app start
buginformation.description: After upgrading to above NB, app crashes upon start („"c:geo" wurde beendet“). Clicking a GC.com link and using c:geo action as handler for that still brings up the cache fine, so it must be an issue with the app main screen? HTC One M7, Android 4.4.2

buginformation.summary: GCVote not loaded for search results
buginformation.description: With 2013.08.22-NB1 the gcvote ratings are not loaded in search results. The box stays grey for all caches. (BM and PM affected). Setting is on, password is stored (should not be relevant at this point). Gcvote loading for cache details works normal.

buginformation.summary: Geocode search is case sensitive
buginformation.description: I remember that this issue was solved in the past but come up again on market version 2014.02.04: Save s geocache for offline use Use the search function and search its geocode in "upper case" Result: Cache is opened immediately Use the search function and search its geocode in "lower case" Result: Cache is requested online

buginformation.summary: ANR when loading direction images in cache list
buginformation.description: The call to get the direction image (in cache lists for BM) is blocking the ui. This may lead to ANR on slow network/server. "main" prio=5 tid=1 WAIT

buginformation.summary: Creating new list inconsistency
buginformation.description: If you create new list by: Click list name on top Select create new type name press OK you get yourself on that newly created list If you create list by: press menu Select List Choose Create new list type name press OK you stay on old list.

buginformation.summary: GPS Cache Exhibit type not parsed
buginformation.description: GC2MYM0 appears as "unknown type". I know...there are not many. But as c:geo is able to filter them we should either parse them correctly or cut down on the filters.

buginformation.summary: GPX import not executed when started from mail in
buginformation.description: 2014.05.07-NB Received a GPX file (exported from cgeo) via mail Opened the file in my mail program Selected c:geo as target app c:geo opens and asks for a list to store the caches After selecting the list nothing happens (only the list is shown) Manually importing the file (via Manage -> Import GPX) works without a problem. I am not sure whether this used to work before with my mail client, therefore setting "Unverified". But IMO it should work if c:geo can be selected when opening the file, or not?

buginformation.summary: ANR in CacheListActivity
buginformation.description: I just had an ANR in CacheListActivity. I opened a pocket query ZIP file from the launcher and selected c:geo. The app opened, but nothing happened afterwards. This is in a location, where I normally only get a GPS fix after quite some time. I run a one or two days old build with enabled Play service location provider. My feeling is this could be a "block until GPS is ready" issue again.

buginformation.summary: NullP when scrooling offline OSM maps

buginformation.summary: Crash when trying to load more caches with filter applied to stored cache list
buginformation.description: Steps: Store some caches offline Filter the stored list, such as to just show multi-caches. Note that the bottom says "No more caches". Click on one of the caches to view it Go back to the filtered list of stored caches. Note that the bottom now says "Load more caches: currently: XX" Click to load more caches Crash There are no more caches to load because I am looking at stored caches. The problem is in the calls to setMoreCaches in cgeocaches.java. It only compares the current list of caches against the search results. It doesn't account for any filters.

buginformation.summary: GeopointParser produces incorrect results
buginformation.description: In some cases the parser produces incorrect results when parsing a coordinate string like "N 49° 56.031", something the formatter happily and correctly produces given the correct input 49 + 56.031*60 = 49.93385. I have created a test case for it, but as it has to do with regex I suppose somebody else will be able to fix it faster then me.

buginformation.summary: WhereYouGo not listed in Navigtion for a specific cache

buginformation.summary: Crashes when opening cache description with image from dropbox

Actual behaviour after performing these steps: After a second the app crashes and sends you back to the start page. It just happens with some caches, not all. One common thing with the ones that causes the crash seems to be that they all have linked images from dropbox in the description using the short url format https://db.tt/U7YqJqwN.Don't know if it is a coincident or not. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.05 NB The bug has been present in the NB:s for maybe a week by now. Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes

buginformation.summary: Translate encoded hint does not work
buginformation.description: When invoking the translation menu on an encoded hint the result is just garbage. We should make the cache details creator set explicit ids for each line (which must be defined in ids.XML) instead of using id.value everywhere. When we have explicit ids for each line then we can easily take the necessary string from the cache member fields instead of reading it from the text controls.

In the GPS Garmin Etrex 10 the difficulty and terrain levels appear as in the image attached (GPX from CGeo.jpg), and there are no smileys in the logs. I modified the GPX file with a text editor and then they appear normally. (see attachement GPX modified manually.jpg) In the GPX files generated by Geocaching.com's Pocket Queries the markups groundspeak:difficulty and groundspeak:terrain are like this : 1

buginformation.summary: Radar opened twice from waypoint tab
buginformation.description: 2013.10.30-NB Steps: Set preferred navigation method to "Radar" (GPS Status & Toolbox used) Go to the waypoint tab of a cache Pres the compass rose button to invoke the preferred navigation Exit from Radar Result: You have to exit twice to come back to c:geo, it seems the radar gets called twice I did not do any changed to the radar app. I am quite sure that the behavior started some days ago with a new nightly. Remark: Invoking the Radar via waypoint menu (not using the compass icon) or for the cache itself (using the compass icon) the behavior is normal. Also if I use an internal navigation method (compass, map) there is no problem.

buginformation.summary: History list item removal doesn't update progress or list

buginformation.summary: Export: State and country fields both contain both values
buginformation.description: Both values are concatenated and exported in both fields, so after importing again, you see "BaWü, Germany, BaWü, Germany". We could either have 2 fields state and country in the database (instead of 1 field "location") or just leave the "state" field empty on exporting GPX.

buginformation.summary: [Feature request] Importing garmin-like spoiler images
buginformation.description: Garmin devices have the option of downloading spoiler images. http://garminoregon6xx.wikispaces.com/Geocaching+With+Photos These images can be batch fetched with tools like GSAK, or manually added/downloaded from coordinate checkers. They are stored as: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\Spoilers\ Example: Images for geocache OXZTXGC would be placed as shown: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\Spoilers\ c:geo should be able to import or display these spoiler images (eg. option to select directory), so that an user can manually add addition spoiler images to the cache page which are not included on the webpage.

buginformation.summary: move to other list doesn't work
buginformation.description: if the internal list id is larger than 100, because this has been implemented as a context menu with menu ids. This pattern needs to be replaced with an AlertBuilder instead (probably also at other places in the app).

buginformation.summary: One-click offline log does not save cache

(sorry, hard to describe). So finally if you continuosly scroll up and down you get more and more of the same photo link on the log entries.

This is confusing most of the users (including myself). Steps to reproduce : import any gpx file via Stored / Import GPX (e.g. 93 caches are added in the "Stored" caches list) Select Manage/Drop All to remove all caches out of the list (deletion proceeds) .... after deletion: The list of caches (in my case 93) can still be seen in the "Stored" caches list [BUG] For my understandig the list of caches shall be empty after a "delete all caches" command. Robert

buginformation.summary: Support for secondary users in multi-users mode
buginformation.description: We do not support multi-user mode (tablets running Android 4.2+), because in multi-user mode each user gets their own directories (accessible through Context.getFilesDir() or Context.getExternalFilesDir()) while we build the paths using Environment.getDataDirectory() and Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory(). The path we use corresponds to the primary user (for example /data/data/cgeo.geocaching), which is unaccessible by other users. The right path to use for some other user might look like data/user/10/cgeo.geocaching and will be obtained through the proper API calls. If this issue is a duplicate of an existing issue, please mark the other one as a duplicate and keep this one as a reference on the problem.

buginformation.summary: Caches not marked as owned when importing GPX
buginformation.description: When caches are imported via GPX, they are not marked as being owned by current user. Initial discussion can be found in #2304. Options as presented by Bananeweizen: A) Move the call to setOwn() from GCParser, line 377 into the cgCache.setOwnerUserId method. Then >the flag would automatically be set when the user id of the cache is set, independent of how the cache >was created (GC parsing, GPX...). That's an improvement as the flag and the user id are then always in >sync during parsing. B) Remove the own flag completely. Instead make cgCache.own a calculated property, for which the >cache asks its connector. The flag and the user name are then always in sync, independent of >changing the user name in the app. Option B sounds best to me.

In my opinion "Archived" should not be returned in any case, and "Disabled" should only be displayed if the mentioned setting is not active.

buginformation.summary: Own coordinates not retrievable for Gk visit log
buginformation.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Enter GKC240 in the search field on main screen Start logging the GK Select "Visit" Click on the coordinate field Click on "My coordinates" in the coordinate window Error toast: "c:geo could not retrieve the current location" although GPS is active and fixed.

buginformation.summary: Add picture to log failed on KitKat
buginformation.description: I tried to add a picture to a log. But I get a failure toast message, just after coming back from pictures selection. I use a Nexus4 + SlimKat 4.4 LogCat displays a "Image does not exist".

buginformation.summary: No activity found to handle intent
buginformation.description: With 2014.08.27, from Play Store: android.content.ActivityNotFoundException: No Activity found to handle Intent { act=android.intent.action.VIEW dat=http://www.geocaching.com }

buginformation.summary: NullPointerException when returning to app
buginformation.description: I was returning to cgeo from another activity (using long-press home, and it crashed): E/AndroidRuntime(19945): FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: Log entry of trackable shown as "today"
buginformation.description: After logging a trackable taken 3 days ago the log is shown on top with "today". Going back to search and again enter trackable log list the entry is correct. So just a problem how we add it to the list.

buginformation.summary: Send installer package name to status manager
buginformation.description: Right now, the status manager displays warning that a new release or release candidate is available and links to the Google Play Store regardless of how the user installed the application. We can retrieve the name of the application that installed the current application from the package manager. This should be sent along with the version code and the version name to the status manager at status.cgeo.org so that appropriate update URIs can be returned eventually.

buginformation.summary: Amount of favpoints no longer shown for own caches
buginformation.description: Starting with 2014.12.17-NB the line showing the amount of favorite points is empty in cache details of owned caches. In list view the amount of favpoints is shown normally.

buginformation.summary: Automate Visiting All Trackables in Inventory
buginformation.description: ...even if it has to be parsed or made inactive if the user has more that 25 trackables (if that's a cg.com issue).

buginformation.summary: Search nearby caches, back -> closes current cache
buginformation.description: open a cache list open cache details from there search for nearby caches press back button -> you are in the cache list instead of the cache details

buginformation.summary: Socket timeout is too long (90 seconds)
buginformation.description: While working on another issue yesterday, I noticed that one cache read from geocaching.com ended only after a 90 seconds timeout. This is too long, the read timeout should be similar to the connect timeout (30 seconds).

buginformation.summary: Wrong sized overlay icons on map
buginformation.description: Some people already told me, that the icons overlays (pencil, disk, etc.) look blurred and/or are too large. On my SGS II with Android 2.3 everything looks fine, however today I had the chance to have a look on a Galaxy Nexus S running on ICS and there is a problem indeed. (Market version 02.04.12) This is how it looks like on the Galaxy Nexus S (bad quality pic because I took a photo of the screen): This is how it looks on my SGS II:

buginformation.summary: Refresh caches + no internet = normal progress
buginformation.description: From mail: disable all internet connections open a list, click menu, refresh (or do it with a single cache?) the progress dialog appears, no warning, that there's no internet

buginformation.summary: Another strange GPX file does not get imported
buginformation.description: Someone on FB is complaining that strange GPX file is not beeing imported. It's on www.cgeo.org/dev/

buginformation.summary: Nearby search no longer contains directional images
buginformation.description: It's pure text now.

buginformation.summary: NullP when starting c:geo (nightly) with no network
buginformation.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at java.util.regex.Matcher.reset(Matcher.java:181) at java.util.regex.Matcher.(Matcher.java:94) at java.util.regex.Pattern.matcher(Pattern.java:290) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.getViewstates(cgBase.java:358) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.login(cgBase.java:450) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeo$firstLogin.run(cgeo.java:727)

buginformation.summary: OC waypoints imported multiple times
buginformation.description: Load OCDDD2 repeatedly. Each time 2 more waypoints will be shown.

buginformation.summary: Location is no longer updated
buginformation.description: After #1556 fix, the location is no longer updated.

buginformation.summary: Popup delete button don't work

buginformation.summary: Live map - key format changed
buginformation.description: As of today evening the live map parsing failed completely for me. The key format was changed from 'x_y' to (apparently) '(x,y)' Can someone verify this?

buginformation.summary: No "caches nearby" after restart
buginformation.description: Use power safe mode in our settings. Restart device. Open the app. The nearby button remains disabled as the GPS does not get activated in the main activity.

buginformation.summary: Support Google Bike Navigation
buginformation.description: From support mail: Hello c:geo-team, is it possible that you can integrate Google Maps Bike Navigation in the app like navigation (driving) or navigation (go).

buginformation.summary: Support keyword for virtual cache logging
buginformation.description: There seem to be some caches (virtual) which require a passkey/keyword in order to place found logs. Example: OCB68A In c:geo I can compose a found log (I did not send it because I did not really visit it), on the website I need the passkey to post a found log. I don't know whether the API supports this and I don't know whether I can post a found log via c:geo even without entering the password.

buginformation.summary: Offline log marker not shown after log autosave
buginformation.description: Found in NB 2013.02.27: Go to the list of saved caches Select an unfound cache and start logging Write a log and leave the logging page (not saving manually so autosave is applied) Returning to the cache details it shows "Saved log" Returning to the list the oranger marker line is not shown. It is only shown after leaving/reentering the list In case this procedure is done with explicitly saving the log the orange marker is OK, so this does only happen for the "auto save" procedure.

buginformation.summary: CI won't build cgeo
buginformation.description: See http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo/2495/console: 10:19:40 BUILD FAILED

buginformation.summary: "Make list unique" menu makes cgeo crash in nearest cache list
buginformation.description: Hello Cgeo team !! Detailed steps causing the problem: Launch the app Click on "Nearest cache list" Click on menu (top right) Click on "Make list unique" Actual behavior after performing these steps: CGeo crashes Expected behavior after performing these steps: CGeo doesn't crash Version of c:geo used: Master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, systematic System information: Device: SDK build for x86 Android version 6.0 Android build: sdk_google_phone_x86-userdebug 6.0 MASTER 3287151 test-keys Cgeo version: 2016.10.08-14bbb90 developer build ... Other comments and remarks: No Many thanks in advance ! Morice

buginformation.summary: "stored" is no longer 1st
buginformation.description: Report from facebook: In the Pick a List menu 'Stored' no longer defaults to the top of the menu...it is alphabetized along with all the other lists.

buginformation.summary: Coordinate dialog broken in landscape mode
buginformation.description: 2015.10.31-NB on my tablet Samsung SM-P600 as well as on my Samsung Galaxy S4: In landscape mode the new input dialog is missing the OK/Cancel and the buttons "Cache Coordinates" and "My Coordinates". Switching to portrait mode it looks ok.

buginformation.summary: Drop found
buginformation.description: There are two options I would like to see. The first one is to "drop found" so I only need to store the unfound caches and do not need to go through lists of found caches when I first go out in the morning. The other option is to allow this as a filter.

buginformation.summary: Waypoint editing broken
buginformation.description: I tried to change a waypoint, now it ist GONE! All the comments are deleted and the name is overwitten by "waypoint 1". This was a Multicahce with 4 Waypoints and Point 3 is overwritten (I only tried to put in some coords...) I tried to create a new waypoint and tried to give it the coordinates: N49 11,929 E008 09,357 but it ALWAYS changes this to N49 11,933 E008 09,350 ? This is with the new version from 15.09.2011 I really would like to change back to the C:GEO Version from 26.08.2011 :( Edit: typos

buginformation.summary: Deleting an offline stored cache during relocation
buginformation.description: If I open the stored caches, the app tries to get the new location and resorts the listitems according to that. But this takes some seconds. If I have choosen an item before this is finished and choose "delete" for a cache it can end in a wrong deleted cache, because the order changed during this process. Although the Dialog shows the right cache title for what the operation should be done. It happened some times and i don't know what cache the app removed instead.

buginformation.summary: TB can not be opened from log view
buginformation.description: If I open the logging page for a cache my inventory is listed below. Trying to click on the listed TBs I always get the message "c:geo kann den gewünschten Trackable ncht anzeigen. Ist es wirklich einer ?". I am sure this worked approx. two weeks ago. Maybe a problem after gc.com site update or some change in the app. NB2013.02.24

buginformation.summary: "On Watchlist" not parsed
buginformation.description: With the current release version the watchlist status seems not to be parsed from the website: Put a cache on your watchlist via gc.com Download the cache to your device in c:geo Result: It is shown as "not on the watchlist". Adding to watchlist within c:geo seems to work but also in this case the status change is not correctly shown (This is issue #1926).

buginformation.summary: New fused provider breaks BT-GPS
buginformation.description: Previously it was possible to have location switched off and use BT-GPS and an external GPS receiver via the mock location provider. This seems not to work any more.

buginformation.summary: crash on navigate to android wear
buginformation.description: A user on geoclub.de highlighted an issue, were he got a crash when navigating with Wear under Android 5.0. Report from March, 31st, 23:14. Here is the stacktrace: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Service Intent must be explicit: Intent { act=cgeo.geocaching.wear.NAVIGATE_TO (has extras) }

buginformation.summary: Crash using new Hint Option on go to coordinates
buginformation.description: When not actually viewing a geocache but simply selecting coordinates from the history list in the goto destination (bottom middle icon on cgeo home screen) you still have the new hint option at the top of the screen (even though there obviously isn't a hint) selecting this crashes cgeo - unfortauntely c:geo has stopped

buginformation.summary: Sort by status
buginformation.description: Will be nice if it is possible to sort list by status (active, disables, archive) so it is easier to delete archived caches from list.

buginformation.summary: Can't delete cache from "All list"
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open Stored activity Select "All caches" from the drop down selector Long press a cache, select Drop Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache is still present in list Expected behavior after performing these steps: The cache should be removed Version of c:geo used: Current master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: GCVote color in lists changed
buginformation.description: The color of the favorite point field background (used to represent the gcvote rating) has changed colors. It used to be (extract from FAQ): The color represents the average GCVote rating for this cache, where green means good (>3,5 stars),brown means average rating (between 2,5 and 3,5) and red means a rather bad rating (<2,5 stars). If the color is grey the cache has not yet any votes.

buginformation.summary: have as last entry in all list selections
buginformation.description: It should always be possible to create a new list on the fly.

buginformation.summary: Empty personal note on OC leads to 'null' as text
buginformation.description: Observed this today, probably a side-effect from the new JSON parser

buginformation.summary: NPE when deleting list with all caches in it
buginformation.description: List -> Manage -> remove all and list -> E/AndroidRuntime(17247): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-1830

buginformation.summary: Home coords parsing broken?
buginformation.description: FB reports tell, that people are located in Iran by default when GPS is not available. I can reproduce by switching off GPS and starting c:geo twice (because home coords are only used after second login AFAIR). It seems either the home coords are not working on the website or we fail when parsing them.

buginformation.summary: Show more information if multiple contacts found
buginformation.description: If a search returns more than one contact with the searched alias (name of gc-user), a dialog shows all results. In this dialog only the alias is shown, so no distinction is possible. It would be nice if more information here would be shown, for example additional first name and last name or something like displayname

buginformation.summary: Bad sort in caches filter
buginformation.description: Hello, In french, the list of caches in the filter is wrong. It's not a natural order and the type "Event Cache" (Événements in French) is at the bottom of the list. Here a screenshot:

buginformation.summary: Disable button while fields are empty in TokenAuthorizationActivity
buginformation.description: At the GeoKrety activation screen (Settings -> Services -> GeoKrety.org -> Authorize c:geo). Button "Authorize/Start again" is enabled even if fields are empty. Button should be enabled only if there is something in both fields.

buginformation.summary: No reaction if hint is requested but cache has no hint
buginformation.description: @Bananeweizen Looking at the code I would assume that if the cache has no hint the toast should be shown with the string="cache_hint_not_available". However if i select the hint menu on compass nothing is shown if the cache has no hint.

buginformation.summary: twitter box in trackable logging not visible
buginformation.description: It only becomes visible after changing the log type.

buginformation.summary: send2c:geo problems with new "list all" feature
buginformation.description: If the List "All" is opened while importing caches with send2c:geo the imported caches will not show up in any list except in the new "All" list. It is quite inconvenient to manually move these caches into the standard list if you have quite a large number of caches. Perhaps should be moved automatically into another list, if you download them while beeing in the "All" list. Keep up the good work! Best regards, Kratergecko

buginformation.summary: Crash when check gcvote with empty string
buginformation.description: Possibly only if service is active and you press check.

buginformation.summary: Pocket Query Creator
buginformation.description: I have just found this app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.pquery It has a GPLv3 license with the source code at: http://code.google.com/p/pocket-query-creator/ It can download existing PQ-files from gc.com and also create new PQs and download them. Would it be an option to think about implementing such a feature ? For PM it is a very convenient method of managing PQs in combination with later import to c:geo.

buginformation.summary: Extract waypoint function should provide result
buginformation.description: After executing the function "Extract waypoints" it might or might not be succesful in extracting waypoints. It also happend to me, that it took some time until the extracted waypoints finally showed up in the waypoint tab (I suspect the process was still running while swiping to the waypoint tab). We should provide a feedback to the user about the result of the extraction. This could be done with a small toast like "Extracted x waypoints from cache description" / "No wapoints found in cache description"

buginformation.summary: Copy Waypoint's
buginformation.description: It would be a nice feature to copy Waypoint's in one Cache. In many multi-caches you get at one station the coordinates for the next station. Can copy a waypoint with the ability to quickly create new waypoints

buginformation.summary: Refresh not stored caches
buginformation.description: Until a few weeks ago it was possible to refresh not stored caches by clicking on "refresh. Now this doesn't do anything.

buginformation.summary: Automate copying of waypoints from cache description
buginformation.description: Often caches have waypoints described inside cache text but not available as cache waypoint. For example, have a look at GCM4Y8. You'll found several coordinates inside cache text description but no official cache waypoints. It would be nice if c:geo could create waypoints automatically from the coordinates inside the text. I don't know: tapping and holding over a coordinate inside text will popup a dialog asking for a description (nice to have: description already populated with 3-5 words from text before the coordinates)? The same feature would be useful also while reading the logs.

buginformation.summary: Bad title, when invoking c:geo from mail
buginformation.description: When the nightly is invoked from a mail to open that cache in c:geo, it does only show "Cache" as title below the c:geo icon (instead of "Import into c:geo" or something like that, as before). This is due to my refactoring to let every activity have its title declared in the manifest instead of in the Java code of the activity. To cleanly fix this new problem, I suggest to introduce a new activity for opening a cache from a hyperlink. That new activity would then only handle the intent, and afterwards forward to the cache details activity.

buginformation.summary: Use user-defined default location in absence of system location instead of Paris
buginformation.description: Since one of the last updates (I'm using the nightlies), quite possibly since c:geo uses Google Play Services, localization with switched-off GPS places my Live Map in France (centred on Paris, Ile-de-France). Whenever I restart c:geo, it's centred there again. Any ideas why? BTW: no Google account on this phone, does that matter?

buginformation.summary: Use event date instead of current date for logging
buginformation.description: I sometimes log event caches some days late. It would be more convenient to use the event date as default instead of the current date, if the cache is an event cache.

buginformation.summary: Wrong attribute icon in OC.de cache
buginformation.description: Version: 20131219_NB Cache: OC101D5 The first attribute has the text nur bei opencaching logbar but an icon which is a red ?!. I assume this is not correct.

buginformation.summary: Compass cpu-usage (mainly while screen off)
buginformation.description: Mucek4 told me at the event, that the compass uses cpu-time while the screen is off. Also the compass needs a lot of cpu during normal operation (constantly 90-100%). Compared to other navigation-apps this is too much(like Locus, 5-80%).

buginformation.summary: Interworking problem with Maps.me 6.0.7
buginformation.description: From support mail: All worked well until I upgraded to Maps.me 6.0.7 Looking at a list of 40 caches and selecting "Show on a map", then Maps.me There are 40 green dots around where I am standing, GOOD. I tap a dot. It comes up with box and words c:geo and the co-ordinates. I tap the arrow labelled "Back", it then quickly shows a message that it cannot download cache details, and return to the list. The one nearest is top of the list. But I want to research other around and have no idea which is which Previously (before the Maps upgrade) it came up with the cache name, and if I did a back arrow, it then opened that cache's description. So it seems that the interchange parameters to Maps.me has changed with this new version. Please can you look into it? Android 4.1.1 C:geo 2016 05 09

buginformation.summary: Crash when validating a note edition after rotating the phone
buginformation.description: In 2014.08.29: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Cache placed date parsing is wrong
buginformation.description: It looks like the HTML code has changed. To check, look for keyword "CITO", the CITO events do not have the date in the search results.

buginformation.summary: NPE when trying to open stored list
