buginformation.description: NB2013.05.30-NB-cc69b7a: I authorized c:geo for OC.de and tried it for a while Then I switched off the "Opencaching use for Live map and search" in the settings If I perform a nearby search and continuously load more results, it also keeps showing OC-results Same on live map "Force stop" and restart does not help

buginformation.summary: NPE in CachePopupFragment
buginformation.description: From GooglePlay with our new version 2014.12.09. One report at staged release of 20%. Android 4.4 No user comment java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread.

buginformation.summary: IllegalStateException with NFC
buginformation.description: ava.lang.IllegalStateException: activity is already destroyed

buginformation.summary: NPE in ImageSelectActivity
buginformation.description: From PlayStore. Currently only one record for this. I just wanted to report back the PlayStore issue in order for you to provide feedback and maybe it is helpful as no each dev has PlayStore access. We can close it anytime if it is a single case (e.g. broken device, Custom ROM, etc.). java.lang.RuntimeException: Failure delivering result ResultInfo{who=null, request=1, result=-1, data=Intent { act=inline-data (has extras) }} to activity {cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Settings - themes folder: changes in textbox are not saved
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Always propose to translate in English
buginformation.description: My device and my c:geo are usually in French. I do not have the "Translate to English" menu because it is only offered when c:geo is configured to use English. Given the fact that the most used translator, Google Translate, uses English as a pivot language and may be very bad for other languages, I propose to always offer the "Translate to English" menu in addition to the local language. This has hit me in Prague where the French translation for some cache was awful.

buginformation.summary: Enabling waypoints in Maps and tapping on Geocache marker brings up Waypoint instead
buginformation.description: This seems to be a problem with the OSM offline map view: if waypoints are shown on a map and a waypoint happen to be near the geocache it is associated with (such as a Parking waypoint), then tapping on the geocache marker brings up the waypoint instead, albeit it is layered below the geocache marker and thus not shown. Similar, if multiple waypoints and/or geocache markers are in close proximity the layering of the display is the inverse of the hit-test layering: the user taps on the topmost marker, but c:geo detects the lowestmost marker instead. Probably both issues are related, thus I filed them together in a single issue.

buginformation.summary: switching list reloads all current caches
buginformation.description: When switching a list, we reload all current caches, before actually loading all caches of the new list.

buginformation.summary: Empty notification box on startup
buginformation.description: The last few days I am often experiencing that on startup of c:geo an empty notification box is shown for some seconds. After some seconds it either shows me, that a new nightly is available or just disappears (in case the newest nightly is installed). I am quite sure, that with older versions the box was never shown when empty but only visible together with a notification. Did something change in the code with respect to the notification ?

buginformation.summary: Sorting of the waypoint list
buginformation.description: checkout: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC53NJM_circumvallatielinie-1 Watch the order of the waypoints at the bottom Now load the same cache in c:geo. Look at the waypoints, the order is different from the website. It looks like that reference points are displayed first. But in this case the reference point is a kind of "walked by"/via point, the waypoints should be kept in the website order. Maybe its not a bug but a change request (in case its intended to have a different order than the website), cannot determine that. c:geo:2014.5.14 Android:4.2.2 samsung:S3mini

buginformation.summary: Waypoints sometimes replaced by "unknown"
buginformation.description: Today I went caching with the market version 24.09. and encountered that waypoint sometimes get lost. I found a way to reproduce: Search for caches (e.g. by adress) which are not in the database Select a cache with waypoints and store it (the waypoints are correctly shown up to now End c:geo Start c:geo again and do the same search as before (e.g. by adress) Select the previously saved cache from the results Select one of its waypoints and it shows "Unbekannte Koordinaten" with the red-dot symbol Refresh the cache-details Waypoints are OK again There may be other ways to have this error (e.g. when selecting the cache from saved list), but I found only this one reproducibly. Regards, Lineflyer

buginformation.summary: Map doesn't react on changes of caches
buginformation.description: Hi ... I have discovered with actual master codebase ... that when I mark cache as found (field note) it's icon is not updated with smile, i need to close map and open ... and it is ok. The same with opening/storing cache to download precise coordinates ... it will not help (map close/open needed). Isn't this caused by some wrong refactoring ?

buginformation.summary: Live-map support for opencaching.org.uk
buginformation.description: As oc.uk also supports OKAPI we can easily extend c:geo to cover this site as well. The implementation is already ready, it is just necessary to acquire official keys (http://www.opencaching.org.uk/okapi/signup.html) and add them to the build environment.

buginformation.summary: Improve contact matching
buginformation.description: From @YraFyra: The current implementation is first looking at the Alias field. If no match is found then DisplayName is searched. However, this search is done using the '=' thus only matching full names. I suggest to using "LIKE" as operator and "%GcAlias%" as pattern to really find the best candidates. Of course this may return more that one match and therefore I added a simple optionsmenu to select which contact to open. and let me add to this: I use to store most caching contacts in this format: Max TheCacher Mustermann or just Max TheCacher where the geocaching name (TheCacher) is either the middle name or the last name. I think some users might do alike, so I would prefer if these formats are also matched (I dont't know if this is implicit in the proposal above).

buginformation.summary: NPE in deleteDirectory()
buginformation.description: From release 2014.03.31. java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Import and parse coordinates added to log
buginformation.description: When you post log you can add coordinates. c:geo currently does not do anything with it. Example: GC3JCM1, log from "trollteamet" an option to create waypoint would be great.

buginformation.summary: Wrong window size or text size not matching in some dialogs
buginformation.description: While testing the new PQ functions I realized some design glitches on my device, see screenshots attached. AFAIR there is at least one other dialog with the same problem, but I could not find it. --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: List sorting is reset on leaving cache details
buginformation.description: Today I was checking a cache series for the notes I had taken on each of them. So I sorted by name, opened first cache, closed it again. Sorting was reset to sort by distance. This is quite annoying when you need to switch between list and details multiple times.

buginformation.summary: Download waypoints static maps fails
buginformation.description: With nighly build and my local build of last week the waypoint static map download is not working. Will go for this myself on wednesday. This is a bug.

buginformation.summary: Cache count on live-map unreliable
buginformation.description: The amount of caches on the live-map seems not to be correctly calculated. My experience is, that this problem already existed for a long time (and there was already a try to fix it with #865) but I could not find an issue for that. Therefore I am opening this issue. These are my experiences: The initial value after opening the live-map and loading has finished is higher than the caches really shown on the map. It seems that the cache-loading returns also caches outside the viewable area on the screen. So the number might be "correct" but its not the number of displayed caches. When scrolling on the live map the value is always only increasing but no longer showing anything useful. I think this behavior is new after the map changes ?!

buginformation.summary: MissingBackpressureException
buginformation.description: Taken from IRC: 18:07:26rsudev1: BTW: I was using the opportunity to check the 'current' crashes, ordered by frequency (that led me to the concurrentmodification fix). The second most frequent is 'MissingBackpressureException'. I have no clue about that one (my understanding of rx is far too limited...)

buginformation.summary: Compass deviation -90° in landscape mode
buginformation.description: Hi, since the last update, the compass has a deviation of -90° when holding the device in landscape mode. I'm running Android 4.2.2 with a Kernel 3.4.5 on a ASUS ME173X (Built ME173X_WW_user_4.2.4.72702_20131128) If I have another app using the compass, like GPS Status, it works well when turning the device. Rebooting and locking the screen in landscape mode doesn't have any effect.

buginformation.summary: NPE on nearby search
buginformation.description: 2015.03.02-NB-b6ed572 Set global filter to "Event cache" Search for Adress "Prag" On the result page click on "Load more caches" Result: 15:15:41.056 Error cgeo 26418 [main] UncaughtException

buginformation.summary: show today literally
buginformation.description: In the log date selector, show "today" for today.

buginformation.summary: Global cache type filter not applied for OC-caches
buginformation.description: If I select a global filter (e.g. "Mystery caches only") and perform nearby search or use the live map the filter is applied for GC-caches but not for OC-caches. For OC all cache types are shown.

buginformation.summary: Add to calendar missing for past events?
buginformation.description: 2015.08.30-NB1 It seems either there is a problem with event cache GC60RZK or it is not possible to add an event which is in the past? If this is intentional I vote for removing that restriction. The missing option is not really intuitive and it should be up to the user whether he wants to add an event in the past. Additionally there seem to be problems with users on some timezones (maybe erratically set on their phone) leading to fail to add it due to the missing menu.

buginformation.summary: Stored OP-caches not shown in list + Search for OP-caches no longer working
buginformation.description: After downloading cache details from service other than geocaching (e.g. opencaching.pl - OP49DB) cache is stored, but not visible on the "stored" list. However it is visible as stored and can be accessed/dropped via Live Map. It is also visible on list created after pressing "show as list" on live map. Also on list selection view such caches are counted, but after opening such list, it's empty. It behaves like there would be some "invisible" filter that shows only GC caches on stored lists.

buginformation.summary: Navbar covering bottom of screen
buginformation.description: On latest version application navbar is covering bottom of screen with nickname and GPS info etc. See screens: Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.31-NB-68ea5ac Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (exodus_d802, LGE) Android version: 6.0.1 Android build: MHC19J release-keys Cgeo version: 2016.03.31-NB-68ea5ac Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation vector sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Magnetometer & Accelerometer sensor: present Direction sensor used: rotation vector Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: pl_PL Geocaching sites enabled: geocaching.com: logged in (Nazwa użytkownika OK) / BASIC Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

buginformation.summary: Cause string missing on login failure
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to Menu -> Settings - Services - geocaching.com Try to authorize with correct username but wrong password Actual behavior after performing these steps: The following prompt is shown: Expected behavior after performing these steps: The cause string "Wrong username and/or password should be shown" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: not relevant Other comments and remarks: Happens since the implementation of the new authentication menus

buginformation.summary: Force english does not work on main screen
buginformation.description: Set your system locale to something not english. start c:geo set "force english" force close app or reboot phone start c:geo c:geo is in a native language of phone.

buginformation.summary: Light scheme in single log picture view not ok (Android 2.x specific)
buginformation.description: Reproducible for me only on Android 2.x: I checked the light scheme throughout the app with 2013.03.31-RC2 on a Sasmsung Galaxy Ace GT-I8160 (Android 2.3.6). With my Galaxy S2 (Android 4.1.2) the scheme is correct. When viewing the pictures of a single log entry (not the picture tab of the cache details - this is working fine), the background is still black only the picture caption is shown black on white. As the menu is still usable I set this issue to prriotiy "low".

buginformation.summary: Propose to remove list when all caches are removed
buginformation.description: When more than one cache is removed since we opened a non-default list view, we should propose to remove the list as well. We do it the other way around (propose to remove the caches when we remove the list) but some users might just remove all the caches, expecting to be able to remove the list at the same time.

buginformation.summary: Do not restrict geocaching.com geocoder to this connector
buginformation.description: When Google geocoder (used to transform addresses into coordinates) fails or is not installed in the phone, we resort to geocaching.com simple geocoder which returns one set of coordinates and return the caches from geocaching.com located near those coordinates. As a consequence, caches from other connectors are not fetched. When the geocaching.com connector is active, we should use its geocoder as a fallback for Google geocoder instead of a special case for loading geocaching.com caches. Also, some other geocaching sites may provide their own geocoders.

buginformation.summary: Crash during GPX export
buginformation.description: From PlayStore. Currently 4 records for this. Users are stating it crashed while exporting a GPX. I just wanted to report back the PlayStore issue in order for you to provide feedback and maybe it is helpful as no each dev has PlayStore access. We can close it anytime if it is a single case (e.g. broken device, Custom ROM, etc.). java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: store zoom separately for live map and for "map of a single cache"
buginformation.description: I'm not using live map much, but today I watched a friend, who never used our app before. He was coming from live map (with a big area covered), looked at a cache and zoomed into the map of that cache very closely. When going back to the live map, it was also zoomed in closely. We should use 2 different persistent zoom states to allow more easy switching between these 2 use cases.

buginformation.summary: Label Caches with Icons
buginformation.description: It would be nice if one could add visible markers/labels to a cache for showing in the map. There are already markers for found cache (smiley) and own caches (star). These new markers could be displayed on the right of the cache icon in the map, same size as smiley or star. Concept: In cache details one can choose one of several markers. This markers don't have an explanation, they are just images for tagging. The user can interpret and use them as he/she likes. monkey wrench (possible meaning: I'm working on it, made some notes, multi that is not fully done) piece of paper (possible meaning: I made some notes) sad smiley (DNF?) Numbers 1 2 3 4 5 ... question mark, exclamation mark thumb up, thumb down ... The marker is shown on the live map and somewhere in the cache details.

buginformation.summary: Favorite point can be added to CITO in c:geo but not in GC.com
buginformation.description: c:geo allows to give favorite to CITO event while GC.com prevents favorites for events.

buginformation.summary: NPE when editing personal note twice
buginformation.description: 2013.12.25-NB Steps: Open saved cache Edit personal note and save it Edit personal note again and save it Result: Crash Log: 12:16:48.656 Error AndroidRuntime 23750 FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: cancelling storing leads to wrong markers
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start downloading an online search result list Cancel at some point in between Actual behavior after performing these steps: The online search result list is refreshed and all caches have the offline marker. But in fact, not all have been stored. When randomly clicking caches from the list now, some open immediately, and some will be downloaded first (the ones we cancelled).

buginformation.summary: Wrongly detect 2 digit numbers as geocode in lab cache gpx
buginformation.description: Import the 3 lab cache GPX files from GC55555. Cache number 10 will always overwrite the existing cache number 10. This is because our GPX parser wrongly thinks that the "10 - some name" indicates the geocode 10, therefore overwriting the previously existing cache.

buginformation.summary: Negative Array Size Exception
buginformation.description: From Google Play for current beta (and the one before): ''' java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException: -4 at cgeo.geocaching.utils.CanvasUtils.drawPath(CanvasUtils.java:25)

buginformation.summary: org.apache.harmony.xml.ExpatParser$ParseException when opening map
buginformation.description: Outcome of #6236 (put into a new issue): Beta version: 2016.01.08-RC2 java.lang.RuntimeException: Aborting on Log.e()

buginformation.summary: Dialog "Uploading Waypoint…" although not uploading
buginformation.description: The dialog is shown every time you press "Save" after editing or creation of a waypoint. It should be shown only if this waypoint is uploaded. Btw: How can you upload waypoints? You can only upload changed coordinates of a cache.

buginformation.summary: Personal note string "Merged:" should be in strings.xml
buginformation.description: If a personal note is merged the string Merged: is shown in the note. AFAICS it is not included in strings.xml but should be to get translated.

buginformation.summary: Always use GPS for direction in compass if device does not have magnetic compass
buginformation.description: Some users made me aware, that on devices without magnetic compass sensor our compass wont point to the direction of the cache while walking but does while driving/biking. My assumption is, that we try to get the direction from that not existing sensor (in case the speed is below the coded limit). Is there a possibility to always use GPS for those devices without having the user to select it ?

buginformation.summary: Batch-actions for trackables not working
buginformation.description: The buttons in the log-view are missing.

buginformation.summary: Event cache: parse the date from search results
buginformation.description: When searching event caches only, the list of results doesn't show any date in c:geo. We probably simply don't parse the date from the seach results.

buginformation.summary: Navigate menu mislabel
buginformation.description: I've noticed when you go to the navigate menu, the button to view the "Map" says "c:geo" instead. That isn't correct, is it?

buginformation.summary: Cache rendering has massive delay or leads to ANR
buginformation.description: Opening this cache Geocache GC49CQC - Das Nest der Hedwigeule - zum 5000. - http://coord.info/GC49CQC is obviously problematic. On my Galaxy S4 the whole app gets quite unresponsive and sometimes runs into an ANR.

buginformation.summary: Only first log image loaded
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open http://coord.info/GC5MF1T Open log images for the log from TX-Tracker Actual behavior after performing these steps: Only the first image is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Both images should be shown. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.20-null-20cccf9 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Filter applied to single cache request
buginformation.description: When you scan a QR-Code of an Multi-Cache while Filter-Settings are set to Traditional you get an errormessage "Cache not found". Filter must be set to either Multi-Cache or All Caches for scan to work. (renamed from "QR scan does not work if filter set")

buginformation.summary: Crash when trying to navigate with MapsWithMe and waypoints without coordinates
buginformation.description: (Error scenario deduced from the following playstore crash report) java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'double cgeo.geocaching.location.Geopoint.getLatitude()' on a null object reference

buginformation.summary: Add ability to download/open image from cache description
buginformation.description: When an image is embedded in the cache description there is currently no possibility to download or open the image with another app. Only by opening the cache in the browser. You should add a long-press feature on images with the context menu choices "Download image" and "Open image". That would be really useful when trying to solve Unknown caches on the field!

buginformation.summary: Live map caches "flashing"
buginformation.description: Today I went caching with NB3101 7fba2c2 and have seen the following issue reproducibly: I started Live Map and the caches are shown normal after (very short :-) ) loading time. When driving around (with my car) the map starts to scroll and at some point of course an update is performed. At the start of this reload (indicated by the progress indicator in the upper right) all caches disappear some seconds (depending on the network speed) until the reload is completed. After that the caches are again shown normal.

buginformation.summary: onscreen keyboard remains after failed search
buginformation.description: Search for a non existing geo code from the search bar at the top of the main screen. For me that leads to the screen keyboard remaining open on my Galaxy Note.

buginformation.summary: MapQuest geocoder returns a 403 error
buginformation.description: As of 2015-02-10, the MapQuest geocoder started to return 403 errors. It looks like this may be a larger issue as shown in: http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open/forums/-/message_boards/message/1327001 As of 2015-02-11, the GeocoderTest.testMapQuestGeocoder test has been annotated with @Suppress. This annotation should be removed when the problem is solved, or when the MapQuest geocoder is removed from cgeo. Note that the unavailability of MapQuest does not impair the behaviour of cgeo in any way when other geocoders (Android, GC) are available.

buginformation.summary: Save for offline no longer available in search results
buginformation.description: Users report, that the "Save for offline" option is no longer available from search results with release 2012.06.06 Could not check up to now.

buginformation.summary: Filtering fails in nearby search
buginformation.description: Reported on support mail and I can reproduce it with current master and release version. Scenario: Perform nearby search Set Filter to e.g. "With Trackables" Filtering is OK Load more results Result: Filter no longer applied

buginformation.summary: Have export menu in cache activity
buginformation.description: People should be able to export a single cache to gpx from the cache activity.

buginformation.summary: Support user modified coords from/to server for all cache types
buginformation.description: According to the latest release notes gc.com now supports this function for all cache types, thus c:geo should do.

buginformation.summary: Negative bearing
buginformation.description: At least in the compass view you have a negative bearing (e.g. -40° instead of 320°). I don't know if this is a wrong order of calling the bearingTo()-method or if it's the result of using the Android-method. Using build from current HEAD.

buginformation.summary: Allow upload of personal note to OC server
buginformation.description: This seems to be supported with the OKAPI and should be implemented identically to the gc.com feature: http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/caches/save_personal_notes.html

buginformation.summary: Coordinate dialog has transparent background
buginformation.description: The dialog to edit wayoint coordinates now has a transparent background (in dark skin, Android 4.0.3). That makes it hard to read

buginformation.summary: turn off stand-by mode in list view
buginformation.description: Bernd Schreck sent me a mail with this ft. request: Hello everyone, while driving in the car (I am using my smartphone in a fixture) in an area with stored caches, the stand-by mode of the device in list-view is quite annoying. This year I used a "holiday caches"-list for our holiday destination area in order to see caches "approaching" on my route. To keep the "holiday caches"-list displayed (meaning to prevent the stand-by mode) on the phone I had to fiddle all the time with my fingers on the display. Improvement proposal for the list-view: ---> Additional option in the list-view to prevent (i.e. enable) stand-by mode. Currently the list-view provides already a menue with "Options" that leads to "Map" and "List". The new proposed option "Stand-by mode ON" i.e. "Stand-by mode OFF" could be implemented (added) there. Hope you ll like my proposal and implement this characteristic. Regards, Bernd

buginformation.summary: "Your saved log" should have orange marker
buginformation.description: @Bananeweizen Small addition to #4679: The shown offline log should have an orange marker in the logbook instead of the default marker for the log type posted. This would make it consistent to the list view and would draw users attention to this log.

buginformation.summary: Show logbook of GK trackable
buginformation.description: Of course this feature request was mentioned by OC-users looking at the new Geokret functionality: The logbook of GK trackables should be loaded as well (like for GC trackables). I don't know whether the API supports that currently, so I just want to file that as a Feature Request here.

buginformation.summary: details view is populated twice
buginformation.description: The details view is initialized twice with all data in most cases, because it loads the cache details in onResume() and from the loadCacheHandler.

buginformation.summary: Create individual types of waypoints when importing personal note from gc.com
buginformation.description: If I got it right the import functionality of personal notes from GC.com creates waypoints of type "reference point" for each detected coordinate string. Would be a nice feature when the import could identify coordinates tagged with keywords to create other types of waypoints during import from GC.com E.g. personal note: "Parking area at PARKING=N 50° 40.666E 006° 58.222 My calculated final coordinates: FINAL=N 50° 40.777E 006° 58.111 Get some ice cream at N 50° 40.555E 006° 58.000" Import creates one waypoint of type "parking area", one of type "final" and one of the default type "reference point"

buginformation.summary: URL in hint gets convertet to "visit link" but it is not clickable
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Some Cacheowners, especially in the US, are writing URLs in the hints of their listings. Here is an example: https://coord.info/GC4W4BP cgeo recocnise this links and shows a blue "visit link" instead. But its not clickable. if you click on the link the whole hint is only getting en/decrypted Actual behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" in hint not clickable Expected behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" should open the link, not en/decrypt it like normal hint-text alternativ: dont convert it to "visit link" so that it can be read or copied Version of c:geo used: 2016.10.13 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Search by geocode is case sensitive
buginformation.description: I am not sure whether this is a regression or was like that all the time??! 2013.08.17-NB Steps: Search for a GC-code which is already stored on your device but use lower case characters Result: Cache is downloaded from network instead directly opened from list Status "Saved for offline" is correctly shown, but however the network call is unnecessary I think the search entry should just be converted to uppercase.

buginformation.summary: GPX Export
buginformation.description: When exporting to GPX, some fields are missing: FV, Found, NotFound, County, State. Child Waypoints not linked. This is when using this GPX with GSAK.

buginformation.summary: Concurrency issues with map
buginformation.description: This may be a duplicate, but this may contain new information and updated traces. On a Galaxy Tab running Android 4.0.4 and c:geo 2012.06.01, moving the live map quickly with a small zoom level and thus containing lots of caches will exhibit several concurrency issues. It looks like we hide some of them in the logs and do not crash, but are still sensitive to a ConcurrentModificationException. We need to understand what thread modifies which information in the map. We cannot modify the overlay information while it may be used by the UI thread, so all the overlays modifications may have to occur through a handler to ensure we are indeed using the UI thread. 06-01 22:25:41.170 I/ActivityManager(182): START {cmp=cgeo.geocaching/.maps.google.GoogleMapActivity} from pid 27446

buginformation.summary: Uploading picture with log fails
buginformation.description: 2013.08.05-NB: Open loggging window Enter log Attach picture Send log with picture Result: Error message "Log could not be send" Log is in fact posted to the website but without picture Stacktrace: 21:56:36.312 Debug cgeo 23003 POST http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?ID=2511222

buginformation.summary: Report login failure as failure
buginformation.description: Noted in the development version when GC.com changed its login variables: the login error was in the log, but success (without the avatar) was reported on the screen. Maybe a forgotten corner case of #602, will investigate.

buginformation.summary: List name no longer on top of screen
buginformation.description: I noticed when I am picking a list of stored caches, the name of the list is no longer displayed. Regardless of my current list, it only displays "c:geo"

buginformation.summary: Scrolling in cache description not possible on Android 4.3.1
buginformation.description: We received four mails on support telling this: Using Android 4.3.1 Scrolling possible in other parts of the app but not in cache description Trying to scroll it jumps around and always ends up at the top after releasing One user confirmed the behavior for market release as well as nightly build. I am still waiting for more details. I asked in what views scrolling is posible and where it is not possible. Any idea from developers side yet?

buginformation.summary: Everywhere function: No history when navigate via compass
buginformation.description: Input coordinates Press the compass icon Press back, the coordinates are not in the history. Press back (go back to main screen), coordinates are added to the history. Additional issue: With history items there is a overflow menu button (three dots) with "nearby caches" and "clear history". Sometimes the button is shown but when you press it, it changes to the arrow for loading nearby caches.

buginformation.summary: When offline CGEO tries to login everytime homescreen is visited
buginformation.description: Hi, I'm not sure if this is desired behaviour, but it feels strange to me that everytime I visit the homescreeen of cgeo, the app tries to Login. This is maybe a good feature when a network connection is present, however when out caching my network status doesn't change. Maybe it is just me, but I feel that this is a not needed power consumption. I'd prefer an 'Offline Mode' where no login-checks are performed.

buginformation.summary: Only 100 waypoints shown per cache
buginformation.description: And here is comes. Another rare use case (love those). Seems I did ust now learn that the amount of waypoint per cache in c:geo is limited to 100. This cache http://coord.info/GC6TT3C has around 194 waypoints (If I counted correctly). Is there any necessity to limit to 100 or just a randomly selected limit which we could raise.

buginformation.summary: Activated / Deactivated Flag
buginformation.description: I deactivated 2 of my caches but the state in list didn't show it. After refresh it is shown correct but activating one cache it is still shown deactivated. The state should be shown correct after logging deactivated / activated.

buginformation.summary: Caches shown as found although not found
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC6HP1Y Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache is shown as found altghough it is not found by the user Expected behavior after performing these steps: Correct found state should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 as well as current master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Reported via support mail and reproducible for me

buginformation.summary: Load more caches button missing
buginformation.description: The load more caches button is not shown in search results. Maybe it has to do with changes from @Bananeweizen.

buginformation.summary: Icon decoding does not work well
buginformation.description: I'm reimplementing the PNG decoder with a different approach because for me it nearly never manages to find the correct cache type.

buginformation.summary: Caches disappear from list after return from cache details
buginformation.description: Version: 2013.12.24-NB Steps: Deactivate all services except extremcaching.com (I could not see this faulty behavior with geocaching.com) Search location "Schwarzenberg" The search should return 20 caches Open one of the caches Press back to get back to the result list. Result: Only the previously opened cache is still displayed Log shows: 16:11:20.689 Debug cgeo 2831 DataStore.loadCaches([EC335, EC69, EC31, EC32, EC71, EC39, EC58, EC36, EC38, EC83, EC111, EC85, EC62]) returned no results

buginformation.summary: Coords in calendar is not usable
buginformation.description: When events are created in the users calendar using the calendar addon, then the coordinates are added as well. These coords has used to open Google Maps or other apps like OsmAnd to view the position. Now it seem like the intent format has changed since Maps don't find anything and OsmAnd indicates that part of the coords are lost.

buginformation.summary: Show event date a today and tomorrow
buginformation.description: We already use today and tomorrow for showing logs. We might also use it for the event date in cache details of event caches. 👍 1

buginformation.summary: live map disables after rotate
buginformation.description: when you do a search ans then display results on map and then press enable live if you rotate your device live map auto disables Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: CompassActivity invoked with non-existent cache
buginformation.description: It looks like CompassActivity may be invoked with a cache which cannot be loaded. java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.CompassActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'cgeo.geocaching.location.Geopoint cgeo.geocaching.models.Geocache.getCoords()' on a null object reference

buginformation.summary: failing export test
buginformation.description: Depending on the system timezone, the ExportTest may fail. This is because the formatting of the SimpleDateFormat depends on the timezone used for "interpretation" of the millisecondsSince1970 value, as documented in the sample code of http://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html Now we can fix the test by adding static {

buginformation.summary: cache details options menu does not adapt to changes
buginformation.description: Refreshing the cache may completely change its properties. The menu currently stays as on first opening the cache.

buginformation.summary: Posting log not possible
buginformation.description: We retrieved some mails that logging is not OK with the release version. It could be a result of the site update from yesterday. I just tested it myself with version 2013.05.22 and can reproduce that. c:geo says "Log sucesful" but updating the cache details afterwards the log is not shown. Also on the webpage there is no new log. Feel free to test with GC352Y3 Log will follow.

buginformation.summary: Logging not possible from compass of waypoint
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Crash when rotating cache window
buginformation.description: From Google Play: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Detect and report time-skew that prevents okapi access
buginformation.description: If the time-stamp betwenn device and the OKAPI-site is higher than a certain limit, all requests are denied. We can (and should) detect this situation and report it back to allow the user to adjust the device time and timezone. A sample answer (with http response code 400): {"error":{"developer_message":"Expired timestamp, yours 1378850423, ours 1378878830 (threshold 300).",

buginformation.summary: No live map functionality for other sources than gc.com
buginformation.description: Today I wanted to test some more with ec.com. With 2014.01.01-NB I do not see any requests to ec.com on the live map and consequently the map stays empty. Steps: Activate ec.com as cache source (only) Open live map Scroll around Result: Nothing is shown (in area where ec caches are present) The debug log does not show any activity (requests)

buginformation.summary: About-Contributors kills the app
NPE in status updater
buginformation.description: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Moving caches by selection mode
buginformation.description: This should not be possible

buginformation.summary: export gpx
buginformation.description: export gpx gets to about 3% then stops saying expot failed. cheers

buginformation.summary: Short press actions for WPs no longer working
buginformation.description: 2014.05.31-NB: With the last release short press on a waypoint in the waypoint tab offered a menu for: Edit Duplicate Prefered navigation Navigate Caches around Now short press does not result in any action. Long press for editing however is still working.

buginformation.summary: Any destination live map = live map
buginformation.description: One from support email. If you enter a coordinate in any destination and selext Menu>Navigate>Map the coordinate is not shown. Instead the Live Map is opened.

buginformation.summary: "date hidden" in cache detail is wrong
buginformation.description: http://dosensammler.info/2011/08/06/cgeo-datumsfehler-oder-geocachen-inklusive-zeitreise/ In the article the wrong date is "7. Dezember 2012". Seems to affect all caches

buginformation.summary: disable base.getRating() for non GC caches
buginformation.description: Ability for getting the gcvote rating should be part of the connector, so non GC caches are not send to gcvote.com. (I'm basically waiting for the network changes to be merged, afterwards this can be implemented easily).

buginformation.summary: Crash when resuming c:geo
buginformation.description: With current NBs it often happens, that the device get unresponsive when I try to resume c:geo when previously left the app with home button (mostly while on map). Up to now I did only get the chance to save one log: 01-20 14:36:27.883 I/ActivityThread(16252): Pub cgeo.geocaching.apps.locusdatastorageprovider: cgeo.geocaching.apps.LocusDataStorageProvider

buginformation.summary: Cannot authenticate to opencaching.pl
buginformation.description: Current master. OAuth authentication process cannot start as www.opencaching.pl is not known.

buginformation.summary: Reproducible ANR with OSM:Offline map
buginformation.description: I wonder If you experience the same 2015.03.06.-NB using OSM:Offline map Open list of saved caches Open a saved cache Select Navigate -> Map Press back to return to cache details Select Navigate -> Map Result: c:geo freezes I am not using two instances of the map in this case, am I?

buginformation.summary: "This description contains table elements..."
buginformation.description: ...which can only be shown correctly on geocaching.com" is not the best for OC caches. :)

buginformation.summary: NoSuchMethodError in Android < 2.3
buginformation.description: With 2014.03.30. Arrays.copyOf was introduced in API 9 (Android 2.3). at rx.subjects.SubjectSubscriptionManager$State.addObserver(SubjectSubscriptionManager.java:188)

buginformation.summary: Show Circles
buginformation.description: showing circles in live map disappear after rotation of screen in RC I don't believe I recall that happening before Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: Import complete message for PQ import
buginformation.description: When importing a PQ I get this message: 447 Caches von downloadpq.ashx importiert It should contain the PQ name instead of the download URL.

buginformation.summary: Refresh all warning also for low amount of caches on list or selected caches
buginformation.description: With version 2016.01 19 I consider this as small issue to be fixed with the next bugfix release

buginformation.summary: Log text should be limited to 4000 characters
buginformation.description: A user reported on our support mail, that the log text on geocaching.com is limited to 4000 chars. Unfortunately it seems c:geo does not limit the log text to 400 chars. If a user in c:geo sends a log with >4000 chars c:geo reports it as sucessfully logged but transmission to the website is not sucessful in this case, thus the cache is not logged. I did not try this but the report from the user sounds reasonable.

buginformation.summary: Waypoint description added automatically
buginformation.description: Create a new waypoint (e.g. stage of a multicache) with a description. Create another waypoint without a description (description field is empty). After the waypoint was stored, it has the description of the first waypoint. Edit the description of the second waypoint. Create a third waypoint without a description. It will get the description of the first waypoint as well. Create another waypoint with a description. It will keep its description. Master from today morning.

buginformation.summary: Improve PQ selection usability
buginformation.description: Taken from #4267: Since I have converted the selection dialog to a list, it would now be possible to have dedicated buttons for preview or download directly on each list item, thereby avoiding the first dialog completely. See also PR #5393

buginformation.summary: Delay when trying to open "Settings"
buginformation.description: Since a few days opening the settings sometimes takes ages for me. Looking into the log I can see that the following request is sent each time I access the settings: 21:02:04.406 Debug cgeo 28554 GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx?RESET=Y&redir=http%3a%2f%2fwww.geocaching.com%2fdefault.aspx%3f

buginformation.summary: NPE in getCachedMissingFromSearch
buginformation.description: From release 2014.03.31. java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Rotation of Compass Screen
buginformation.description: I'm looking to get a ZTE Optik in the future from Sprint and cgeo works great on it. I did notice however that wwhen the compass Screen is opened it goes to landscape view which is awkward to hold a 7 inch tablet in that orientation is it possible to add a way to rotate the compass Screen Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: Map title should more accurately reflect what is visible
buginformation.description: When opening a map, it gets an initial title which does not change afterwards. But several options menus make the map behave totally different. Therefore on activating the "live" option, the map should call itself "life map" on disabling the "live" option, the map should call itself "map". This is most confusing when the map was started from a list, where it (correctly) takes the list title initiallly.

buginformation.summary: Cache name with special chars not shown
buginformation.description: 2014.07.07.-NB1 For GC55BKB the cache name is not shown. It starts with Offline" (in settings), selected the directory for maps, clicked on "Map" again and didn't get "Offline" but the names of available maps. It worked afterwards but I don't know if it would have worked without selecting "Offline" (or the name) a second time. http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?f=155&t=71676 http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?f=155&t=71705

buginformation.summary: Doubled point at string end
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to Menu - Settings - Services - geocaching.com Enter wrong password Send for authentication Actual behavior after performing these steps: The string of the error message ends with doubled point Expected behavior after performing these steps: Not doubled point or no point at all (my preference) Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.05-NB Other comments and remarks: Will fix this myself in strings. Assigning myself

buginformation.summary: Images from opencaching.pl don't download
buginformation.description: I found issue with opencaching.pl cache images. C:GEO only download spoiler image, but not download other cache images. You can try this bug in cache OP4FE1 (http://opencaching.pl/viewcache.php?cacheid=20454). Other - on opencaching.pl there are some other attributes than in gc.com, so maybe you can add this attributes (http://wiki.opencaching.pl/index.php/Parametry_skrzynki).

buginformation.summary: Avatar no longer loaded on login check gc.com
buginformation.description: 2014.01.03-NB1: Steps: Go to Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com Select "Check login" "Login OK" is shown but no avatar although the user has set an avatar Log: 14:01:37.390 Debug cgeo 29968 GET http://www.geocaching.com/email/

buginformation.summary: Menu item "Scan QR Code" should show a QR code instead of Barcode
buginformation.description: The UI of c:geo is slightly inconsistent for the menu item icon for "scan QR code" (main screen): it shows a barcode. However, for reasons of visual consistency, it should show a (simplified) QR code. This allows users not familiar with the term QR code to better understand what this function is for and to easily identify QR codes when they see them.

buginformation.summary: Logging progress: GEOKRETY should not be all uppercase
buginformation.description: but instead we should use one of the localized strings we already have (was unable to find the uppercase version in the strings... hard coded?)

buginformation.summary: Wrong username kept in authentication screen
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Be logged in as user A for geocaching.com with c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com and authenticate sucesfully as user B Go back to the main screen Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com again Note that the authentication status is correct (correct user and avatar) Open the authentication screen Actual behavior after performing these steps: The username of user A is still shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: The username of user B should be shown as he is currently authorized Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: During my tests I also had the connectors for opencaching.de, extremcaching.com also active with user A. MIght be relevant if there is some mix up between the connectors here.

buginformation.summary: Refreshed cache is reloaded twice from database
buginformation.description: When reload is used on a stored cache, the cache is then reloaded twice from the database after getting the static maps.

buginformation.summary: Bold font displayed blurred in log and cache details
buginformation.description: From time to time single users are reporting that bold font is displayed only blurred and almost unreadable. Logs are affected as well as the cache description. Recently I discussed with a user and found the following facts: Using Samsung Galaxy S3 with Stock-ROM (same as mine) Android 4.1.2 Newest market release Problem is not reproducible but once it occurs only force stop and restart of c:geo solves the problen I have the same phone but can not reproduce this. I am still in chat with the user trying to find out more details. So I open this issue for me as a reminder and for you in case you have any idea for that. Screenshots: Cache: Cache description:

buginformation.summary: New map: "Store Offline" not shown
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Enable new map Open live map wait till all visible caches are loaded Open menu Actual behavior after performing these steps: No "Store Offline" menu entry is shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: Menu "Store Offline" is shown Version of c:geo used: Reported via `2016.05.29-NB-fb50e95 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System)

buginformation.summary: Refresh caches on history will store them to default list
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log some caches from different lists Delete some of them from all lists, let some remain on the different lists Open the history Select "Refresh all" Actual behavior after performing these steps: All refreshed caches are now stored on the default list (whereas caches still stored on a random list will additionally appear on the default list and no longer stored caches will also appear on the default list) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Refreshing the history should neither store no longer stored caches, nor add them to the default list Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? From support mail (only partly retested by myself)

buginformation.summary: Save for offline not working
buginformation.description: 2013.10.04-NB: Search for location (e.g. Köln) Press Menu, Select "Save for Offline" Result: Nothing happens

buginformation.summary: Sort by Event is missing in menu
buginformation.description: In the CacheList, I didn't found an entry to sort by EventDate. I've found where to add the entry, but I'm wondering if this entry should always be visible even if there is no Event Cache in list. What if the list contains mixed types of caches?

buginformation.summary: Sorting selector sometimes not prefilled
buginformation.description: 2014.09.08.-NB: Followup of #3914 and #4260 Steps: Clean start c:geo (no sorting set for this session) Open list with non-event caches Check sorting menu, sort by distance is active Change to a list of event caches Default sorting changes to event date (=hidden date) automatically Check sorting menu --> No entry is selected but should be "Hidden date" Also related to #4321

buginformation.summary: c:geo crashes when choosing Drop All from a stored list
buginformation.description: Steps: Go to a list of stored offline caches Click menu / Manage / Drop All Click OK c:geo crashes Error log: FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-33

buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Select Search Enter tracking code which is numeric only and has five digits Actual behavior after performing these steps: Immediate response toast "c:geo konnte diesen Trackable nicht finden" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Open trackable page Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: From support mail and verified Secret code available on request

buginformation.summary: Exception when parsing bad coordinates
buginformation.description: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$ParseException: Could not parse coordinates as LAT: "N .000"

buginformation.summary: Info about trackable items missing
buginformation.description: When viewing details of a trackable item, goal and info is missing.

buginformation.summary: Cache count on main screen shows 0
buginformation.description: Since a few days (first noticed in 2013.07.05-NB) the main screen is at first start showing the correct cache count for my username. However if I return to the main menu later on (not sure when) or resume the app after having it in background for some time the main screen suddenly shows ˋˋˋ Lineflyer (0) . Login OKˋˋˋ. The login seems to be OK as I can use c:geo without problems, only the cache count is gone.

buginformation.summary: Only show Changelog on startup if hash code changed
buginformation.description: Currently only the version code is checked to trigger opening of the changelog on app start. Additionally the hash code of the file(s) itself should be checked to only show the changelog if both conditions are met (i.e. there is something changed in the changelog). This will prevent triggering the changelog on each new NB. Thanks for the idea @Bananeweizen Assigning @rsudev as requested

buginformation.summary: Exclude own/found directly from Live Map
buginformation.description: Excluding own/found is a feature I use very regularly. However, to toggle this setting requires me to exit the live map, open the settings, scroll, change the setting, exit the settings, load up the live map, and then find my way back to where I was before I closed the map. And then, once I've looked at the position of the own/found cache I was interested in, I have to repeat all of the above to turn the setting back off. Am I missing something? This process gets a bit tedious! It would be great to be able to turn on/off my own caches and my found caches from the 'Map Modes' dialog inside the live map. It would be even greater if I had the ability to differentiate between showing own caches and showing found caches. I often want to see my own caches but not found caches, or to see my found caches but not my own caches.

buginformation.summary: show geocode in history
buginformation.description: I nearly always log offline and then use the PC afterwards for logging. For that use case it would be quite comfortable if the second line of the history list entries would not only contain date and time, but also the geocode, so you can more easily search the logged caches online (without opening each of those caches).

buginformation.summary: oc.de: Ignored caches displayed in c:geo
buginformation.description: When ignoring a cache on oc.de and searching e.g. at the coordinates, the cache is shown nevertheless. While this could be a bug in the OKAPI, we should ensure that we properly authenticate (level 3) in this case, to enable filtering of ignored caches.

buginformation.summary: Show offline log as topmost log in logbook
buginformation.description: If an offline log exists, then it should be shown as the topmost log entry (independent of the date), to make the user more easily aware of that existing log. Clicking that log should lead straight to the log editor.

buginformation.summary: multi selection in directory choser
buginformation.description: I've managed to have multiple items selected in the directory chooser dialog, which should not be possible at all. Additionally the checkbox button should be replaced by a radio button to not confuse the user.

buginformation.summary: Offline logging does not work from cache details
buginformation.description: Steps: In settings set to Log Offline Open cache details for a cache From menu, select Log Offline Nothing happens I think the refactoring by @Bananeweizen in b8b1121 is the source as a function in NavigationAppFactory that used to return true or false now always returns true which disrupts logic in CacheDetailActivity.onOptionsItemSelected

buginformation.summary: Long press on a cache in a list does not provide options
buginformation.description: Currently using 2014.03.17-NB-89b499e. Previously, when in list view, a long press would provide a context menu to allow caches to be moved, etc. This is no longer available.

buginformation.summary: Edit "Personal Cache Note" and copy from it
buginformation.description: It is very nice, that c:geo shos the "Personal Cache Note". Additionally it should allow to edit it. And (even more important), it should be possible to copy text from it, e.g. copy coordinates and create a waypoint from them

buginformation.summary: Crash when openning logging screen if connected to wifi network with captive portal.
buginformation.description: There is not enough network input sanitisation. I can look on this, but not now. The problem is, that sometimes you can be connected to wifi network which redirects all http traffic to some page, where you have to insert password. If you are connected to such wifi ... and try to log a cache ... cgeo crashes, instead refusing to log online. (I have suspection that it is something related to trackables, because it works for short period of time (you can type one word or so)).

buginformation.summary: HW acceleration switched off on Android 6.0
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: There are numerous users on support mail, who have graphical problems and stability problems. All of them have in common: They either have a new device with Android 6.0 or recently upgraded to Android 6.0 In all system informations I do see that HW-acceleration is switched off (HW acceleration: disabled (manually changed)) After enabling it, the problems are gone Expected behavior after performing these steps: The users do say that they did not manually change this setting before. Is there any problem in the code, which may lead to the effect, that it is disabled on Android 6.0? Is this setting contained in any (google) backup and might be wrongly restored on a users new device? Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.06.

buginformation.summary: First Waypoint shows text of second waypoint
buginformation.description: Sometimes (unfortunately i cannot reproduce it), the text of the second waypoint is duplicated into the first for saved caches. Screenshot for GC4E28K: „Der Yogi bewacht C und D“ belongs to the second WP, Stage 1. Text for first WP (Start) is gone. This is different from #3420. The error is permanent and persists across refreshes of the saved cache. Also WP detail view shows the wrong text. Unfortunately, the error appears infrequently, and the circumstances are unclear to me. I noticed it 4-5 times during the last months, but never was annoyed enough to open an issue. Version 2015.02.16-NB, but i suspect the error occurs during saving of the cache, which was quite a long time ago now, and thus happened with an older version.

buginformation.summary: Action Bar: Secondary navigation tool?
buginformation.description: Open cache details. You'll see two buttons in the action bar: compass and map. A short press on compass ("primary navigation") starts the compass, a short press on map opens the navigation menu. A long press on both shows a short help tooltip. What I expect: A long press on the compass-button ("secondary navigation") starts the secondary navigation, which is configured in the settings. Currently there is no way to invoke it.

buginformation.summary: Log progress dismissed when tapping on screen
buginformation.description: This was probably in since a long time but not relevant as logging was fast: While a log is being posted (including a picture it might take some time) I tend to tap on the screen to keep it alive. If I tap outside the upload progress window it disappears but the uploading process is still running (as after a while my log is visible on the website).

buginformation.summary: Missing indices in the database
buginformation.description: The indices in my database are: CREATE INDEX in_a on cg_caches (geocode);

buginformation.summary: Navigation bug with filter and list
buginformation.description: in a case, shown menu is not the right one ! Scenario to reproduce the bug : Open a list Filter by type / traditional sort by name long tap on an item to move to another list open filter menu choose type here comes the menu of an item (may be the item under the menu), not the menufor cache's type.

buginformation.summary: NPE checking credentials in preference
buginformation.description: Probably GCVote is the culprit: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.lang.Object org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.ImmutablePair.getLeft()' on a null object reference

buginformation.summary: Units.getSpeed() returns uncommon string
buginformation.description: Today a user told me that c:geo shows "0 m/h" as the speed. That's not miles per hour, but meters per hour. getSpeed() calls getDistanceFromKilometers() which calls scaleDistance(): if (distanceKilometers >= 1) {

buginformation.summary: Waypoint limit for live map not always working
buginformation.description: With the market release (as well as NBs) the functionality of the limit for waypoints showing on the live map is working almost good, but on some occasions it is not working. I can not clearly reproduce this but it is something like this scenario: Live map is running while driving around A saved cache with waypoints is coming in range The count of caches on live map is below my configured limit (in this case: 20) and the WPs are shown The live map keeps periodically loading Suddenly the WPs disappear although the count of caches is still below the limit Closing and reopening live map makes the WPs reappear in this case Set "Unverified" because the described steps are not always reproducible for me.

buginformation.summary: Personal note edit box not ok with light skin

buginformation.summary: Heading line has wrong target when started from compass
buginformation.description: Somehow linked to #4684 but another scenario which I consider a bug: 2015.03.31: Open cache details of a saved cache with waypoint Open waypoint tab Start compass for a waypoint Use title bar map icon to switch to the map Result: Heading line is targeting to the cache coordinates but not to the waypoint previously selected for Navigation

buginformation.summary: Add exif target navigation to picture context menu
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: IOpen a gallery tab of a cache containing georeference pictures (Having our new overlay) Long press on the picture Actual behaviour after performing these steps: Only some "Open with..." options are shown in the menu Expected behaviour after performing these steps: As a click on the overlay can "only" trigger the prefered navigation I would suggest to include the full navigation menu offering all methods in the context menu after long press Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.15-NB Other comments and remarks: This will also make the feature more usable as the user might fail to recognize that clicking the overlay on the picture triggers an navigation action

buginformation.summary: Define types for custom waypoints
buginformation.description: It should be possible to give custom waypoints also a type attribute. For a cache with only custom waypoints for parking, stages and final they are all displayed just as waypoint. At the map the waypoint could then also have the icon for parking or final.

buginformation.description: In the logs of TB4K4FC a recent entry has some encoded HTML in a photo title.

buginformation.summary: Broken string in progress bar for moving caches
sort by date in cache list
buginformation.description: I'm adding an additional comparator to be able to sort event caches by the event date in the list. Sorting by GC code to get the age isn't enough in those cases.

buginformation.summary: Choose map directory in preferences not readable with light theme
buginformation.description: When you have selected the light theme (Android 4.4.4), the button 'Choose directory' in the map selection in the preferences is black on black...

buginformation.summary: Doubled requests when logging in
buginformation.description: Version 2013.12.25-NB If I (clean) start c:geo the log shows that all requests to gc.com seem to be performed twice: 12:33:50.031 Debug cgeo 26625 GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx

buginformation.summary: Use enter key to invoke action in one line input fields
buginformation.description: If you input a keyword in the keyword search and press the return key, the focus jumps to the next input field (or the button, depending on the Android version, as it seems). And this is the same for mainly all other one line input fields, which have a button to invoke an action using the value of the input field. I suggest to instead directly invoke the button action when pressing the enter key in the input field. (And when doing this refactoring, the IME_ACTION_GO should also invoke the same action). Anybody with different opinions?

buginformation.description: Steps: load an EC cache e.g. EC35 you should see the attributes tap the refresh button the attributes disappear

buginformation.summary: Support OC cache size "Nano"
buginformation.description: OC has an additional cache size "nano". Currently c:geo reads it as "micro" size. Example: OC100CB

buginformation.summary: Waypoint edit discarded after screen lock
buginformation.description: When during changing the text and other stuff of a waypoint the screen get's dark (screen lock) the changes are lost after awaking. Edit (Lineflyer): More precise heading

buginformation.summary: Merge between nearby search and map results faulty
buginformation.description: With NB1103 I have seen a lot of "jumping" cache-icons (marked as reliable all the time) on the live map. To that time I used the "speed dependent" strategy, which seemed to cause it. On the start I was not moving so the map was filled with the nearby search, then I started driving and the cache positions started "jumping". Trying to reproduce this, I found the following way: Use "detailed" strategy to populate the map You will get the reliable results from the nearby search (as PM) Change the strategy to "fast" and force update of the map (e.g. by moving a little) Result: Some of the reliable icons may change their position on the map (to a wrong position) Result of nearby search (coords verified with website): Result after update with fast-mode (the multi has moved to a wrong position) :

buginformation.summary: minor fault in waypoint description
buginformation.description: Create a new custom waypoint. Its description in the cache details activity then starts with " . benutzerdefiniert", i.e. some check for an empty/blank string seems to be missing when constructing that string. (assigned to SammysHP because of his changes in that area)

buginformation.summary: Template for cache owner
buginformation.description: Currently log templates only include items about the time and user. Since logging is done in the context of a particular cache, can some items be referenced about the cache too? I am particularly interested in the cache-owner (getOwnerDisplayName()), who many name in their log entries. Unfortunately, I'm only just skilled enough in Java to be dangerous....

buginformation.summary: Waypoint improvements
buginformation.description: Working with waypoints is more awkward than it should be. I propose the following changes to make the experience 'smoother': Remove the save button from edit waypoint, add save and cancel to 'action bar', make 'save' the default action on 'back' Swap short and long press in waypoint list. Short-press - edit, long-press - menu

buginformation.summary: Logbook username not matching to log entry
buginformation.description: Using NB 2013.05.20: After scrolling several times up and down through the listing of GC4BRWM suddenly the logbook entries were no longer matching the username next to it. This means e.g. that the username "ApproV" who initially published the cache was suddenly shown as the user who wrote the FTF-log. It seems something gets misaligned after scrolling so that username and their corresponding log entries get out of sequence.

buginformation.summary: History list jumps to top after returning from CacheDetails
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: have more caches on history than fit on the screen scroll down and open one of the cache details close the details Actual behavior after performing these steps: return to history list jumping to the top of the list Expected behavior after performing these steps: returning to history and stay were you were before Version of c:geo used: Release branch - 6daf3fc Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: Zoom out zooms in on offline maps
buginformation.description: Using latest build with mapsforge 0.3 maps. Steps: Open a map view of caches (via Live Map or Stored) using offline maps Zoom in as far as possible (using double click or zoom in button) Once you can't zoom in any further, click the zoom out button The map will zoom in more instead of zooming out The only way to zoom back out is by pinching the screen. Once the zoom in button is enabled, the zoom out button works correctly.

buginformation.summary: NullPointerException on login without network
buginformation.description: When trying to login and there is no network, a NPE occurs (loginResponse is null in cgBase,454)

buginformation.summary: Found caches shown on live map
buginformation.description: Right now the "Found caches shown on live map" (although hiding is activated) is still on of the most mentioned user problems on our FB-page as well as on support mail. We had a lot of these issues in the past, and all of them have shown that this is mainly resulting in a merge problem of data from different sources. However there might be some issues which I was trying to find out by testing. After chatting with @SammysHP today (and @mucek4 in the past) I created this new issue. Here are some results and (possible) conclusions and suggestions: Test steps: Delete all data of c:geo in app manager to make sure the cachecache and stored caches is empty Start c:geo Enter your user details While still in setting activate "Hide found & owned caches" (and debug log to check tile loading) All other settings remain default Go to main menu, don't restore any database Start live map (for me it starts with Google Maps, 3km/unit zoom) Note: The strategy is set to "Speed dependent" by default, I did not change this setting This means (as I have speed=0 there will be a nearby search on top) Wait until loading is finished The log shows: 2 tiles with Z=11 are loaded and 630 caches are retrieved from that. Additionally a nearby search is performed with positive result. The map shows 170/500 caches Zoom in one step (now 1km/unit) New loading is triggered The log shows: 4 tiles with z=12 are loaded and 190 caches are retrieved from that The maps shows 55/500 caches Zoom in one step (now 800m/unit) The log shows: PM-case: 1 tile with z=13 is loaded and no caches are retrieved (because for that tile I found all caches - PM case) The map is still showing 17 caches as not found which are in fact all found by the user Conclusions: Starting with z=12 the live map on gc.com stars hiding own&found (PM feature) But c:geo is still showing all of them as not found. (This is a merge issue ?!) Due to the cachecache this incorrect state will remain for quite a long time (unless the user opens a cache, performs a nearby search) A nearby search is only performed at the very start of the map action. On zooming in no additional nearby search is performed (most probably as my position did not change ?!). But somehow the results of the nearby search is not taken into consideration. (The nearby search should have already provides the information, that the 17 caches around my position are all found but they still show up later in the test). I see the following optimization potentials: If a particular cache is no longer retrieved from Z=12 tile but still shown in c:geo the probability is very high that this one is a found cache and should also set "Found" in c:geo and thus hidden. (PM only) Note: In case the tile has no data, the request for map.inforeturns a 204 error. Initial zoom of 3km immediately leads to this problem for all first time users or users not using the zoom feature very often. We should reconsider the initial map zoom. We could even consider not loading tiles with Z<12 but always request Z=12 minimum. In this case app performance, loading time and sever load should be considered as well as there should be a max zoom level in this case to avoid endless loading. There is something wrong with the usage of the nearby search result. It is not taken into the merging somehow.. I can not clearly tell whether this already happens at the initial zoom or is lost at subsequent reloads due to zoom in (as the map was packed with caches and I could not clearly see whether they have been hidden initially) In areas with high cache density already Z=11 retrieved more caches than we are able to show (limited to 500) which leads to some sideeffects (i.e. moving the map causes some already displayed caches to disappear as new caches are loaded). However in low density area loading tiles with a low zoom can make sense, so it is a difficult question how to manage this at all. Thinking about the implemented strategy selector we could e.g. only load with z=12 at the minumum (see 2.) if the user selects "Detailed"/"Speed dependent" (which is default) but allow Z<12 for "Fast" and "Fastest" mode. Note: I also tested as BM. There result is mainly identical although the conditions are different: Starting with Z=12 we retrieve the found info by PNG-parsing (I can not see this in the logs) but as the result has no difference I assume that also a cache parsed as Found when zooming in is not merged correctly as well. The nearby search returns the found state also for BM but the problem is the same as mentioned above. Tested with version 2013.06.02-NB-fa71747

buginformation.summary: Move selected caches to a new list not possible
buginformation.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to lists Select one or several cache(s) Press Menu and Select "Manage" -> "Move selected" Create a new list in the dialogue shown(!) Result: New list is created but cache(s) not moved to that list Expectation: New list created and caches moved to that list If the list is already existing, moving is working normal.

buginformation.summary: GSAK field notes export
buginformation.description: According to a report on Facebook, GSAK expects the log type in the fields note to use mixed case, e.g., "Found it", while we currently use "found it".

buginformation.summary: Load more results not working

buginformation.summary: History of Navigate any Location does not allow navigation other than compass, no edit
buginformation.description: This is a request for frontend improvement: the "navigate any location" activity has a history of past locations entered. However, its use is currently rathing limited. In particular: the user can only delete a history waypoint or navigate using the compass. the user cannot navigate any other method, such as maps, et cetera. A long tap on a waypoint brings up only the option to delete. the user cannot recall a history waypoint. My suggestion is to change the activity as follows: when the user taps on a history waypoint, its coordinates get transferred to the input field. No navigation is done yet. the user then may choose to edit the waypoint or navigate using the same methods as when entering a new waypoint. the existing "shortcut" of tapping on a history waypoint and navigating by compass should be removed as its use conflicts with easy recall, editing, and navigating by other means.

While we don't know the number of caches in advance, we should at least set the title of the list before we actually load its caches, to avoid that "jumping".

Any suggestions how I can determine the image urls because there is no direct connection from the cache data to the images. The image gallery has to be parsed at first.... buginformation.summary: Crash on apply filter in lists
buginformation.description: I tried to set an filter for attribute/medium hike in my lists of 600 caches. Several times but not always I get a FC like this: I/SqliteDatabaseCpp(30951): sqlite returned: error code = 1, msg = no such column: cg_logs_offline.log, db=/data/data/cgeo.geocaching/databases/data

buginformation.summary: Clear up GPS status in cache list activity
buginformation.description: As in several other activities, the GPS is turned on when entering a cache list in onResume() and turned off (if noone else requires it) in onPause(). In parallel, we try to be clever by turning it off while refreshing caches, and turning if back on when the refresh is finished (regularly or through a user cancel). This two cycles do not cope well with each other. It led to #3521 where the GPS will stay turned on after we navigate away from the activity or from cgeo entirely. The fix is only partial, and will lead to the GPS not being turned on spontaneously when a list refresh is cancelled (but will resume regular behaviour when navigating away from the activity by going back in cgeo or by displaying the details of a cache). I think we try to be too clever here. The questions we should ask ourselves are: Do we need the GPS to be turned on while displaying a cache list? Do we need the GPS to be turned off while refreshing the caches? Note that keeping the GPS turned on may be overriden by an explicit user action (the user is always free to disable the GPS and this is easy to do from the status bar on most devices), and preserve an up-to-date distance and direction (if the GPS is used for it) for the caches displayed in the background window. What do you think we should be doing? Should we keep being clever or should we adopt more simple an approach?
