buginformation.summary: Exporting caches to Locus
buginformation.description: Hello, Is possible to implement some option for exporting caches (from Stored) to Locus? I know I can send them to Locus using Menu-Show on map-Locus. But it doesn't save them to Locus' database so it's not possible to use some features for them (such as downloading map around caches or displaying 161 m circles)... I found that if I cachange last parameter in DisplayData.sendData function (AbstractLocusApp.java, line 81) to true, Locus asks for saving caches - that's exactly what I need. So it'll be great if you'd add something like Menu-Show on map-Export to Locus. It wouldn't be that difficult, wouldn't it? Thank you! BTW I asked author of Locus about saving these temporary caches and he replied me it would be very complicated and easiest way is to ask you for implementing this straight to c:geo.

buginformation.summary: Page parsing impossible due to proxies on mobile network
buginformation.description: I would like to take the posting from @BudBundi to the issuetracker to start a discussion: TB Page not correct load with vodafone DE Beitragvon BudBundi » 06 Aug 2013, 23:05 I have told that to some of you on the MEGA Eck when load a TB Page over the Vodafone DE Network it isn't showing correct. So I investigate in that a little and found that the vodafone proxy try to optimize the HTML and delete some empty divs and not used styles. You can change that when load http://perfomance.vodafone.de and change the settings to optimize off or in expert settings optimize html off. Perhaps that is something for the FAQ. Adding this to the FAQ is one point, but another point would be to compare the HTML-output with both settings and see whether we can optimize our parsing so that this optimization does not have any impact to it. As far as I know these performance proxy installation they usually only strip "unnecessary" HTML-content (like comments, unsued scripts, etc.) from pages and additionally compress pictures requested in that HTML before transfering it to the user. So it is somehow strange that these break our parsing. I also met a user recently with the same problem on Telekom-D1 network in Germany. So it is not specific to one operator but may spread widely with all operators using that kind of proxy. Here are the infos provided by the german network operators: D1: http://www.t-mobile.de/speedmanager/0,20641,24079-_,00.html VF:http://www.vodafone.de/business/hilfe-support/vodafone-performance-manager.html E+: Proxy introduction was stopped (AFAIK) 02: Proxy program was live but terminated after a few months (AFAIK)

Yes System information:

buginformation.summary: NPE crash in History view on Drop or Move
buginformation.description: From Bonemaro. Steps: Go to History view Long press on an entry and select Drop or Move to Other List NPE occurs when the code tries to refresh the list (after drop or move completed) Crash is from cgeocaches.switchListById because app.getList return a null list. I think the fix can just be check for null list and return if present. We don't actually need to reload the history list as dropping a cache or moving to another list doesn't affect the history list. (On a side note, it might be confusing because the user is not actually dropping from history list or moving from history list, but I like the functionality present there as it allows easily taking action on all caches you have found)

Happend to me since some weeks in nightly on mobile network as well as on wifi. buginformation.summary: Wrong URL used for smilies in logs
buginformation.description: Look for a geocache whose logs contain smilies and scroll the logs (for example http://coord.info/GC3E9YP). Noticed on master, probably present on release as well. 01-16 17:52:28.805 D/cgeo (12966): [OkHttp] GET https://www.geocaching.comhttps//www.geocaching.com/images/icons/icon_smile_big.gif

buginformation.summary: New map: Overlays not updated
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map (new map) Click on unsaved cache Select Save Actual behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay not shown for the cache Expected behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay shown. Working with old mapsforge implementation. Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.17-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Same may apply for deleting a cache or updating icon after posting found log

buginformation.summary: Configurable directory for "Import GPX"
buginformation.description: my c:geo version is 03.01 RC2, running on a Samsung Galaxy SII with Gingerbread 2.3.3 When I select "Import GPX" from the Import menu c:geo scans my complete SD card (actually both cards because the SII has internal storage which gets mounted as "sd" card and place for an second card as well). Scanning all that storage takes 5-10 minutes. I'd like to set the directory c:geo looks into for PQ's, usually I am pretty well aware where I (actually, the dropsync client) put my PQs on the SD card.

buginformation.summary: OC: Cache count not updated after online log
buginformation.description: I just logged my third OC cache online using c:geo. The website correctly shows this, the main activity is still showing 2 caches only.

buginformation.summary: Crash while opening certain cache
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: From Facebook: Open GC6661W Actual behavior after performing these steps: c:geo crashes reproducibly Expected behavior after performing these steps: Cache details should be opened Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.09 (and current master) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: 23:20:10.071 Debug cgeo 18728 [network-8] GeokretyConnector.searchTrackables: wpt=GC6661W

buginformation.summary: Confused strings in connector setup
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services Note: No "Active" subtitle for geocaching.su Enter menu for geocaching.su Note: Subtitle of Activate item shows "Load caches from geocaching.su" Activate the item Actual behavior after performing these steps: Subtitle now shows "true"/"false" depending on the active state of the checkbox Additionally on leaving the menu the service list does not show "Active" for geocaching.su Only on leaving and reentering the settings menu the behaviour is correct again. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The subtitle within the geocaching.su setup should remain unchanged "Active" should be shown in the services overview menu Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: @Bananeweizen

buginformation.summary: Delete from list not possible
buginformation.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to stored caches list Long press on a cache Select "Delete" Result: Cache remains stored Expected: Cache deleted from device

buginformation.summary: hide empty sections in trackable view
buginformation.description: TB2T01N has no description, but we show an empty section.

buginformation.summary: Do not check bounds when creating Geopoint
buginformation.description: As we generalize the use of Geopoint, we get it by the fact that Google Location objects are not always in the expected bounds. In particular, our current adjustments are probably wrong when dealing with a viewport which encompasses the 180° meridian. Any latitude and longitude should be accepted. Since we use Android methods to compute distances and bearings, we do not have to deal ourselves with wrap around and such.

buginformation.summary: Crash on "Show as list" from live map
buginformation.description: From facebook and reproducible for me: Open live map Wait until loading finished Select Menu -> Show as list Result: 03-27 14:58:49.265 E/AndroidRuntime(10576): FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: Find count not correct if switch to english is performed
buginformation.description: 2014.01.03-NB1: Steps: Set language to "German" on gc.com website Clean start c:geo Result: On the main screen Username(0) is shown instead of the correct find count Log: 14:12:08.750 Debug cgeo 565 GET http://status.cgeo.org/api/status.json?version_code=30140103&version_name=2014.01.03-NB1-ac278a2&locale=de_DE

buginformation.summary: Option to download PQ from list
buginformation.description: Currently we have PQ reader, that displays 20 at the time. The most seen usecase I see from users is. They make PQ, download it, import it and then "refresh all" as PQ just does not contains all the informations a normal cacher needs in c:geo. The request is. Have an option to directly download all caches from PQ reader. Not just 20 at the time.

buginformation.summary: Sygic support
buginformation.description: Like Navigon support I like to request support for Sygic http://www.sygic.com/en

buginformation.summary: No progress on static map imports
buginformation.description: Since the some days when importing GPX the progress windows for saving static maps does not show the progress correctly. The progress-bar stays unfilled and instead of percentage NaN is shown. Currently I am not sure if the map download is working at all...this has to be checked, therefore setting to "Medium" at the moment.

buginformation.summary: Missing back pressure on location observable
buginformation.description: Play report on 12.12.2014, 18:15, c:geo version 20141209, likely the same in 20141212, Android version 4.4, no user comment. Stacktrace: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. Add `onError` handling.

buginformation.summary: FC when opening link from TB-view
buginformation.description: Found in NB2012.07.09 (not tested before): Open TB4CWJX Click on the link to the cache embedded in the description FC Log: W/dalvikvm(23918): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x40a321f8)

buginformation.summary: Search result cannot be saved
buginformation.description: 2016.01.17-RC3: Search nearby caches Press menu button on search result list -> No "Save for offline" option Also you can trigger the selection mode, select caches but there is no menu option what to do with this selection anymore.

buginformation.summary: Will attend not counted in log summary on OC-logbooks
buginformation.description: Open OC10CB8 In the logbook summary on the logbook tab the "WIll attend" logs (and maybe other log types as well??) are not counted

buginformation.summary: Store for offline not working from Map view
buginformation.description: If I do a search using a place name, it brings up a list of the caches. If I then map that location I can see where they are. From that screen, if I choose Store for Offline, nothing happens. If I return to the list view and do it from there, no problem. Still a great app. Thanks.

buginformation.summary: Mark waypoints as done/visited
buginformation.description: There are many multis, whrere you need to collect indicies from many wpts spread whole city ... and it is obvious, that it is not possible, that you can not get all info in one day. So I have an idea, that wpts could be marked by user that you have visited that place and gathered info. This mark should hide wpt from map and differentiate it in wpts list. Does it make sense for you?

buginformation.summary: GCC not available for navigation
buginformation.description: With the new navigation method selection I realized that the method "GCC" is greyed out for me, although I have GCC installed on my device. Maybe the reason could be, that I use the "GCC Pro" version?

buginformation.summary: Live map should start at last position if not fixed to current position
buginformation.description: A feature request from support mail which I fully agree to: Open the live map Move it manually to the desired location (which means "fix to current position" is off) Leave the live map Enter the live map again Result: It starts at the current position ("fixed to current position" is on again) Desired behaviour: In case the map was moved to another position before it was closed it should open again on this very position (right now we only store the last zoom but it seems not the last position)

buginformation.summary: For single map cache show T/D in subtitle
buginformation.description: When running the map with a single cache we can use the subtitle for additional information like d and t.

buginformation.summary: ECConnector does not check validity of credentials properly
buginformation.description: From release 2016.01.19: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread.

buginformation.summary: Live map handling became massively instable with latest nightlies
buginformation.description: More a reminder to myself to take a closer look later Either its the server once again or something within cgeo. E.g. the following makes cgeo crash in a high percentage of cases: Open live map While map is still loading click on a saved cache Click to open details from popup Using mapsforge beta with nightly 2016.11.12

buginformation.description: Release 2014.04.01. java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to stop service cgeo.geocaching.speech.SpeechService@44351200: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Selection for adding to fsvorites no longer shown
buginformation.description: 2016.02.04-NB The logging view does no longer show the option to add a cache to your favorites, although I am PM and favorite points are available. Already noticed this some days (nightlies) ago...or a site change?

buginformation.summary: Export field notes progress indication not correct
buginformation.description: When exporting field notes the progress indication is incorrect. Start export to field notes on a list with 50 caches where one of them has an offline log stored Result: Expectation: The total number should be the number of caches with an offline log (or the number of caches really uploaded in case of "since last export" was selected). Version: 2013.07.24-NB-bc584a3

buginformation.summary: Wrong image when opening a spoiler with Photos
buginformation.description: When clicking on a spoiler image and opening it with the Photos app, another image is displayed (in my case a spoiler from a previously visited cache). Sometimes the other image is displayed during less than 1 second and the actual spoiler is displayed after that but darker than usual.

buginformation.summary: Poor notification when unable to send log
buginformation.description: When you made online log and you are on really bad connection c:geo is sometimes unable to send log. It's only notified as toast and it's almost the same text as found. I suggest when c:geo fails to send log a popup window should be displayed. Something like c:geo failed to post log because server is not responding. and options. Retry, save offline, go back to editing

buginformation.summary: Problem on editing waypoint coordinates
buginformation.description: I found two problems when editing waypoints, but i believe they are related to each other. I found this in the emulator. Don't know if it's easy to reproduce on a real device. The location is set to Longitude 13,8 and Latitude 51,3. When creating a new waypoint from current location in format DDD° MM.MMM the initial displayed value (grey text) is "N 51 18.000" and "E 013 48.000" (without °). But when opening the popup to edit the coordinates the north value is displayed as "N 51° 17.1000" ! (18.000 == 17.1000?) Create a new waypoint. The proposed value (from current location is X) Then click to change the coordinates to another value Y, press "Done" but not Save. Change the value again and the popup to edit the coordinates is initialized with value X (and not Y as expected).

buginformation.summary: Caches not visible in TB log entries
buginformation.description: 2015.02.22-NB If I am not completely wrong the TB logbook normally contains the geocache name alongside with dropped, retrieve and visit logs. However for me the TB TB4TXR0 does not show them in the logbook. Did not check if only this one or all TBs are affected. Maybe a website change or I just remember incorrect.

buginformation.summary: have "attended" as initial selection, when already logged "will attend"
buginformation.description: For event caches, if there is already a "will attend" log by the current user, then the initial selection in the log type field should be "attended" (to save one click of the user).

buginformation.summary: Crash in PocketQueryListActivity
buginformation.description: With 2016.01.19: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread.

buginformation.summary: Compass values are outside the [0, 360[ range
buginformation.description: The value returned by the sensor for the orientation falls into the [0, 360[ range. However, when the direction is adjusted for the phone orientation through Compatibility#getDirectionNow(), a value as large as 270 may be added. This might be the cause (or one of the causes) of the problems recently discovered with the compass.

The settings show my selection correctly but the map stays with GoogleMaps. I am on the road right now...will provide more details later. Can someone reproduce?

buginformation.summary: Default event log type should depend on date
buginformation.description: Starting from event date the default should be "attended", before that it should be "will attend"

buginformation.summary: TB not visible (maybe related to special characters)
buginformation.description: I have a problem with logging the TB http://www.geocaching.com/track/details.aspx?id=4079615 as visited. On the geocaching site, I see on the log page all my TBs to log visited/dropped etc, in c:geo, this TB is missing and I see only the other two ones. Maybe it's the fault of the special characters. The name of the TB is currently " Schlauchen&ravestorm=<3 ".

buginformation.summary: Color of "Note" log type changed
buginformation.description: With 2015.08.22-NB I just realized that "Note" logs are no longer shown with a grey color strip in a cache logbook but with a somehow white strip with grey ends. As i did not closely follow the changes of last weeks I am not sure if this was intended or a side effect of another change.

buginformation.summary: GPS reference count mismatch
buginformation.description: If you go to a list of stored cache, refresh them all and cancel the operation in the middle, the GPS (which had been turned off during the refresh) will be turned back on twice (this is reference counted). It means that it will no longer be turned off when not needed, and will even stay on if we switch to another application. This can lead to a battery drain.

buginformation.summary: Support GeoLutins trackables
buginformation.description: Long time ago I've contacted David, the GeoLutins owner, asking him if he agree with an integration of GL in c:geo. He replied yesterday, and was enthusiast. He proposed a simple API to lookup GL. He also added a GL[0-9AZ]{5,} pattern to lookup GL. The c:geo icon was added on his website just near this "new GL numbers" http://www.geolutins.com/profil_geolutin.php?ID_Geolutin_Selectionne=1976. Is there a problem with that? Main API url, is as of today: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/api.php?G=GLXXXXX There is also a converter from Tracking Numbers to GL numbers: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/decode.php?G=00000000-000 ( [0-9]{8}-[0-9]{3} ) I've done a proof of concept, I still need to clean a bit the code.

buginformation.summary: Drop down menu in selections problems
buginformation.description: Drop down menu for selecting stored caches maps: is dark when light skin is selected has smaller font when dark skin is selected

buginformation.summary: OSM offline/online cards mode doesn't work with Android 4.2
buginformation.description: Since I've updated my Google Nexus 7 tablet from 4.1.2 to the official Android 4.2 release this week c:geo crashes every time I switch from Google Online Map to OSM Offline/Online map. Let's be clearer: I can open a OSM map and I am able to zoom in or out for more or less detail but when I try to move the map to change the position the application is crashing every time. I tried both maps version 0.3.0 and 0.2.4. It was working fine with Android 4.1. Thanks a lot, Vikala2011

buginformation.summary: Null pointer in SettingsActivity.java when loading navigation app preferences
buginformation.description: main/src/cgeo/geocaching/settings/SettingsActivity.java:155 The call getPreference(appEnum.preferenceKey) can return null when another app on the device has an intent-filter that responds to cgeo.geocaching.wear.NAVIGATE_TO. Take SkeletonApp or any sample, add this intent-filter to it, and install the app. c:geo will crash on startup.

buginformation.summary: Trackable image to small
buginformation.description: Just comparing the trackable TB3KX4V in the browser and in the app. The image is much bigger in the browser. Are we fetching a small one?

buginformation.summary: click preview map to invoke navigation
buginformation.description: What do you think about showing the navigation menu when clicking the preview map? I'm not sure, but I think it was that way in the old version, too.

buginformation.summary: Popup on live map should open before requesting more details
buginformation.description: Edit Lineflyer: Changed title and label to match remaining problem. In opposite to the GC.com live map we don't do an additional request when tapping on a cache in Live Map. The advantage of implementing this feature request is that not the complete cache description is requested but only some small JSON infos. Maybe a good task for @campeb or @marco-jacob ?

buginformation.summary: c:geo crashes on first fix
buginformation.description: With NB 2013.10.03 I experienced several crashes in different parts of the app which didnot stop until I deactivated oc.de. NB 2013.10.02 was quite stable. So my assumption (which is totally unvalidated due to lack of logging capability) would be that something with the oc.de interface is broken from yesterday to today. A focus area of the crashes are in the search field when searching for cache name or GC-code. Reproducible for me was: Search for "GC4" Progress window is shown but before cache is displayed c:geo crashes Note: OC.de was activated in parallel to gc.com to that time I am outside the OC.de area (>200km rule applies) Edit: changed title according to description from @AlfredSK

buginformation.summary: Test fails for me: cgeoApplicationTest.testSearchByViewportNotLoggedIn
buginformation.description: This test fails for me and I have no clue why. I get a search result with coordinates even though I am not logged in (sign in box and link in page). So the test fails as the coordinates are reliable. How is this working out for the others?

buginformation.summary: View all waypoints of a cache in an external app
buginformation.description: From support mail: Currently I can map a list of caches in an external app (like Locus or maps.me). Great feature! (Map - Menu - Show on map - ) The same thing should be possible from the waypoint tab of a cache to get all its waypoints shown on the external app.

buginformation.summary: 'More'-search doesn't work any more
buginformation.description: I assume by the recent changes in the connector framework, the currently gc.com-specific 'more'-search was broken. Even though it is a regression, IMO it is not very critical. Instead of re-activating this short-term, we should rather try to generalize it (as it is available for OKAPI as well) mid-term.

buginformation.summary: History list not refreshed after clearing
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open history Menu → Clear history Actual behavior after performing these steps: The caches in the history list are still shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The list should be empty. If you go back to the start screen and then again to the history, it will be empty. Version of c:geo used: 52db0cc

buginformation.summary: Remove from watchlist unsuccessful
buginformation.description: With nightly build 2011.08.10 I can add caches to my watchlist succesfully. But if I want to remove them the message "Ändern der Watchlist nicht erfolgreich" appears. I checked on the website and confirmed the cache is still on my watchlist. I tried 10 different caches, it is never working to remove from watchlist.

buginformation.summary: Log.e when live map loading returns no caches
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map for an area without caches Actual behavior after performing these steps: App seems to work normal(?) but log shows exceptions Expected behavior after performing these steps: Not sure if current behaviour has a negative functional impact, still log shows a log.e which it should not Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.11-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: 20:30:39.385 Error cgeo 14863 [RxComputationScheduler-1] GCMap.searchByViewport: No cache parsed for viewport (N 51° 19,696 · E 007° 01,435,N 51° 21,883 · E 007° 03,659)

buginformation.summary: .gpx import fails to recognize most caches in TX Challenge package
buginformation.description: Attended the 2012 Texas Challenge this past weekend. 45 minutes prior to the start of the challenge, the cache information was distributed on a stick to each team. ALL of the other devices, mostly Garmin but others too, recognized all of the files. My Droid X2 (on 2.3.4) with c:geo only recognized the multi-caches and the First Aid entries. Most of the caches were not accessible. I am guessing it is a parsing error, but don't know the syntax well enough to determine the failure for you. I will be glad to forward the original .gpx file for you to test. (not sure how to attach it to this report). To reproduce, load it into any Garmin (or probably most others) and Import. This will let you see the list of 130 or so items. Then load into c:geo and Import. Most aren't there. John

buginformation.summary: java.lang.SecurityException accessing location through gms
buginformation.description: We regularly get such crashes fro Android 6.0 and 7.0 devices. I could reproduce it by denying location access for c:geo in the app settings. Perhaps we should try to expect this, capture it and inform the user accordingly. java.lang.SecurityException: Client must have ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission to request PRIORITY_HIGH_ACCURACY locations.

buginformation.summary: Auto suggest to delete empty list
buginformation.description: Some time ago the menu item "Delete caches&list" has been removed (AFAIR to reduce the amount of menu items). The drawback is, that if a user now wants to delete a list of caches including the list itself (common use case) he has to perform to separate actions which is not user friendly: Menu - Delete all caches Menu - Delete list I suggest to show a prompt asking for deletion of the active list if after a delete or move action it is detected that the list is empty. This would be a convenient solution without need for another menu item.

buginformation.summary: Change icon in map for caches with offline log
buginformation.description: Imagine there are several similar caches located in a small area. All are saved in a list, but the names are long with a appending number. So they are hard to distinguish. On the map started from the list all look also the same because they are of the same type. Now during the cache tour every cache is logged offline as found (or DNF) and in the list they are marked. But on the map they look still similar. It would be an improvement to "mark" them also on the map. Maybe an overlay or a slightly changed color could do it.

buginformation.summary: Have settings active by default
buginformation.description: Ask for list

buginformation.summary: Performance is sluggish with latest releases
buginformation.description: I have noticed a slow down in performance recently, so much so, that I feel it is worth commenting on. I am using a Note II, so processor power & memory should not be an issue. When loading lists, there is a noticeable delay in loading. The main list I use has about 300 entries. Lists with more items (2000 entries) take considerably longer to load. When I try to load 'all lists', the phone hangs - and if lucky, I get an 'application is busy, wait or close' dialogue. I am using NB from 17-Mar. I loaded the NB from 23-Mar, and the behaviour was worse, so I uninstalled and reverted. (Is there a way to revert without uninstalling first?)

buginformation.summary: Wrong count of stored caches
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Look at text balloon on Stored main screen icon or Open Stored activity Open cache list drop-down menu Actual behavior after performing these steps: In my case, it display 321 stored caches but there is really 12 caches stored. Expected behavior after performing these steps: 12 caches should be displayed on main screen drop-down list should also display 12 caches for 'All caches' entry. Version of c:geo used: Current master 3f5c1c9 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Leaving search function on main screen broken
buginformation.description: Press the search icon on the top of the main screen Press back to close keyboard Press back again -> Another(?) search field appears instead of the search field beeing closed

buginformation.summary: Graphical problems in DirChooser
buginformation.description: After implementation of #1901 (SimpleDirChooser) I tested it a little. Its a nice implementation but when scrolling through the available directory I see some temporary graphical problems which I try to describe below: While the list of directories is scrolling I can see some dark brown bars flickering along Furthermore the remains of the directory names as they are scrolled are also flickering on their original position for a second Its hard to describe but maybe @marco-jacob can reproduce it.

buginformation.summary: Cache not removed from history after offline log deleted
buginformation.description: 2015.02.21-NB Log a cache offline Verify it is added to the history Open the cache again and delete the offline log by Menu - Log offline - Delete (or whatever the menu is called in english) The cache keeps showing up in the history permanently (also after app restart)

buginformation.summary: NPE while exporting GPX
buginformation.description: With 2014.02.04. java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: List entries get lost frequently
buginformation.description: Since I use the NB11.09.11 or later, I have the problem, that caches disappear from the saved lists. Reproduce: open live map and save caches shown on the map verify the amount of stored caches in the saved list from homescreen open Nearby Caches, just scroll through the list and return back to homescreen open saved list and you will see that some or sometimes all of the saved caches are gone

buginformation.summary: have number of caches in list selection
buginformation.description: Currently the cache list shows the list name and number of caches in the title. If you select another list, it only shows the titles of the other lists in the selection, but we could also have the number of caches in brackets for each list.

buginformation.summary: Internal parse error with BigDecimal
buginformation.description: Several reports indicate that there might be a problem with BigDecimal creation used in DMM.java and DMS.java. An intermediate string seems to be created then parsed, and this string might contain extra characters at the end such as ")". We could investigate this problem by looking into the various Android runtimes, or we could probably just use double for the computation, as it is likely that it is enough for what we want to compute, while not introducing rounding errors. java.lang.NumberFormatException: -001544)

buginformation.summary: Compass starts without being chosen
buginformation.description: When the Navigate menu is selected, the compass is displayed without being chosen. (My Default Navigation is set to Map) Steps: Open a list of caches (can be Stored or Nearby) Long press a cache to open the menu Select Navigate About the same time the menu is displayed, the compass will show up. Hitting back takes you back to the Navigate menu where you can then select something other than Compass. I thought this might have been due to refactoring by Bananeweizen in 9b0459d, but the previous commit has the same problem.

buginformation.summary: OC-caches no longer shown on live map
buginformation.description: In pull request #1035 there seems to be a minor bug: OC-caches stored in lists used to be shown on the live map. Now I can see that they just "flash" for a short time if I move the live map to an area with stored OC-caches and then disappear. Can someone confirm this ?

buginformation.summary: NullPointerException in CGeoMap.DisplayRunnable#run
buginformation.description: In 2012.06.06, also in 2012.06.01 (at line 1220): java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Finalize multi list UI (first step for release)
buginformation.description: In order to optimize the usability of the possibility to have a cache on more than on list: Instead of the new multiple buttons for ¨Remove from list¨ couldn`t we just make the list selection dialog checkbox based and keep the remaining UI elements on cache details as they have been before? IMHO this would have some advantages: Moving a cache from one list to another currently got more complicated than before No cluttering of buttons on cache detals page Simultanous storing to multiple lists possible in one dialog Doing it like this would also bring it more into the direction of the discussed ¨tag¨ strategy

buginformation.summary: huge empty space on devices without compass
buginformation.description: Small screen devices without compass have a huge empty space instead of the compass switch button.

buginformation.summary: Click on filter bar crashes c:geo
buginformation.description: Seems d8c5377 is not working correctly: Set filter to Multi-Cache Open live map Click on filter-bar Result: "cgeo stopped" No log yet, because using a S3 with 4.1.

buginformation.summary: No logs for users without date format preset
buginformation.description: 2016.10.23 Two French-speaking users have reported that they cannot see the logs associated with a cache. The log tab says that there are none. The one I exchanged mails with (on support) is a basic member.

buginformation.summary: Detailed mode in live-map returns reliable caches for BM
buginformation.description: With NB1503 (and probably also before that) I resetted the DB and logged in as basic member. The strategy for live map was set to "detailed". As a result I get the 20 caches around shown as reliable (no orange circle) but in fact, the cache positions are only approximated from the map. So I don't think they should be marked reliable. As a verification I opened the details for some reliable-shown caches and afterwards closed and reopened the live map. I have seen all of them jumping to their correct position. I marked this issue as "high" because I think only 100% matching coords should be regarded as reliable.

buginformation.summary: Empty strings added to capability list
buginformation.description: If any of the first 4 standard capabilities is missing, it will be replaced by an empty string instead of removing the item completely.

buginformation.summary: sorting wrong after switching between event list and normal list
buginformation.description: c:geo automatically sorts event lists by date by default. when switching between an event only list and a normal list, the sorting somtimes is wrong, i.e. the normal list is then also sorted by date and vice versa.

buginformation.summary: Deleting geocache in "History" don't work (+related problem)
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open history long press on a cache press "drop" > Message "Deleted 1 Cache" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache is still stored (in history and everywhere else) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Cache should be deleted (in all lists) Version of c:geo used: 2016.09.06-RC Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Device: SM-G800F (kminiltexx, samsung) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49H.G800FXXU1ANJ2 Cgeo version: 2016.09.06-RC Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation vector sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Magnetometer & Accelerometer sensor: present Direction sensor used: rotation vector Hide own/found: true Map strategy: auto HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: de_DE Log date format: 12/09/2016 Debug mode active: no (cgeo forced to English) Geocaching sites enabled: geocaching.com: Logged in (Login OK) / PREMIUM Installed cgeo plugins: calendar Other comments and remarks: There is an other probably related Problem: For normal I delete all caches after export field notes in history list from the device by marking it with select mode but that is also not possible any more. In select mode there is no more "drop" or "delete" for this list. I don't want found caches on the device and I don't like to search for them in other lists every time. (Possible with all lists > filter > with offline logs - but deleting in history was much easier.)

buginformation.summary: FC after clean install
buginformation.description: Deleted my emulator (some problems after update) and recreated it. After installing c:geo and starting it I got this: FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: Remember last list selection
buginformation.description: Sometimes I store caches one by one from the live map. Every time I have to select the same list(s) again and again. Previously we had the "ask for list" option, now I suggest to add an option to remember the last list selection for storing a cache. This is somehow related to the requested long-press in #5839 as it removes the additional work for selecting a list.

buginformation.summary: Offline-map search does not scan all locations
buginformation.description: On my Asus Transformer (Android 4.0.3) the MicroSD is mounted at /Removable/MicroSD/. Also Locus stores the vector maps at this location (Removable/MicroSD/Locus/mapsVector). If I scan for offline maps in c:geo settings it does not find *.map files located in this directory and I have to manually input the path.

buginformation.summary: Smileys on TB-page not loading
buginformation.description: I don't know whether this is new or has been there ever since: If a TB-description contains smileys from gc.com c:geo only displays a image-placeholder (Red x). Example: TB3F651

buginformation.summary: No arrow on map
buginformation.description: I can't see the arrow indicating my position on the map with master/HEAD. When I press the "center on location" button, the map is centered correctly, also follows my movements. But the arrow itself is not shown. It's the same with Mapsforge (online/offline) and Google. Will try to bisect.

buginformation.summary: New settings: Not possible to change gc.com login
buginformation.description: I tried to change the existing login to a new one but was not successful: Entered a new username Entered a new password Selected "Check Login" Result: The confirmation is shown for the old user I tried to force stop c:geo and checked the login after startup...I am still logged int with the old user name. Looking into the setting I see the new username here but still the old one is used. I am also missing the possibility to reset the login data like it was possible in the old settings.

buginformation.summary: Export GPX loses log author names
buginformation.description: I exported a cache and then imported it. I noticed that the log author names were no longer shown. I opened the exported GPX in EasyGPS and it also doesn't recognize log author names. Can anyone else duplicate?

buginformation.summary: unpublished caches not recognized
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: NPE with new bugfix release
buginformation.description: According to Play Console this happens with the new version 2014.11.03: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: export crashes on missing hidden date
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Favorite status and button missing for Charter Members
buginformation.description: From support mail: I user is missing the button for adding a cache to his favorites. He send along a screenshot which seems to confirm, that the whole favorite line is missing. Login is checked OK, all other functions normal. Any idea? I asked him to crosscheck another device and another user on his device. Waiting for answer. To only "unusual" thing I noticed up to now is, that the user has a 5-digit find count. Might this influence the parsing at that point?

buginformation.summary: NPE in switchMyLocationButton
buginformation.description: In 2014.08.29 on Android 3.2 (where the button is not visible as the menu bar is not visible). java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Duplicate filter for offline logs
buginformation.description: As noticed by one of our translators, the filter for offline logs is actually implemented twice. https://crowdin.com/translate/cgeo/80/en-hu#14917:drl:531:kia71

buginformation.summary: Link to spoiler not available
buginformation.description: Tested with four caches (not my own) and they all don't have a link to spoiler in the cache description. This seems to affect also stored caches with the newest nightly. I am quite sure, that these stored caches had the spoiler link and picture available but now it is gone (cache was not updated). So I guess it is rather not a problem with the recent site-update but a problem within c:geo which came in recently.

buginformation.summary: Switch from history to other list by title click
buginformation.description: When being in the history list, the title click does not lead to a list selection pop-up. It does nothing. This is surprising for users, therefore this should just work in all lists without any special exception.

buginformation.summary: Favorite points not updated in cache details after adding it to your favorites
buginformation.description: 2014.12.16-NB Have a saved found cache Open caches details and select "Add to favorites" The online operation is succesful but the shown amount of favorite points is not increased After refresh the correct number is shown This used to work fine in some past version, but is reproducibly not working in the current NB

buginformation.summary: Online logging not stored
buginformation.description: offline stored cache open details log offline --> select "log cache" in menu write text, log online toast says that everything is ok cache not labeled as "found" (details and list), no log in log page kill process doesn't help refresh cache from details --> labeled as "found" and log in log page Didn't try to reproduce yet.

buginformation.summary: Got FC with latest build version
buginformation.description: I can't get the nightly build version running (tested 2303), I get a FC as soon as I click on any button, only "About" is working. I saw you have done a lot of good work, but I can't enjoy it :( Android 1.6 running on Archos 5 Internet Tablet Latest known c:geo version running is the current market version (04.01.2012).

buginformation.summary: Attached images get rotated
buginformation.description: While attaching pictures on my mobile (Samsung Galaxy S3) to a cache, I notice that the pictures get rotated. I've tried taking landscape and portrait and each time they are rotated. This happens when taking "New" pictures. Could the problem be fixed, or provide a way for the picture to be rotated in the app? Very happy to provide any extra information.

buginformation.summary: Make list sorting permanent
buginformation.description: From support mail: Please remember "Sort By" in the lists. I usually sort by "Date stored on device" or sometimes "Favorites" and would like to keep that at least during one session or better permanently. I have to select it all the time again and again.

buginformation.summary: wrong creation of search result in loader
buginformation.description: We throw a wrong error message during every re-load of a cache list: 22:24:30.890 Error cgeo 17714 GCParser.searchByNextPage: No url found

buginformation.summary: Navigation for walking
buginformation.description: There should be an additional entry to start navigation in walking mode.

buginformation.summary: "Unknown error" shown as log type for TB instead of "Move to inventory"
buginformation.description: version 2016.01.18 Open an owned TB via search for its tracking code from main menu action bar Start logging activity for this TB For me there are two available log types "Bemerkung" (Note) and "Unbekannter Fehler" (Unknown Error). Trying to send this log with type "Unbekannter Fehler" or "Note" both lead to long time progress indicator until timeout with error toast "Login fehlgeschlagen". (I cannot take a debug log at the moment) For not owned TBs I could not find any problem up to now. See screenshot:

buginformation.summary: ¨Start talking¨ menu item on compass not changed after selection
buginformation.description: Open the compass Select ¨Start talking¨ The menu item is still labeled ¨Start talking¨ instead of ¨Stop talking¨

buginformation.summary: Resorting of event lists not working
buginformation.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Set global filter to "Event-Caches" Perform nearby search The resulting list is sorted by event date as default Select Sorting - Distance Result: Still sorted by event date Remark: Connectors for oc.de and GC active (if this makes any difference)

buginformation.summary: GC-Vote not merged from map popup
buginformation.description: How to reproduce Import cache(s) via GPX Open map Click on cache previously imported from gpx. GC-Vote is loaded and displayed. Click on "more details", there's no GC-Vode shown Expected behavior The GC-Vote should be stored in the DB and merged with cached data so that it is shown also in the cache details. Workaround Refresh cache. Version bc584a3

buginformation.summary: Initial zoom for map in lists not always correct
buginformation.description: Edit @Lineflyer: NB1602 - d53b445 When using list view to show map, it now goes to the default full world size (5300km scale bar in the lower left corner) instead of zooming to a range that would be all inclusive of the caches (list I'm using is encapsulated within about a 15km radius.) This takes about eight or nine zoom +'s to get down to where it normally opens not to mention the other 3 or so zooms to get to about a 1km scale bar that's more realistically usable. Not a major issue, but considering the live map isn't fully working yet and I'm using lists w/ about 2K caches to do my caching it would be more convenient. To not have to zoom so many levels every time I open the map window.

buginformation.summary: Could not allocate CursorWindow crash
buginformation.description: I have seen similar reports on GooglePlay console and can also kind of reproduce this with 2014.04.03-NB: Open live map, google sat Start scrolling into one direction really fast Keep on scrolling until crash For me it takes real effort scrolling on the map until this happens. Therefore assigning as 'Low' by now. 21:00:06.246 Error CursorWindow 18601 Could not allocate CursorWindow '/data/data/cgeo.geocaching/databases/data' of size 2097152 due to error -24.

buginformation.summary: Mini-compass deviation in cache list
buginformation.description: As for #3729, the cache list activity mini-compasses are wrong when in landscape mode.

buginformation.summary: Unavailable host prevents pictures from beeing shown
buginformation.description: I see a problem with GC2G9AJ and 2014.07.13-NB1 One of the listing pictures seems to be hosted on a server which is not answering. Although all other listing pictures are succesfully loaded non of them are shown in the cache details unless the timeout for the last picture occurs (90 seconds). Furthermore this problem reappears also when opening this cache after is has been saved. AFAIR we used to show the pictures once their individual download is completed. I do not understand why we know wait for all downloads to be completed before any picture is shown. Log (saving the cache): 11:58:34.379 Debug cgeo 5420 Saving GC2G9AJ Historisches Langenberg (0) to DB

buginformation.summary: Extra HTML in cache location
buginformation.description: Some caches (but not all) seem to include an extra HTML section in their location. See for example cache GCV2R9:

buginformation.summary: StaticMapsActivity modifies reads and writes adapter outside the main thread
buginformation.description: Noticed in master. This should be modernized to use RxJava to benefit from fine scheduler control, parallelism, and ability to cancel requests properly, instead of using a thread. The StaticMapsProvider is already reactive. Also, some operations (such as the refresh operation from the menu) appear to block on the UI thread. This should be adressed as well. 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): [Thread-2] StaticMapsActivity.LoadMapsThread.run

buginformation.summary: support encrypted logs
buginformation.description: from facebook: Does cgeo automatically decode encrypted logs? I have permanently encrypted a log entry on one of my caches as it gave clues to the cache location. On the web page the entry appears encrypted but cgeo shows it in plain text. GC59E5Z, log entry for 27 Aug 15 This is because we use the "Decrypt" button functionality when fetching logs. It should be possible rather easily to instead fetch the non decrypted JSON. I'm just wondering if we would need a new database column for log entries. To my mind it should in principle not matter for our app whether the stored log text is actually encrypted or not. Clicking it in the UI will just toggle, independent of whether we known its state. Am I right with that concept? If so, we could probably just pimp the JSON parser.

buginformation.summary: Sort by name automatically
buginformation.description: We are already have a mechanism which will sort lists containing only events by date automatically instead of by distance. I was wondering if we could similarly detect that all caches have a common prefix (i.e. belong to a series) and in that case sort by name by default. Does anyone see a problem with that? If not, I may try implementing this.

buginformation.summary: Smilies in waypoint description shown incorrect
buginformation.description: 2015.02.23: Open GC5NBMH Swipe to the waypoints Waypoint "Cafe Times" shows a block instead of the smilie.

buginformation.summary: Remove spaces when editing coordinates
buginformation.description: My language setting is German. When I add a waypoint (eg. station of a multicache) and enter coordinates in "simple" mode, then the current coords are shown using ',' as the comma, but when I enter a coordinate using ',' the fractional part is set to '000'. Example: When adding a waypoint, the coordinate entry (simple mode) shows: N 48° 12,345 Now I change it to N 48° 11,345 (note, that it only occurs when the ',' is re-entered) When I save, it shows N 48° 11,000

buginformation.summary: How to handle the case when no location is available
buginformation.description: With market release 2014.04.01: Switch off GPS Start c:geo The main screen shows "Last position" and correct coordinates for the last known location Perform nearby search Results are according to the last known location Open live map Result: No pointer/arrow shown The map starts up where it was last opened position or even defaults to N0/E0 (in case c:geo was not running before) Clicking on the "my location" button has no effect Expected: Last known location should be used as starting point for the map If possible the arrow should mark the last known location I am using a new device, so I am not sure whether this is a new issue or just device depending?!

buginformation.summary: Pocket Query list: show last generated and remaining days
buginformation.description: The PQ list on gc.com has a column with "last generated" and "remaining days". (https://geoclub.de/forum/viewtopic.php?p=1243198#p1243198)

buginformation.summary: Settings to enable/disable all navigation apps
buginformation.description: By now we explicitly support around 12 different navigation apps and tools (e.g. bike navigation, Oruxmaps and that stuff). While that is really nice for the people who want to invoke exactly their app, I find this menu is starting to get huge (at least on my device). As we now have better settings, it would probably make sense to add another category to the navigation screen, where each navigation app can be disabled using a checkbox. Each would be checked by default, and only for installed apps the preference would be enabled.

buginformation.summary: Actionbar send button on TB-logging does not work
buginformation.description: Open a TB and open the logging activity for it. THe actionbar shows a "SEND" action but this is without any functionality. Instead you have to use the "Send log" button further down.

buginformation.summary: When filtering subset count is not shown on lists
buginformation.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Open list of saved caches Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result: Not that the count in the header still shows `xx Caches`` where xx represents the total and not the filtered amount In nearby search however it works liek before: Perform nearby search Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result (as expected): The heading shows yy caches/xx caches where yy is the filtered amount and xx is the total amount (like it was before implementing the actionbar)

buginformation.summary: Long press options in logbook no longer working
buginformation.description: 2014.05.31-NB: In the last release it was possible to long press a logbook entry to do one of the following actions: Copy Translate to Share At the moment there seems to be no action associated with a long press anymore.

buginformation.summary: compass gets stuck after some rotations
buginformation.description: Show compass for a cache. Start slowly rotating around yourself so that the compass is always trying to get to the current cache direction. After some rotations (2 or 3?) the compass gets stuck and will not come to life again.

buginformation.summary: add start time to calendar entry
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Parse errors in cgeocoords
buginformation.description: From Google Play. Some of the Geopoint constructors don't do any sanity checks on the input. java.lang.NumberFormatException: unable to parse '' as integer

buginformation.summary: crash on import from mail
buginformation.description: One of my refactorings in the caches list can lead to an UnsupportedOperationException in the caches list. The attachment import is the only case where the extras are not set, but the current code always demands them.

buginformation.summary: Menu displaying c:geo instead of Map
buginformation.description: Similar to the Navigate : Map labels, when you pull up a stored list and choose "More," it too reads c:geo instead of Maps.

buginformation.summary: Crash when using an empty waypoint display threshold
buginformation.description: If no number (empty string) is used as a waypoint threshold, c:geo dies when leaving the activity.

buginformation.summary: Sporadic crash when trying to navigate to a waypoint
buginformation.description: 2014.11.30-NB: Open lists Open a cache Switch to waypoint tab Long click a waypoint, Select Navigate -> Map In some attempts (but not always) a crash happens. Location settings: Google Play, Energy saving on Log: 20:40:37.309 Error cgeo 24864 UncaughtException

buginformation.summary: Reload reCAPTCHA
buginformation.description: We need to add the possibility to reload the captcha, e.g. by clicking on the image.

buginformation.summary: Online log on OC without authentication not prohibited
buginformation.description: Just tried to log an OC cache without having it authorized in the settings. This fails only on sending the log, but does not give a meaningful error message. It also does not tell the user in advance to authorize the connector.

buginformation.summary: Cannot get trackables as suggestions
buginformation.description: Happens on master, but may happen in the release too. E/cgeo (20722): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: columnNames.length = 6, columnValues.length = 5

buginformation.summary: Put history in list selection
buginformation.description: When selecting a list, we have pseudo entries for "all" and "new list". I think it might be good to also have "history" there to more easily switch to that list.

buginformation.summary: When logging a cache, move cache to a specific list
buginformation.description: Feature Requst/Suggestion: A configuration option could be added to define, if a cache should be move to a specific list right after logging it (offline/online). The target list could either be a configurable one, or a fixed/predefinged one that is supposed to contain finds (when logging online) or caches to log online when doing offline logging. After moving the cache to the target list, it would be removed from all other lists.

buginformation.summary: Fieldnote-Upload to gc.com shows "successfull" even if there is no connection
buginformation.description: When I export and upload my fieldnotes to gc.com I always get the popup-mesage "upload to geocaching.com successfull" - even if there is no internet-connection and nothing could be submitted. Sometimes the mobile data connection is not so good and I lost my fieldnotes this way. I can reproduce the bug when I disable wifi and mobile-data and try to upload the fieldnotes! Even an error-message-popup displaying for one second would not be the best solution because it is easy to overlook and there is now possibility for a second try because the last-upload-date was updated. But an success-message in case of failure is really bad.

buginformation.summary: login display text on main screen leads to position settings of device
buginformation.description: We have a shortcut from the position label on the main screen to the GPS settings. The same action is invoked when clicking on the login labels instead. That seems counterintuitive, especially as the number of connectors (and labels) increases. We might want to open the connector settings instead on clicking there.

buginformation.summary: replace term standard navigation
buginformation.description: although this is implemented since several days, I'm still not used to the term standard navigation. reading it in the menu, I always have to think about what is my standard navigation. Therefore I suggest to use the name of the tool again, e.g. compass.

buginformation.summary: Problem loading cache detailed description
buginformation.description: With market version and NB 10.11. - 6d4744c, I have a problem with loading the cache-detailed description. It just keeps the loading screen endlessly. It does not happen with every cache but it seems especially with descriptions containing pictures. Examples of non working caches: GC26YB9, GC26R2V

buginformation.summary: Have confirm selection also in coordinate input on top
buginformation.description: From support mail: While in waypoint adding the "OK" has been moved to the top the coordinate input window still ahas an "Ready" button at the bottom which might be blocked by the keyboard. It would be much more convenient to also have an "Ready" button on the top of the window. See explanation: I like this suggestion!

buginformation.summary: switching map type changes zoom
buginformation.description: open map with Google, the last zoom is used. change the zoom. switch to OSM. you no longer have the current zoom (but probably the one from the settings).

buginformation.summary: import GPX without ImportActivity
buginformation.description: As discussed in #823, there is still an issue with the GPX import (activity being destroyed at a bad time). This could be solved by importing the GPX file directly in the main activity (or the cache list activity respectively). Would solve that activity leaking problem and also make the screen "a bit more colored" during the import operation. :)

buginformation.summary: Waypoints are defect
buginformation.description: Hello today I had the following problem If I add a Waypoint over the menu and save it the next time I edit it the point can't be save and he is automatic deleting from list. If the Waypoint is from Listing there is a duplicate for every edit. I hope your guys are understand what I mean. Timo aka BudBundi

buginformation.summary: Inline-log-images not loading
buginformation.description: Only a . and in log: D/cgeo(935): HtmlImage.getDrawable: Failed to obtain image

buginformation.summary: Compass TTS: Wrong direction in "GPS only" mode
buginformation.description: I first noticed that while caching on the event in Koblenz together with the c:geo team. Today I did some more fieldtesting with the TTS function: As long as I use "GPS + Compass" mode the TTS output for the direction is always accurate (i.e. same as shown on the compass rose). If I use "GPS only" (which is meaningful for using it in some pocket and listen only) the direction shown and TTS output of it is different from each other most of the time. I did not manage to find any logic in it beside one thing: If I am not moving and switch to "GPS only" (this will not get any meaningful direction shown as movement is necessary to calculate the GPS direction towards the cache) the direction shown and TTS output of it are identical. If I now start moving the displayed direction changes immediately but the spoken direction seems to remain as it was or only catch up after a long time. I set this to "medium" as using "GPS only" mode is pretty helpful in combination with TTS output.

buginformation.summary: Opencaching.us: Api update to rev 901
buginformation.description: opencaching.us updated their okapi installation to rev 901, so it can be set to current in our implementation.

buginformation.summary: Send2cgeo for opencaching.pl
buginformation.description: From FB: is it possible to make send2c:geo compatible with polish site opencaching.pl ? it will be very usefull to polish geocachers!

buginformation.summary: Live map crashing
buginformation.description: Sine this morning we get complaints about freezing/crashing live map. I can reproduce this after short usage of the live map. As it wasnt the case last days I assume we have a server issue one again (or still) where cgeo crashes instead of catching the error and giving a proper error message. Maybe someone can reproduce and provide a log. IMHO we should urgently fix this because people blame cgeo for this.

buginformation.summary: Store cache from context-menu in list-view
buginformation.description: An entry for deleting a cache is already there, but not for storing it.

buginformation.summary: Trail on live map gets lost if phone is rotated
buginformation.description: From support mail: Each time I rotate from/to landscape the trail recorded up to this location is lost. It would be appreciated if the trail would survive the rotation.

buginformation.summary: Map selection dialog has huge text about standard directories
buginformation.description: If I scan for maps or other files, then the message about not finding files in the standard directories is about 30 lines long.

buginformation.summary: Geocode search for ec.com is case sensitive
buginformation.description: 2013.12.30-NB Steps: Search for geocode "ec242" EC returns 404 Search for geocode "EC242" Cache is returned Geocode should be capitalized in cgeo or ec.com should accept those requests as well

buginformation.summary: Wrong date when logging trackables very early?
buginformation.description: I logged a trackable this morning at 6:10 German time. When I refreshed the trackable afterwards, it was shown logged yesterday. I had not changed the date selector, so I'm somewhat sure it was not set to yesterday. Might this be a problem with the time offset of -7 hours that we use somewhere? I can't verify this behaviour at the moment, since I have no private tracking code available. Will re-test one of the next days with my own trackables.

buginformation.summary: Importing GPX twice duplicates all log entries
buginformation.description: If I Import a cache through GPX twice, all log entries are doubled.

buginformation.summary: Stored Lists Not Working
buginformation.description: Testing Release 2013.03.13-NB-787597e The stored lists are not working. If the user goes into the lists, then chooses another list from the drop down menu, the name of the list changes, but the list itself does not.

buginformation.summary: cgeo not offered for opening coord.info links

buginformation.summary: Mapsforge: do not try to open a `null` filename
buginformation.description: In 2012.06.01, and probably in the current source code as well: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fileName must not be null

buginformation.summary: Icon overlay for "final defined" not shown in lists
buginformation.description: 2015.10-04-NB (and also 2015.09.28): Store a multi or mystery cache to a list Open cache and go to waypoint tab Add a waypoint of type "Final" with valid coordinates Save the waypoint Return to the list Expectation: Cache icon should be shown with overlay icon on lower right for "defined final" instead of no overlay. The overlay does only seem to work if the function "replace listing coords by final waypoint" has been used while creating the waypoint. This should not be necessary for the overlay to appear in the list. I assume the bug was introduced with recent changes to the overlay design in lists as it used to work with older c:geo versions.

buginformation.summary: Delay when navigating to a cache in Nearby
buginformation.description: Steps: Select Nearby from the main screen Long press on one of the caches in the list (that you have not looked at recently) Select either your default navigation or Navigate There is a delay before anything happens If I'm looking at the list and I select to show on the map via button in the top right, it is instant. So, the coordinates are already known. There should not be a delay when choosing to navigate to the cache. I haven't looked at the code, but it seems that it is either retrieving more information from the website or doing some other slow operation.

buginformation.summary: Storing cache overwrites all other stored caches
buginformation.description: Version: build from 38afd18 Step by step: initially no caches stored open map click on a cache select "store" click on another cache select "store" do it as often as you want close map, open stored caches only the last stored cache is visible Also if you select "store" from detail-view or from "store all/selected". When you store 3 caches with "store all/selected" all 3 are stored. When you store another one only 2 are stored (1 from the 3 and the new one).

buginformation.summary: Find better menu icons for some menu entries
buginformation.description: In some menus c:geo reuses the same menu icons for different functions. For example, in the cache list the "Select mode" icon is the same as the one for "Log visit" in the details view. In other places, generic icons are used, presumably because better ones weren't available. For example, the "Open in browser" in details view, which has a generic "information" icon. I propose that we adopt some of the icons from the free icon set from androidicons.com: http://www.androidicons.com/freebies.php It would obviously be nice if we could link back to them in the about page, or similar. I find that ok since they're offering a wonderful gift to the community for free. If you guys agree, I'll go over all the menus and post the proposed changes here for voting before implementation.

buginformation.summary: Hide disabled menu items
buginformation.description: We have some menu items which are disabled instead of hidden. The Android design guidelines prohibit that: "If an action is unavailable in the current context, hide it. Do not show it as disabled." Examples are "Strategy" and "Store for offline", when opening a map from a cache list.

buginformation.summary: NullPointerException on DownloadStaticMapsApp invocation
buginformation.description: We got several of those in the 2012.06.06 and the 2012.06.01 releases. java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Trail jumps to 0° and back.
buginformation.description: (sorry if this should be a douplicated issue, i dont found an other one with my seach before) Sometimes I have to switch from c:geo to an other app and back. For example for calculating new coordinates or making a photo. When c:geo is not active the gps gets deactivated. (Sometimes I even go to the home screen to disable gps and save energy.) After switching back to cgeo the gps needs one second to get a fix again. When I use the live-map I get a trail from N0°E0° near africa to my current position in that moment. When I switch between apps a few times (for example to calculate the next part of coordinates) there comes more and more of this trail-lines from 0° to different positions around me. At least it gets sometimes almoust impossible to see the southern part of the map. Possible solution could be to filter the 0°position from using for the trail or to filter very large jumps of the trail in little time.

buginformation.summary: friends log without login
buginformation.description: Friends log is shown although no login data is given in settings. just testing in mediamarkt...

buginformation.summary: Spoiler images of owned caches are missing the description

But descriptions of OWNED caches are still missing. I think the reason is that the HTML-code of owned caches is slightly different the following code is additional for owned caches: | <a href="/seek/image.aspx?imgid=......"

buginformation.summary: Search for Opencaching waypoints not working for some sites
buginformation.description: After a first look into the code (thanks to @marco-jacob) c:geo should already handle searching waypoints and opening the cache details for: OC - opencaching.de Germany OZ - opencaching.cz Czech Republic OS - opencaching.no Norway / Sweden OK - opencaching.org.uk UK OP - opencaching.pl Poland OU - opencaching.us United States OB - opencaching.nl Netherlands I did only test some of them before so I gave it a test with current master version: OC = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OZ = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) There seems to be some functionality behind which no longer works OS = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OK = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) I am not sure if this is really implemented OP = Working OU = Working OB = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented Can someone give some more background infos what c:geo should support and what not ?

buginformation.summary: trail is on by default
buginformation.description: contrary to the change from #4243 the map trail is still on by default. This is because our default values come from the XML file, not from the default values we pass into the getters.

buginformation.summary: Offline map (mapsforge 3 version) very slow on Nexus S
buginformation.description: I updated cgeo to version 2012.06.01 on my Nexus S and installed new mapsforge 3 offline maps (http://download.mapsforge.org/maps/europe/germany/baden-wuerttemberg.map). Unfortunately, the map is very slow. It usually takes 20s before the first tile is drawn. It doesn't matter if I map a single cache, a cache list or show the online map. Always slow. I could not see any exceptions in the log during rendering. The same map file renders fast in Locus. When I switch back to the 0.2.4 version of the map, cgeo renders again fast. The online versions (OSM:Mapnik and OSM:Radfahrerkarte) are slow as well. Might be network (using WLAN for test) but I guess it is more related to mapsforge 3. In the emulator (x86 with HW acceleration), the mapsforge 3 offline map is fast. Renders immediately. Does anybody observe the same behavior?

Maybe related to the amount of files/dirs returned by the scanner? Stacktrace: java.lang.StackOverflowError

buginformation.summary: Bad encoding in features list

buginformation.summary: "load more caches" wrongly enabled

buginformation.summary: OAuth signing is wrong
buginformation.description: Our OAuth signing is wrong for the reserved characters of RFC 3986. OAuth requires everything except unreserved characters to be encoded: http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#encoding_parameters I found this while trying to add support for name search in OKAPI and failed for a long time, due to us not encoding the asterisk wildcard "*". Even if our OAuth signing method is only 20 lines, to me this issue (and the hours I spent looking back and forth) makes me think it should be replaced by a ready-made library.

buginformation.description: Is it possible to add a default action a single tap on an item of the waypoints list ? In nightly version, user should long press item in the list to open menu and then select action. Single tap does nothing ! I suggest : single tap: edit long press: menu

Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, always System information: Android 4.4.2 (Huawei Ascend P7)

buginformation.summary: ask for restore if database is empty
buginformation.description: If the database is empty at startup and there is a backup available, the app should ask the user if he wants to restore it.

buginformation.summary: Manual download of static maps should always be possible
buginformation.description: Currently there is no possibility to manually download static maps for a certain cache in case the general setting "Download static maps for caches" is switched off in the settings. But switching it on in the settings will also load the static maps generally e.g. in case of GPX-imports. This has some side effects like long import time, google timing issue and restrictions. It should be possible to download static maps manually for a cache (like it is already implemented for the case that no static map is available). After this has been implemented I would further suggest to have the general setting for downloading static maps switched off in order to avoid problems on GPX-imports. My personal guess is, that only a minor percentage of users want to have a static map by default in this case. Another possibility would be to introduce a new setting for "Static map download for GPX-imports" to split up the usecases. This should be switched off by default.

buginformation.summary: empty log image title
buginformation.description: A photo in a log can be without title. In that case we show an empty string as the headline above the image, which doesn't look nice. Example: GCBHV1, log of 2011-10-16

Yes System information: -— System information —- Device: D5803 (D5803, Sony) Android version: 5.1.1 Android build: 23.4.A.1.232 Cgeo version: 2016.06.27-NB-c9c941d Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation vector sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Magnetometer & Accelerometer sensor: present Direction sensor used: rotation vector Hide own/found: false Map strategy: auto HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: en_US Debug mode active: no Geocaching sites enabled: Geocaching.su Installed cgeo plugins: calendar, contacts -— End of system information —-

buginformation.summary: have search term as new list name
buginformation.description: When searching for caches online, it would be nice to have the search term as the default name of a new list created from the search results.

buginformation.summary: Trail gets disaligned on OSM
buginformation.description: I have reproducibly the following issue on version 15.08.2011: When I use OSM:mapnik in "Live Map" and drive around I see that the trail (Spur) gets disaligned. Example: I drive along a windy road and the trail follows the road at first but after the next turn the trail from some minutes ago seems to drift away from the road. It looks like the trail is averaging to become a straight line from trail start to current position as longer as I use it. However it is not fixed to the position I was some minutes ago. On GM it is OK, I do only see this with OSM.

buginformation.summary: Nearby result overwritten by PNG-parsing
buginformation.description: Found with RC-version 2012.05.30-RC-dd31d83. Test with first RC-version will follow: We have the known limitation that owned caches are identified as multi caches by the PNG-parsing. This is no big deal, but it allows to track the following problem: Strategy: Speed dependent (in stationary environment -> Nearby search used) User: PM After loading has finished the owned caches are well identified (by nearby search): Zooming out a reload takes place and the owned caches change their type to multi and owned marker is gone: I guess this is not limited to owned caches, but due to the limitation in parsing mentioned above it most likely to happen with owned caches. It seems information from nearby result is merged wrong with map parsing results.

buginformation.summary: Login slow
buginformation.description: Since the last update, when you first sign in it takes an age before allowing you to log in. This is also the case when using WiFi so slow connection is not an issue, it never used to be this slow.

buginformation.summary: Live map shows WPs of caches fitlered out
buginformation.description: Found in NB2012.07.04 : Save a cache which has WPs with coords for offline Set WP-limit in settings to a number >>0 to enable the feature Open live map and check that the saved cache and its waypoints are shown Close live map Activate filter which does not match your saved cache Open live map Result: The cache is hidden properly but its waypoints are still shown which is not what the user expects Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: Use Crowdin branch management support

buginformation.summary: Login fail with unhelpful message on unvalidated account

buginformation.summary: Remove fastest strategy on live map
buginformation.description: I suggest to remove the selectable live map strategy for the following reasons: Users I spoke with are not even aware of this option Users I spoke with always prefer to see the cache type and get most information out of the map Networks have become faster There are often users on support and in ratings claiming that they only see ?? caches as they accidentally selected "Fastest" thinking it would be the same but just faster Make things simpler, less options The speed dependent solution (Current default) should be the fixed strategy. 👍 3
