Yes Other comments and remarks: Does not happen for GC or OC as far as I could test but I am not sure.

buginformation.summary: NPE in GPX parser
buginformation.description: happens with "half baked" OC caches (might be from beta versions, but let's fix it anway) 04-07 09:14:03.363: E/cgeo(3800): java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: length=67; index=-1

buginformation.summary: Bad query string
buginformation.description: Every once in a while, some formatting using String.format() and a zeroed coordinate seems to generate bad characters (here, we get -0.00*). android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "and": syntax error: , while compiling: SELECT cg_waypoints._id , cg_waypoints.geocode , cg_waypoints.updated , cg_waypoints.type , cg_waypoints.prefix , cg_waypoints.lookup , cg_waypoints.name , cg_waypoints.latlon , cg_waypoints.latitude , cg_waypoints.longitude , cg_waypoints.note , cg_waypoints.own , cg_waypoints.visited FROM cg_waypoints, cg_caches WHERE cg_waypoints.geocode == cg_caches.geocode and cg_waypoints.latitude >= -0.020859500000000003 and cg_waypoints.latitude <= -0.00* and cg_waypoints.longitude >= 0.005064000000000001 and cg_waypoints.longitude <= 0.0127)

buginformation.summary: Illegal longitude argument for Geocoder
buginformation.description: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: longitude == 4387.5822204351425

buginformation.summary: Refresh all from history asks for list to store
buginformation.description: One can refresh all caches in the history list. Doing that will lead to asking for a list to store all these caches. That's unusable. It should be possible to refresh those caches and leave them on their own list each.

buginformation.summary: Bad overlay sizing
buginformation.description: From german geoclub.de as announced by @SammysHP on IRC. Look at the overlay for "final available" near middle of the screen. http://show.picr.de/23125480nr.jpg.html On current nighlties as well as on release.

buginformation.summary: Cache status not updated on refresh
buginformation.description: I unfortunately archived GC3X5D2, guess due to the log type reorder after loading log page. After refresh the cache is still shown as is in list and details without archived. Log entries are refreshed.

buginformation.summary: calendar time recognized wrongly
buginformation.description: The event time of GC4N2MB is not recognized correctly.

buginformation.summary: Crash on Google Map
buginformation.description: This is another round of crashes which might be contrary to initial believe something new (the only older report is from an NB version) java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.MethodUtils.invokeMethod

buginformation.summary: Bad format for event coordinates when added to calendar
buginformation.description: Hi, I found a problem related to event caches. Use case: Open an event cache in c:geo Menu -> Add to calendar Close cgeo Open your calendar application Find and open the event The "location" of the event has coordinates and is clickable on my Sony Ericsson phone. Click on the location. Google Maps will open but will not find anything because the coordinates mm/ddd are separated by "," where GoogleMaps requires "." (After editing the calendar item and replacing "," with "." then GoogleMaps will load location). Thus. Coordinates added to calendar should have "." instead of ",".

buginformation.summary: Login issue (Unknown error) solved by disabling/enabling the connector
buginformation.description: Recently I started asking users on support to do this procedure when they report "Login failed: Unknown error" and confirmed to have checked all other things mentioned in the FAQ: Go to c:geo Menu - Settings - Service - geocaching.com Disable the service completely (disabling the tick box) Reboot device Go to c:geo Menu - Settings - Service - geocaching.com Enable the service again In all cases users reported back, that it was now working normal (Login OK). Can someone imagine any root cause in the c:geo code causing this. I personally suspect problems in upgrade cases or data restore after reinstallation (Google backup)...IMHO this is somehow enabled in c:geo to store this data in Google.

buginformation.summary: No distance calculation and coords if cache is at equator
buginformation.description: Current market release as well as 2013.09.30-NB: Example GC53 which is located at 00 00.000 E036 00.000 Distance to cache shows --- Coordinates are not shown / Navigation is impossible

buginformation.summary: Management of release notes
buginformation.description: Since we are now always merging release to master my previous method of periodically manually updating the release notes on master is no longer possible. I used to update release notes on release- and master branch independently depending on where the changes have been applied. I liked that method to just keep track of the changes included in master only. @rsudev told that we can get a list of commits only on master via github. My questions now would be: How to get that list of changes? How and when to transform the commit list into a list of "user readable" list of changes ?

buginformation.summary: URLs for most opencaching.* sites are not recognized by cgeo
buginformation.description: opencaching.{de,fr} is supported, but opencaching.us is not for example. They should be added to the AndroidManifest.xml and handled properly.

buginformation.summary: Deleting cache not possible
buginformation.description: 2014.08.04-NB1: Open a list of saved caches Long press on a cache Select "Delete" Result: Nothing happens, cache is still saved Expected result: Cache deleted from list and no longer stored offline

buginformation.summary: Include status of orientation sensor usage in system information
buginformation.description: With the recent version we are now using the rotation sensor by default and added an option for the user to fall back to the orientation sensor instead. For support cases it would be helpful to include the current setting of "Use Orientation sensor" into the system information section.

buginformation.summary: Both navigation options are compass
buginformation.description: Just noticed that on my new phone the primary and secondary navigation are both the compass. I'm not completely sure, but very much that I did not touch that setting yet.

buginformation.summary: Lists panel is not updated when editing Personal note
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a cache that is not currently stored in the device Go to the Description tab Press "Edit" under Personal note The message "The cache has been stored locally" is shown. Enter something in the Personal note field and save the changes by pressing the checkmark Go back to the Details tab Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The cache does not seem to be stored in any List since the Lists panel is empty. You have to refresh the cache details for it to appear in the List view in the List "Stored" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.19 NB Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Other comments and remarks: Bug related to the newly implemented feature #87

buginformation.summary: Add support for new opencaching nodes
buginformation.description: List of pending sites with running OKAPI installation: opencaching.us (#3219) opencaching.nl opencaching.ro (in the final stages of getting active)

buginformation.summary: Caches don't show on map from nearby list
buginformation.description: I am running Gingerbread on HTC thunderbolt. When I click "nearby" I get a listing of the closest caches. If I then hit menu and "show on map" the map loads up but does not show any caches. This used to work, however the last few versions its been broken. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, logging in etc.

buginformation.summary: Rounding error near "minute confluence"?
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a cache Move to East xx° yy'.998 from West Swipe to waypoints "Add Waypoint", select DD MM.MMM format Now move further to East Actual behavior after performing these steps: Display will eventually show xx yy.000 (and a WP taken will be >1 km off) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Expected: yy gets incremented (and WP reflects current position) Version of c:geo used: 2016.07.09-NB.34c95b1 Is the problem reproducible for you? It's a bit tricky because is apparently only happens at xx yy.999[5-9] and with very good GPS reception System information: OnePlus (A0001, bacon) 6.0.1 MHC19Q Other comments and remarks: This looks quite similar to Issue #2624 - but this time, for minutes

buginformation.summary: Personal note editing problem
buginformation.description: This problem seems to be similar to but more severe as #2527 If I select to edit the personal note The window looks like this ("Reise" is the note content): Once I tap into the note window the note content is covered by my keyboard and due to the unusual window design (#2121) I am not able to move it to see what I am writing:

buginformation.summary: excludeMine parameter is always false
buginformation.description: Analysis by IntelliJ IDEA shows that the excludeMine parameter in SearchResult#filterSearchResults is always false. This is likely a bug. If this is not, the parameter can be removed and the code can be simplified.

buginformation.summary: Picture in description not shown
buginformation.description: Last days it happend to me quite often that pictures in cache description are replaced by the placeholder (Pic-icon with red x on lower right) with the current market release (NB not tested yet). Reproducible with these caches, website shows it. Example: GC2XD3P

Only "login failed: unknown error" appears. Desire S is my smartphone. May you help me? LOG: 11:22:16 shows what i mean 08-10 11:22:08.374 I/cgeo ( 799): Starting cgeo.geocaching 20120628 a.k.a 2012.06.28 08-10 11:22:08.374 D/cgeo ( 799): GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:08.384 D/LocationManager( 799): requestLocationUpdates: provider = network, listener = cgeo.geocaching.GeoDataProvider$Listener@463f5308 08-10 11:22:08.384 D/LocationManager( 799): requestLocationUpdates: provider = gps, listener = cgeo.geocaching.GeoDataProvider$Listener@463a2978 08-10 11:22:13.064 D/cgeo ( 799): Decompressing response 08-10 11:22:13.064 D/cgeo ( 799): 200 (4688 ms) GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:13.134 D/cgeo ( 799): POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:13.864 D/cgeo ( 799): GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:14.464 D/LocationManager( 799): removeUpdates: listener = cgeo.geocaching.GeoDataProvider$Listener@463f5308 08-10 11:22:14.464 D/LocationManager( 799): removeUpdates: listener = cgeo.geocaching.GeoDataProvider$Listener@463a2978 08-10 11:22:16.324 D/cgeo ( 799): Decompressing response 08-10 11:22:16.324 D/cgeo ( 799): 200 (3192 ms) POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:16.364 I/cgeo ( 799): Failed to log in Geocaching.com as nos! for some unknown reason 08-10 11:22:16.384 D/cgeo ( 799): Decompressing response 08-10 11:22:16.384 D/cgeo ( 799): 200 (2517 ms) GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:16.464 D/cgeo ( 799): POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:19.364 D/cgeo ( 799): Decompressing response 08-10 11:22:19.364 D/cgeo ( 799): 200 (2904 ms) POST https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx 08-10 11:22:19.404 I/cgeo ( 799): Failed to log in Geocaching.com as nos! for some unknown reason 08-10 11:22:23.574 I/cgeo ( 799): Requesting settings backup with settings manager

buginformation.summary: Light skin in settings broken
buginformation.description: From support mail: I am running c:geo version 2013.08.24 and have Light Skin selected. When I go into Settings, the main screen is displayed correctly. When I select any sub-option, the text is not visible. I have to slide finger up or down (scroll) and then text will appear. Running on HTC Incredible Phone. For me on Android 4.x it is working normal. But HTC Incredible for sure has some Android 2.x version which I am unable to test. Maybe someone can have a look on the emulator. AFAIR we already had some version specific problems with the light skin in the past.

buginformation.summary: Be more explicit in system information when no connectors are active
buginformation.description: The absence of any active connector shows in the system information by not showing anything. It should be more explicit and says that no connector has been enabled.

buginformation.summary: Request cache description in other language
buginformation.description: OpenCaching supports cache descriptions in multiple languages. c:geo should request one in the user's language. It looks like this is already supported (#4559 + #2512), but not when you forced English in c:geo's preferences.

buginformation.summary: NPE when trackable does not exist
buginformation.description: Play store report 2015.01.12: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to destroy activity {cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.TrackableActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Failure in testSearchByGeocodeBasis
buginformation.description: From jenkins after gc.com site update 2013.02.20: [exec] Failure in testSearchByGeocodeBasis:

buginformation.summary: Avatar no longer recognized
buginformation.description: The gc.com HTML code changed once again, and the avatar image is no longer recognized when verifying one's credentials.

buginformation.summary: Edit coordinates: treatment of fractional seconds
buginformation.description: Today I was doing a multi-cache where I got coordinates in DDMMSS-style, e.g. with 23.4''. When entering them in our dialog, the fractional part as '4' it was interpreted as '004', which surprised me (and took a while to notice). Even if I think this interpretation would be well aligned with my expectations regarding fractional minutes (the three digits are so 'standard' to me that I simply do not see them as fraction). I'd rather not prepend trailing zeros for fractional seconds. What do you think?

buginformation.summary: Do not query the magnetic field sensor
buginformation.description: We should not test the presence of the TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD sensor to check whether we can use either the TYPE_ORIENTATION or the TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR sensors.

buginformation.summary: Export OC caches in field notes
buginformation.description: Currently the field notes feature is tested on opencaching.de and will be released soon. c:geo does not export logs of OC caches.

buginformation.summary: GPX import problem
buginformation.description: From support mail: When importing the attached gpx file to c:geo (latest version from Android store) only 12 caches are imported. No other program (Locus on Android, EasyGPS on Windows) or Garmin device does have problems with that gpx file. File: http://db.tt/fKMDjy1h The file looks a little strange (e.g. the geocodes in it) But if it is syntactically OK we should be able to import it. BTW: There is also the NaN problem in the import progress dialoge here.

buginformation.summary: Have OK/Cancel also on top for personal note editing
buginformation.description: From FB after users tried our nightly which included the fix for #5196 Also the personal note input window should have the Done/Cancel selection on top sue to ease of use and design consistency. @rahu In case you are interested and it is technically possible...

buginformation.summary: sort in reverse order
buginformation.description: I sometime need to reverse the order in a list, like when I try to find a Cache with the beginning letter "Z". But I have no option to reverse the sort-order? I read the FAQ and searched the manual... Am I blind? If not, this is a feature request ;)

buginformation.summary: Log order wrong when requesting friends logs
buginformation.description: When requesting friend logs is active, the log entries are no longer sorted after gc.com. Probably the HashSet juggling in cgBase, 1298-1293

buginformation.summary: limit zoom level of live map
buginformation.description: I just opened a (non live) map for 10 caches around the world, showing the whole earth. Afterwards I opened live map, which used the same zoom level. That's absolutely not useful, so the zoom level for the live map should be limited in such a way, that you cannot "zoom out" further than that limit.

buginformation.summary: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: credentials are not valid in Credentials.guard
buginformation.description: Stacktrace from google play (sample, there are quite a number of them recently): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: credentials are not valid

buginformation.summary: hide some options menus for empty list
buginformation.description: We currently have 7 main menu items in the options menu of cache lists. As only 6 are shown at a time, we always have "Map" and "List" under the "more" button. This is even true for an empty list. There you see 3 disabled menu items, but you have to use the "more" button to get to the list management so you can delete the empty list. I suggest that for empty lists (and only for those) the disabled menu items are also hidden to avoid clicking through multiple menus.

buginformation.summary: Cache logbook not updated correctly
buginformation.description: 2013.06.25-NB-8a2e859 Open a saved cache (where you know there are new entries since you saved it) Open the logbook tab and check the currently shown logs Go back to the detail tab and select "Refresh" After refresh is done go to the logbook tab again The logbook tab does not reflect the update (the old status is still shown as before) Exit from cache Open the cache again and go to the logbook tab Now the logbook content is updated

buginformation.summary: Use one dialog for username and password
buginformation.description: For services which need username and password, we should use a single dialog combining both. This should help in getting the credentials right for new users.

buginformation.summary: Turn By Turn not working
buginformation.description: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue with this, but in the latest build I am unable to use the turn by turn feature. In both Google Nav and TeleNav, it starts to load the app, then goes back to cLgeo.

buginformation.summary: performance of name sorting
buginformation.description: The performance of the newly introduced number aware name sorting is bad and needs to be reworked (this is mainly a reminder for myself).

buginformation.summary: Use infinite scrolling for ViewPager
buginformation.description: Loop from the last page to the first one and vice versa. (See #829)

buginformation.summary: Don't allow to check ".." in path selection
buginformation.description: The user should not be allowed to select the checkbox of the ".." entry (or OK should be disabled, whatever is easier). This will lead to effectively unreadable pathes, like "/sdcard/..". While those can always be typed manually, we should avoid creating them using our browsing activity.

buginformation.summary: Variable speech output interval
buginformation.description: Improvement proposal for the speech output function recently integrated by @Bananeweizen : Currently a fixed interval of 30s is implemented. The GCBabble offered a settings for this (which I do not suggest to implement) and also an adaptive speaking (which does not work for me or I do not know how it is supposed to work). After thinking a bit about it my idea would be: Implement an adaptive speaking interval which triggers an output each time the distance to target has decreased or increased by a certain value and only keep the minimum interval at 30 (or 20 ?) seconds in case of no movement (distance does not change or change of distance is below the aforementioned limit). I would propose the following distance steps for that (to be discussed) assuming a walking navigation: 1000m distance: 200m 500-1000m distance: 100m 200-500m distance: 50m 100m-200m distance: 20m 0-100m distance: 10m As the speed output itself takes some time there has to be a lower limit of 5s anyway to avoid triggering the next output while the first is still running.

buginformation.summary: Floating point coordinates not accepted
buginformation.description: We can parse longitude OR latitude from double. But we cannot parse two doubles as coordinate. Found because the copy from clipboard button was disabled after copying such a coordinate from the browser.

buginformation.summary: Waypoint description gets mixed up
buginformation.description: Today I noticed that the userdefined description text which is shown for each waypoint in the WP tab gets mixed up when scrolling through the list of waypoints. I can not exactly give a clue on when this happens, but if a cache has e.g. 12 waypoints where the first one has the description "This is a small parking spot" and you scroll down and up the list a few times suddenly some of the other waypoints also show the description "This is a small parking spot" in the overview. Such a like this happens with all WP texts randomly. If you open those wrong described waypoints the wrong description is not shown, which probably means it is only a problem in the WP overview view. 2013.11.09-NB

buginformation.summary: Language change when rotating the device - again
buginformation.description: Before reporting this bug I did a search on issues and found that issue #2343 seems to fit my problem as well. Detailed steps causing the problem: Device language is Swedish c:geo is using device language by default Select "Använd engelska i c:geo" in Inställningar/Utseende ("Use English in c: geo "in Preferences / Appearance) Kill the app and restart it. Open Live Map and tap on a cache to get the pop-up window- Everything is in English. See Screenshot 1 below. Rotate the device Everything is now in Swedish. See Screenshot 2 below. Rotat the device back Everything is still in Swedish. See Screenshot 3 below. Close the live map. The home screen is in English, except for the filter button that says "Alla typer av cacher" instead of "All Cache Types". See Screenshot 4 below. Exit c:geo Enter c:geo again The home screen is now in Swedish. See Screenshot 5 below. Kill c:geo by swiping it off the recent apps menu Start c:geo The home screen is in English again Screenshot 1: Screenshot 2: Screenshot 3: Screenshot 4: Screenshot 5: Version of c:geo used: 2016.07.31-NB-cec02b1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Device: ONE E1003 (onyx, OnePlus)

buginformation.summary: Radar navigation not working
buginformation.description: 2014.02.05-NB If I start navigation from a cache using Radar (with GPSStatus) the target coords are not the desired coords but some which have nothing to do with that cache. I did not get my PC running with logcat yet, but I would guess the radar uses the last target coords it has and we for some reason stopped handing over coords when calling the Radar. Please try to reproduce, maybe there is a problem with my installation.

buginformation.summary: send2cgeo button no longer appears on cache page
buginformation.description: due to a change in the way GC publishes cache pages, the send2cgeo button has not been appearing on the cache description page. old url style http://www.geocaching.com/seek/cache_details.aspx?wp=GC117J5 new url style: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC4D00K_my-brain-hurts?utm_expid=3682814-19 Note old style url's still work, but they redirect to the new style. Because of this the greasemonkey script is not being applied to the page. The work around is to add a user filter to include http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/* In firefox: add-ons-> (then on send2cgeo script) options->user settings -> add... Longer term, this will need to be added to the send2cgeo install script.

buginformation.summary: Cache information dialog does not provide help manual access
buginformation.description: This issue applies to version 2.26RC3. The new (or old, depending on your point of view) cache information dialog provides quick access to the compass, but not to the help manual. In contrast, the cache info screen (activity) we had before provided access to the manual. Please add a "?" action button to the cache info dialog. The corresponding manual topic is "c:geo-cache-info".

buginformation.summary: Parsing cache problem
buginformation.description: I made a new RC version and decided to try it. This was the resoult. The problem is (i guess) my personal note copy-pasted from autoresponse email on of one cache. Koordinate zaklada so: N 46° 27' 55,65'' E 15° 53' 41,68'' Namig: sem v objemu 3 gabrov (Carpinus) Coordinates of the cache are: N 46° 27' 55,65'' E 15° 53' 41,68'' Hint: I am hugged with 3 hornbeams (Carpinus) FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-23 java.lang.NumberFormatException at org.apache.harmony.luni.util.FloatingPointParser.parseDblImpl(Native Method) at org.apache.harmony.luni.util.FloatingPointParser.parseDouble(FloatingPointParser.java:283) at java.lang.Double.parseDouble(Double.java:318) at cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.GeopointParser.parseHelper(GeopointParser.java:126) at cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.GeopointParser.parse(GeopointParser.java:60) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache.parseWaypointsFromNote(cgCache.java:1062) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.parseCacheFromText(cgBase.java:1169) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.parseCache(cgBase.java:790) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:123) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByGeocode(cgBase.java:1823) at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DetailsViewCreator$RefreshCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:1652)

buginformation.summary: Fresh image taken from Camera fails to be added to log in some cases
buginformation.description: This one can happen after the recent image handling changes for pictures just taken with the camera (depending on the Camera application, some will return a thumbnail and work fine, others will result into this NPE). java.lang.RuntimeException: Failure delivering result ResultInfo{who=null, request=1, result=-1, data=null} to activity {cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: No GPS in some views
buginformation.description: Google Play Services disabled Powersave mode disabled High precision is only used in some views like map, list, cache details but not in cache description, logs, etc. That is bad e.g. when you are deep in the woods and waiting for a GPS fix.

buginformation.summary: oc.de attribute 'Leichtes Klettern' mapped wrongly
buginformation.description: The mentioned attribute (oc.de id 28) is mapped to 'serious climbing' (gc.com id 10). Even if it describes mostly the same thing (climbing without technical help) the wording doesn't fit, so these should be separated.

buginformation.summary: Sharing a cache opens Locus automatically
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open details of a cache Select "Share Cache" Short list of share targets opens, select "view all" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Locus opens, and displays the cache After pressing Back and leaving Locus, the list of all share target is shown in c:geo Expected behavior after performing these steps: List of all share targets should be shown, allowing to select Locus Locus should not be triggered automatically Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.07-NB-8b891da Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Device: D6503 (D6503, Sony) Android version: 5.1.1 Android build: 23.4.A.1.264 Cgeo version: 2016.04.07-NB-8b891da Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation vector sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Magnetometer & Accelerometer sensor: present Direction sensor used: rotation vector Hide own/found: true Map strategy: auto HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: de_DE Geocaching sites enabled: geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / PREMIUM Installed cgeo plugins: calendar Other comments and remarks:

buginformation.summary: Also request more details in popup for known cache types
buginformation.description: With the current market release more details when opening a cache popup are only requested if the cache type is unknown. From my point of view it would be an improvement also to request the data if the popup is opened for caches which already have a parsed cache type icon, because: It will deliver the D/T rating and cache size It will deliver the favorite points (but currently this is not used for the popup anyway) We would be able to confirm or correct the cache type (if parsing went wrong) Let's say you are using the live map to look for an appropriate cache to go for, then this information would be very useful and it will probably be faster than having to download every cache.

buginformation.summary: Corrupted images on image tab
buginformation.description: This is not clearly reproducible, but with 2014.01.12-NB-95a511b I had problems today with images of saved caches. Sometimes it looked like this: However I can not reproduce this case up to now. I just wanted to create this issue as there might be a connection to the recent changes.

buginformation.summary: quick search doesn't work for trackable code
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Log failures from GPX imported by GDAK
buginformation.description: A user on FB stated that his logs for caches previously imported via GDAK resulted in online logs for wrong caches. I received a GPX and I assume the following: The GPX contains wrong(?) IDs like . The cache is showing up normal in c:geo without any indication that something might be wrong, however when trying to post a log for this cache I can see the following in the debug log: 22:44:24.704 Warning cgeo 3477 [ModernAsyncTask #3] 404 [Not Found] (739 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?ID=3 So it seems we try to load the log page with the given ID (which is not the real cache ID). In this case it results in an error as there is no cache with that ID, however as the IDs from GDAK seem to be just counting up from 1 some caches might accidently match an existing ID. @Bananweizen As seen on FB!

buginformation.summary: Description page in detail activity is created more than once
buginformation.description: Open a cache, go to the description page. For demonstration immediately decrypt the hint. One or two seconds later the detail page is recreated and the hint is encrypted again (and the long description is hidden). Maybe setDataSetChanged() is called a few seconds after the first creation of the page.

buginformation.summary: Suggestion : Move to other list from cache screen
buginformation.description: To manage items in our custom lists, you need to open lists in listview mode. If you want to sort items / list through map or after a search, you cannot do it. Please add a row with the list name, if there, into the cache details and add a menu into this cache screen to move to other list (like it already exists on long press in listview). Thanks

buginformation.summary: GPX parser dies on invalid character references
buginformation.description: Import the GPX from GC53HTM. The XML parser freaks out, as that is invalid XML (due to a bad character reference � in the file). I've been trying to remove this using a ReaderFilter as described in http://info.tsachev.org/2009/05/skipping-invalid-xml-character-with.html, but that implementation only works for invalid characters as such, not for invalid character references. Now we could implement our own character reference detection, in a FilterReader, but to me that looks like a very big gun. Does anyone see an easier solution? Just to be crystal clear: I know this is a bug on the GC.com side, but nevertheless I would like to fix it in our app.

buginformation.summary: Progress indicator in Live Map
buginformation.description: Requesting the needed informations in the Live Map takes somes seconds. It is not clear/visible to the user when the requests are finished esp. in case of an error. If no caches are shown: are the requests still outgoing ? Or are there just no caches around ? With the start of searchByViewport() i'd like to start the indicator, with the return i'd stop it. My idea is to use an counter because there can be more than one call to searchByViewport() at the same time.

buginformation.summary: finalDefined not correctly stored/initialized
buginformation.description: The finalDefined flag is not persisted correctly. To reproduce: Store an unmodified cache (without GC edited coordinates) for offline use. Add a final waypoint. -> Cache is shown with flag in cache list, everything ok. Close and kill c:geo (a simple close is not enough to get rid of the process in memory). Restart and open the list containing the cache -> Flag is gone, finalDefined=false. Open cache details, go back -> Flag is there, finalDefined=true. To my understanding the reason is the following: The flag is set when a waypoint is added. Therefore it is correct after adding a final waypoint or after loading all waypoints from the database. But the flag (which was set on adding a waypoint) never gets stored, because the cache itself does not get stored after adding a waypoint. Therefore it is not correct after running a new c:geo instance, where only the cache details without waypoints have been loaded. A possible solution would be to store the cache after modifying waypoints but that may have other bad side effects (like data usage when caching in the wild).

buginformation.summary: Problems logging TB with newest NBs
buginformation.description: Reported on Support with 2015.03.29-NB: Trying to discover a TB When sending the log there is an error message "Logging from c:geo cannot be anonymous...". I guess the user did not even touch the GK-settings and his action does not involve GKs. Will try to reproduce later.

I do not want it there! It is distracting and gets in the way of reading Street names and other things. How can I make it go away? I looked at settings and do not know how to disengage it. Maybe it is a Google map thing and has nothing to do with c:geo. Any helpful advice is welcomed.

buginformation.summary: Slow list if many caches stored
buginformation.description: 2014.04.20-NB (but most probably not new in this version): For my holiday I stored a list with an imported PQ of 1000 caches. This slows down a c:geo a lot: Scrolling through the lists is stuttering not always but most of the time Opening a single cache from the ist and returning from the cache to the list takes considerable time (1-2 seconds) The situation gets worse in the following scenario: Open cache list with 1000 caches Apply a filter (e.g. Attribut -> Medium hike) Open details of a cache from the filtered list Return to the list In this scenario two things are noticeable: Even the attribut selection list in the filter menu is stuttering when scrolling It takes 7-10 seconds until the list is shown after the last step Setting label "Unverified" as I have no possibility to take a log currently. Mabye someone can try to reproduce with a 1000-PQ. This is one of my usual holiday usecases and I never experienced such problems before (last time used in February). It is not related to the mini-compass (tested by disabling it in settings).

Looks similar to #3962 Crash: 19:53:31.751 Debug cgeo 16779 GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx?RESET=Y&redir=http%3a%2f%2fwww.geocaching.com%2fdefault.aspx%3f

buginformation.summary: Watchlist state toggling not recorded
buginformation.description: If you add a cache to your watchlist from the cache details activity, it will be put in your watchlist on the server and displayed as such on your device. However, if you go back to the cache list activity and reenter the cache details activity for the same cache, it will say that your cache is not in your watchlist while it is.

buginformation.summary: Introduce Range limit for opencaching 'nearby' searches
buginformation.description: Always returning the twenty first results from opencaching seems to be not a good idea, as you may be far off the mainland of a particular site and thus receive a number of meaningless results (several thousand kilometers away). One option can be to manually switch this site off (which would lead to some missed caches as the occasional cache is placed her and there even far off the mainland. I suggest to introduce a maximum range instead of about 100 or 200 km.

I am not sure but I suppose it was the display rotation I activated on Monday. Since then I have this issue. I think These issues are already reported: #4533 and #4540

However, the image is not visible in c:geo - I only found it by looking at the cache in Firefox. Detailed steps causing the problem: load GC6EYYH [ Sherlock Holmes' Retirement Cottage (East Dean) ] into c:geo try to view the image titled "Sherlock's Morris Men" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Only 4 images out of 5 are visible. The image titled "Sherlock's Morris Men" is not visible anywhere. But you can see it on the website. Expected behavior after performing these steps: All images (5 at the time of writing) should be visible. Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Device: D6603 (D6603, Sony) Android version: 6.0.1 Android build: 23.5.A.0.575 Cgeo version: 2016.06.09 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation vector sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Magnetometer & Accelerometer sensor: present Direction sensor used: rotation vector Hide own/found: false Map strategy: auto HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: en_GB Geocaching sites enabled: geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / PREMIUM Installed cgeo plugins: none Other comments and remarks: I also see the issue on my Nexus 7 and my partners Moto-G

buginformation.summary: WP from personal note doubled
buginformation.description: We used to have this problem some time ago, but it seems that happens again: I had 6 pair of coords in the personal note and 6 WPs created from them. I edited the personal note in c:geo and added a 7th pair of coords Saved the note and uploaded it I refreshed the cache to get the new coords parsed to a new waypoint Result: It ended up in having 10 "personal note" WPs, i.e. some are doubled The note looks like this: Station 1: N 51 20.123 E 006 58.123 Station 2: .... ... (I added Station 7)

buginformation.summary: Use text watcher to format coordinate input
buginformation.description: Similar to how phone numbers are formatted in edit texts we should add leading or trailing zeros automatically in the coordinate fields. I have been quite confused again by our non mathematical minute fraction part.

buginformation.summary: Insert last log text
buginformation.description: When I'm logging multiple trackables, then I sometimes want to repeat the log text. But typically I forget to copy it into the clipboard, while I'm logging the first one. I suggest to have a menu item "Last log text" either on the top level or behind the "Insert" menu item, which automatically puts the last used log text into the text field. Anyone with different ideas or related use cases?

buginformation.summary: Automatically check login after first credentials supplied
buginformation.description: For a new installation, we should automatically trigger the "check login" functionality after the login credentials for geocaching.com have been supplied. The login needs to be executed anyway during the next steps to get some data, but it would be good to detect errors early, while the user is still in the settings.

buginformation.summary: create waypoint based on cache coordinate
buginformation.description: I currently need to have a waypoint created based on a distance and angle from the cache coordinates. I see no way to create this easily in c:geo. We can only create such waypoints based on manually entered coordinates or based on my current coordinates. Therefore I suggest an additional button "Cache coordinates" in the coordinate input dialog, which works similar to the "my coordinates" button.

buginformation.summary: Restore debug information for live map
buginformation.description: Some time ago the live map had some debugging information in the title bar if "Debug log" was active in settings. Somehow this seems to be removed. I suggest to reimplement this, in order to allow better testing and better supporting users with live map problems. What is needed: If "Debug log" is active in setting the headline of the livemap should display something like that: Z=zoomlevel requested, s=Strategy applied, lat=Latitude requested, lon=longitude requested

buginformation.summary: Have file name in GPX import window
buginformation.description: From support mail: I use to import large GPX files (and sometimes several of them). Sadly while the import is running it does not show which file I am currently importing. This would be helpful in order not to accidently the same file again after a long importing time. So the name could be shown in the import window header or at least the "import done" window should state the file name which has just been imported.

Yes, since today Other comments and remarks: No time yet to check the logs, but I assume the LOC download is broken.
