buginformation.description: We should add more specific system information that would help us debug problems tied to specific models.

buginformation.summary: User should not be able to modify final coordinates for non-multi non-mistery caches
buginformation.description: Right now, the user can modify final coordinates of non-multi non-mistery caches because c:geo and gc.com backend allow that. However, that is not reflected on gc.com interface and may be confusing for the user. c:geo should refuse those changes as well. Related to #2271.

buginformation.summary: Support all OpenCaching URLs
buginformation.description: This works: https://opencaching.de/OC10DA9 This does not work: https://www.opencaching.de/viewcache.php?wp=OC10DA9 https://www.opencaching.de/viewcache.php?cacheid=172122

buginformation.summary: Mysterious login problems - gc.com sends 'set-cookie' header
buginformation.description: Today all of a sudden I had mysterious problems interacting with gc.com using the release version - even before the update. Luckily after some tries I could reproduce and debug it on the emulator and found that gc.com in my case sent 'set-cookie' header instead of 'Set-Cookie' - which lead to successful login and 'not logged in' when requesting the cache page. Currently no idea why this happens.

buginformation.summary: Crash when trying to add cache as favorite
buginformation.description: This is working with release version 2012.12.18 but no longer in todays nightly version: Open a found cache Click on "Add" for favorites Result: 21:37:59.796 Error AndroidRuntime 7060 FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: NPE in map source setting
buginformation.description: From the console: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.settings.SettingsActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Disable map tracking when dragging
buginformation.description: When the user drags the map, the position tracking remains on. This leads to confusion as the user drags the map, and then it jumps back to centre on the current position. This happens both with Google Maps and OpenStreetMaps. I think that c:geo's maps should follow the standard set by the Android Maps app, which is to disable tracking as soon as the user starts dragging the map. In a related note, I also feel that it would be nice if c:geo followed the Google Maps approach of putting the "tracking button" on the action bar instead of a floating button on the top corner of the map.

buginformation.summary: Include "Cache Beacon" in apps
buginformation.description: Include "Cache Beacon" as generic app like GCC. http://fun2code-blog.blogspot.de/2012/08/cache-beacon-beta-introduction.html Because the app returns an intent result, we can handle it if there's a use case. See #1338.

buginformation.summary: "Webcam photo taken" log does not mark cache as found
buginformation.description: 2014.05.03-NB: Open a saved webcam cache Post a log of type "Webcam photo taken" Result: Log is correctly shown in logbook Status is NOT changed to "Found" NO green marker in lists After manual refresh the cache is correctly marked as found.

buginformation.summary: NPE when requesting unactivated TB
buginformation.description: The TB-code mentioned has not been activated. However c:geo should catch the exception instead of crashing: D/cgeo (15593): GET http://www.geocaching.com/track/details.aspx?tracker=PCQYKT

buginformation.summary: Navigation with Sygic no longer working
buginformation.description: From support mail and confirmed by a test with 2015.03.30-NB: Open a cache Select Navigate -> Sygic Sygic will open but no navigation action is started According to users info it was working before and stopped with the recent feature release 2015.03.28.

buginformation.summary: Also show my logs in friend-logs tab
buginformation.description: The logbook page on geocaching.com has a tab for logbook, my logs and friend logs. In case I e.g. want to help someone finding a cache it would be good to have instant access to my own log for this cache. Its not worth an own tab but maybe you coud append it to the friend-log tab.

buginformation.summary: Write note for GC trackable no longer possible without tracking code
buginformation.description: 2015.04.03-NB Open any GC trackable (for me it was a TB listed in a cache and I opened it from the inventory) Select log type NOTE Enter log text Try to send the log Result: Toast is displayed, that the tracking code is missing. It seems the tracking code is needed for GKs but it is not needed for GC TB (and was working without before implmentation of GK support)

buginformation.summary: Inconsistent labels for non-event cache
buginformation.description: As noted by @Kucharskov in #4146, the labels at the top of the log book for OC110EE include "0x will attend" while this is not an event cache (it is a virtual one).

buginformation.summary: Moto G compass fails completely
buginformation.description: From support mail. A user performed an upgrade to Android 5.2 which was offered by Motorola for his device. Afterwards the compass of c:geo stopped working. I first advised to try the setting of using the orientation sensor...He reported back that it is not selectable. Other compass apps are working all the time before and after the upgrade. The sys info is as follows: --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Premium caches not identified in searches
buginformation.description: I am not sure how this was before the recent changes on gc.com. Can someone check whether we have been able to detect PM-caches from search results before ? I can see in c:geo that when doing a nearby search premium-member caches are not identified as such. That leads to the problem (reported on facebook) that the "All Member Access" filter is useless in this case. Comparing with the website search results I can see that there is a (new) icon which indicates PM-status. I don't know whether this was in form of text before... Sadly this icon is sometimes displaced by other icons for that cache (e.g. Has TB, Needs Maintenance).

buginformation.summary: Performance issue
buginformation.description: Just a reminder for me to test this and maybe clean install before retesting. I noticed today with 2016.03.14-NB that cgeo is laggy in responding to clicks. Especially after pressing the three dot button in cache details or popup may take a few seconds to open the menu.

buginformation.summary: Parsing of URLs in Personal Note
buginformation.description: A lot of mysteries use a checker with a spoiler in the solution, and I copy/paste the URL of the picture in my Personal Note to retrieve it quickly when I am on the spot. But it's very annoying to copy the URL (very difficult with my fingers and the screen, and i'm not alone in my case), and then, open the browser and paste it. Can you make it clickable? Thanks!

buginformation.summary: Concurrent modification exception in new map
buginformation.description: It looks like the old bogus unthread-safe model has been copied there (see #5906). With release 2016.08.16. java.util.ConcurrentModificationException

buginformation.summary: IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread
buginformation.description: This is also a new issue on play, but I currently have no idea how it can happen: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread.

buginformation.summary: Have setting for Logbook-loading
buginformation.description: Today I had to fight with a very slow connection out while caching. Right now, c:geo has some options settable for loading cache-details. I would like to propose, to add another option "Load Logbook" to fasten up cache-detail loading. The logbook might only be needed optionally, therefore for the logbook an optional loading would make sense. This option should be active by default, but users might deactivate it to save loading time and reduce traffic to gc.com. Of course, consequently this would also require a "button" to load it by request in the cache-detail view if not loaded by default. Does this make sense or is the amount of data so small, that it wont make any difference ?

buginformation.summary: Editing coordinates for waypoint downloaded from Gc.com crashes cgeo
buginformation.description: If stages are already present on cache and parsed by c:geo but with hidden coordinates you can't edit those stages as c:geo crashes. I was using my own build made out of master couple of days ago.

buginformation.summary: Twitter placeholder [NUMBER] adds finds plus 1
buginformation.description: It seems that the number of found caches is one too high for the Twitter placeholder while it works perfect for the log template itself.

buginformation.summary: Another OutOfMemmory
buginformation.description: Looking in market and see this too many times. java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at java.lang.String.(String.java:468) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.replaceWhitespace(cgBase.java:4566) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4527) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4279) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.requestLogged(cgBase.java:4259) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByGeocode(cgBase.java:3056) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail$loadCache.run(cgeodetail.java:1227)

buginformation.summary: Progres bar stalled at 100%
buginformation.description: Open a live map click store (about 30-40 caches) move map clicl store again (about 10 caches) Progressbar at 100% all the time

buginformation.summary: TTS has no speech output if "Use GPS only" is active in compass
buginformation.description: Activate compass Select "Use GPS only" (which is an important choice in case you carry the phone in your pocket and want to listen to TTS only) Select "Start speech" Nothing happens Thanks @rsudev for the hint to test this

buginformation.summary: IllegalStateException short after editing personal note
buginformation.description: 2015.07.13-NB but not clearly reproducible Open a saved cache Edit existing personal note and save it Select Upload When selecting upload or short before just after saving the note c:geo crashes sometimes: 12:49:46.450 Error cgeo 10085 [main] UncaughtException

buginformation.summary: NPE when activiating live on map
buginformation.description: With current master I have the following problem: Search for a location Map the results Select Menu -> Enable Live Crash: 11:22:32.937 Error AndroidRuntime 15954 FATAL EXCEPTION: main

buginformation.summary: Find number missing in logbook entries
buginformation.description: Since two days the nightlies won't show me the find count of the users in the logbook: I don't know whether something changed in the nightly or the website changed. It may also be possible, that it is a problem of my SGS2 after upgrade to android 4.0.4. I will check other devices later, but maybe someone of you can crosscheck

buginformation.summary: Crosscheck new preferences page
buginformation.description: Recently gc.com changed the content of http://www.geocaching.com/account/ManagePreferences.aspx which is used in the login process of c:geo. It is now forwarded to https://www.geocaching.com/myaccount/settings/preferences with a new UI. I tested that the date format seems still to be detected correct, but I did not test all possible formats (so I am not 100% sure). Additionally I don't know what else other information we retrieve from the mentioned URL. Please notice that now also HTTPS is used. Can someone confirm that all is working normal at this point?

buginformation.summary: Redesign detail-page
buginformation.description: As said in #829, the detail-page should be redesigned (remove the stupid list, more graphically, user-friendly). I'm open for drafts (as image).

buginformation.summary: check GPS enabled state
buginformation.description: Since a while I have a phone with Android 2.3.6 which allows enabling/disabling GPS very easily from the status bar. I now have it disabled by default (so Facebook and other apps can not track my position), but always forget to activate it for c:geo and then wonder why the position is not updated. We really need to have a check in the tool whether or not GPS is enabled (at least when entering the map) and to notify the user or to activate it by ourselfes then. Not sure if there are duplicates for this, I didn't find one with the quick search.

buginformation.summary: OX caches should have blank before rating
buginformation.description: OX caches have a line like Traditional Cache(2.0/1.0/3.0) There should be a blank before the opening brace. We could even think about removing all information that is already shown elsewhere.

buginformation.summary: Crash on GPX export
buginformation.description: From PlayStore in new market version 2013.05.13: ava.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: Inventory Order when logging a cache
buginformation.description: Previously Inventory was in alphabetical name order when you were logging a cache. Since the last update, a new little icon is next to them, but it is no longer in alphabetical order. This makes it very time consuming to scroll thru and find the ones you want.

buginformation.summary: More sensible default for waypoint type on creation
buginformation.description: I propose to make a more sensible default for the type of a waypoint when creating a new one, depending on the type of cache: Traditional: Keep Reference point Mystery: Make „Final“ default Multi: Make „Stage of Multi“ default (or whatever the english translation is in the moment) — yes i know that then at the end you have to change to „Final“. But normally Multis have more than one stage, but only one final. Others: Don't know, perhaps you guys have ideas? Else keep „Reference Point“. I personally never need a „reference point“, and so i have to constantly change the type of waypoint when i need one. Just a small thing, but it would mean less annoyance. Thanks for considering.

buginformation.summary: New map: Title for heading line not updated
buginformation.description: Open map (new mapsforge implementation) Click on a cache to open the popup Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Heading line is shown and title is the correct geocache previously selected Click on the waypoint of a another cache (but not on the cache itself) Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Result: The heading line is updated correctly but the title still shows the cache which was selected in the first step (Problem does only occur for waypoint icons but not for cache icons)

buginformation.summary: Filtering by Status=disabled also shows archived
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: have a list o caches imported from a GPX generated by GSAK based on geocaching.com data filter, select by status = disabled Actual behavior after performing these steps: disabled and archived caches are shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: only disabled caches to be shown. Version of c:geo used: 2016-05-09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Android 4.2.1

buginformation.summary: Logging with oc not possible without entering user credentials for gc
buginformation.description: When trying to log a cache, the menu is available for oc caches, but disabled. It si only enabled when credentials for gc are stored (it doesn't matter whether they are valid or if gc os activated).

buginformation.summary: Force close OutOfMemmory
buginformation.description: It happens while zooming maps. It fails in native memmory not heap. Might be related to caches dissaperaing and reapearing. (#5) java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: bitmap size exceeds VM budget at android.graphics.Bitmap.nativeCreate(Native Method) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:468) at com.google.android.maps.ZoomHelper.createSnapshot(ZoomHelper.java:444) at com.google.android.maps.ZoomHelper.doZoom(ZoomHelper.java:151) at com.google.android.maps.ZoomHelper.doZoom(ZoomHelper.java:140) at com.google.android.maps.MapView.doZoom(MapView.java:1478) at com.google.android.maps.MapView.doZoom(MapView.java:1487) at com.google.android.maps.MapView$6.onZoom(MapView.java:1442) at android.widget.ZoomButtonsController$3.onClick(ZoomButtonsController.java:268) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:2408) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:8816) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4669) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:876) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:634) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

buginformation.summary: Add the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes
buginformation.description: This is a feature request for the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes. Use case example: Go on a multi cache hunt Store the cache locally Write down A, B, C, etc. in the personal notes section of the multi cache Calculate the final coord by switching between personal notes and a calculator app back and forth. When done, you have the final coord written down in your personal notes. Now you have to swipe left twice and hit the "Add waypoint" button to add the final coords. The little window opens and you have to put in the numbers. My personal problem here is that I can't kepp more than 5 numbers in mind, so I enter the North coordinate, hit the tick symbol, go back to personal notes, read the East coord, go back to waypoints and enter the East coordinate. (You see, this workflow works and the app does what it should, but it could be easier for the user I think.) Expected behavior: I personally see two possible improvements: Expect the app to parse my personal notes after saving for something like "Final: N 47.123 E 8 33.123" and create the waypoint accordingly. Highlight the coord in the personal notes and allow the user by clicking on it to choose "Add to waypoints" or "Update existing waypoint"... something like that Version of c:geo used: Not relevant System information: Not relevant Other comments and remarks: I love caching and your app since 2011 - big thanks to you guys!

buginformation.summary: Personal note parsing might be too loose
buginformation.description: Seen on Facebook: Mike Binnemann: [basic member] I now have almost always a new waypoint with the name personal note, when I edit my personal note. These waypoints I can not delete it. Often these mird entered twice in the field even after the edit personal note. The previous text is displayed after the new text, separated only by a line of ---. Mike Exemple note: 1 T 126

buginformation.summary: Bug:NM attribute not cleared
buginformation.description: If a cache do not have any attributes except the Need Maintenence flag, that attribute is not removed on refresh after the attribute is cleared on the geocaching site. #3370 is closed but the bug is still there.

buginformation.summary: Add event-logtypes to Field Notes export
buginformation.description: Will Attend and Attended, I've forgotten it and will fix it.

buginformation.summary: Follow up: Filter out stored caches
buginformation.description: I just tried the patch from issue #2640 in the current nightly: I would appreciate having a possibility to filter out stored caches e.g. in search results. It works great. However sometimes the search result does not show full details below the cachename. ("GC... -" instead of "GC... - D 1.5 - T 1.5 - Regular - Offline") In this case the filter has no effects. If I manually open and close an offline cache the details appear. Is this an intended behavior? Is there a workaround for this?

buginformation.summary: Exception in search by user for non existing user name
buginformation.description: 01-14 18:03:36.224: W/cgeo(7905): 400 [Bad Request] (226 ms) GET http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/users/by_username?fields=uuid&username=silizius83&langpref=de%7Cen

buginformation.summary: Support loading existing log pictures
buginformation.description: According to http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/logs/entry.html it should be possible to load the picture associated to log entries of a cache. @rsudev I wonder a little bit, that I did not notice that we don't support this some time before. Is something wrong here or is it really that we never supported it?

buginformation.summary: Doubled friend log in standard logbook
buginformation.description: Not sure whether a special case or a general bug: I have a cache where I see the friend log (only log on friend logbook page) doubled in the normal logbook page. The cache has only 18 logs, so all its logs are contained in the normal logbook page. 2014.06.06-NB

buginformation.summary: Duplicate short description not recognized
buginformation.description: OCE142

buginformation.summary: Search result limited to 40 caches
buginformation.description: Three users contacted us with the following problem: Market release 2014.06.11 Perform "Nearby search" or search by location First 20 results are returned Press more to load more results 40 results are returned and "No more caches" is shown The bahviour is reproducible for them independently of the searched location/keywords/etc. I performed the same searches and can not find any problem yet. Any idea from the code?

buginformation.summary: Offline log not indicated on map
buginformation.description: I don't know whether this has a relation to #1440 therefore I open another issue for now: Does not depend on offline-mode activated or not Select "log cache" from (live)map and store the log (e.g. if you want to export field notes later) After return to the map the cache is not marked as having a saved log (red smiley) Only when leaving and reopening the map it is marked correctly

buginformation.summary: History menu contains not working "Import"
buginformation.description: The menu of the history contains an item "Import", but nothing happens when pressing on it (only the menu closes).

buginformation.summary: Crash when user enters invalid coordinates
buginformation.description: With release 2014.04.01: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$ParseException: N 49° 11,571 E 1642309° 00,000

buginformation.summary: Back from waypoint editor should not save automatically
buginformation.description: I know we discussed this briefly somewhere. Now I crosschecked with current release and new relase candiate (with modified waypoint layout): On the current release 2015.03.31 pressing back while editing the waypoint discarded the changes. With 2015.05.29-RC pressing back will save changes made I think we should either adopt the old working mode (don't save on back) or preferably show a dialog with "Save" or "Discard" options.

buginformation.summary: Hidden date missing
buginformation.description: 2016.02.09-NB Open previously unsaved cache Hidden date is misisng in cache detail screen Older saved caches do show the hidden date and it is kept also after refesh With 2016.01.21-NB on my other device it is working.

buginformation.summary: Import from web does not work if started a second time
buginformation.description: Maybe a follow up of #3550 : Start "Import from web" Send a cache to c:geo Result: OK Press "Cancel" Start "Import from web" again Send another cache to c:geo Result: Nothing happens. Kill c:geo Restart c:geo and start "Import from web" Now the queued cache from step 6 is downloaded

buginformation.summary: Find count for gc.com not working
buginformation.description: Just noticed that when logging in the total caches found shows 0 - not what you have achieved. Not sure if Geocaching.com have updated something and causing an error on the app.

buginformation.summary: Popup downloaded each time again
buginformation.description: If I click on a cache on live map the additionl request just implemented is performed. Returning to live map and clicking the cache another time does the same request again. Can't the retrieved Information be saved so another request is not necessary (and it will not contain new information)

buginformation.summary: Recognize geocache imported from GSAK as "with corrected coordinates"
buginformation.description: Hi, I am working on solving a series of 139 mystery caches in GSAK. When exporting the solved caches to a GPX and importing them in c:geo, it would be nice if c:geo would recognize the caches are solved i.e. it recognizes that there are corrected coordinates. The export from GSAK does contain the original coordinates, so I think the import could recognize this? Sample waypoint with corrected coordinates:

buginformation.summary: Caches vanish from lists when storing them
buginformation.description: Market release 2014.06.11: Disable Menu -> Settings -> Offline-data -> "Ask for list" Perform a search (e.g. by city) Select "Store for Offline" from the resulting list Cache storage progress is shown normally After storing has been finished you will see that the number of total stored caches (on the main menu) did not increase nor are those caches visible in any of the lists. A fix for this should go to the release branch if possible.

buginformation.summary: Waypoints from personal note not removed
buginformation.description: When a waypoint is added by c:geo from personal note on gc and when those coords are removed from the cache description on gc.com they are not removed in c:geo. Neither the note or the waypoint is removed after refresh. If the note is manually removed from comments the delete option is still not shown on the waypoint.

buginformation.summary: red flag missing on map for mystery caches, where the listing itself includes final coords
buginformation.description: For mystery-caches, which include final coords already in the listing, which is sometimes the case for challenge-caches, the additional red flag over the cache symbol is displayed in the list view, but not on the map view. Example: http://coord.info/GC5AZ68 Version: latest nightly, but noticed this already few months ago.

buginformation.summary: RxJava periodic timer is not stopped in onPause
buginformation.description: We had several user reports issues with hangs/ANRs after unlocking a phone that has been locked on the map screen for an extended period (10 mins till over 1 hour). Digging into this I was able to see, that the unsubscribe in CGeoMap.onPause does not stop the LoadTimerAction from being called. According to my limited knowledge this is what unsubscribe is for. I was unable to finally deduce if this is an implementation Problem (incorrect Api usage) or a bug in rxJava. If the latter is true, it seems to be present even in the latest 0.19.0 version (I could not fully switch to that, but had to fake/comment out stuff related to the GeoDir handler in order to build it) Any of the more experienced (@samueltardieu @Bananeweizen ) that can shed some light on this or provide pointers for further research?

buginformation.summary: Waypoint sorting
buginformation.description: With the current RC I have seen in GC3853R, that the WPs are not sorted according to their name or short name nor sorted acc. to the website sequence. I don't know, how the implementation works, but the cache above shows, that it might need improvement ?!

buginformation.summary: Calendar plugin should also read short description for time
buginformation.description: GC4RN8X has the time in the short description I believe

buginformation.summary: Use same "gpx" directory for export and import
buginformation.description: Currently the gpx export writes into a directory "gpxexport", naming the file by the current timestamp. I suggest to instead use the "gpx" directory that we also use for import and to put something like "cgeo_export_[timestamp]" into the file name. That way we don't have to manage 2 different locations. And it also becomes easier to do manual roundtrip testing. :) I've labeled this "feedback" because SammysHP worked on that feature mostly and I may have overlooked some very strong argument for the current "gpxexport" directory.

buginformation.summary: Refresh all without progress
buginformation.description: At least six users report, that from time to time the refresh of several or all caches does have no progress, i.e. it is stuck at 0%. At the same time updating single caches work. As we recently changed the network operation in this area I open this issue for further investigation.

buginformation.summary: Disable trail on map does not refresh
buginformation.description: The trail only disappears on next move.

buginformation.summary: Display save state in map view
buginformation.description: When I'm on a quick caching tour somewhere I usually look on the live map, select a few caches (thanks to the new overlay mode that displays more info on the cache without that the details have to be opened!) and save them to the local list. What I'm now missing though is a small visual indicator that I already saved a particular cache, especially in regions with many caches, so I don't accidentially click on such a cache again and try to save it.

buginformation.summary: Navigation method deactivation does not work
buginformation.description: 2014.08.24-RC2 Go to Settings -> Navigation ->Navigation menu Deactivate an available navigation methos (in my case: "Navigation (Fahrrad)") Open a cache Select Navigate from action bar Result: The navigation menu still contains the deactivated method Facebook users also confirmed this.

buginformation.summary: Bad memory usage
buginformation.description: cgeoapplication.searches is an unsynchronized hash map which is never cleared and is accessed concurrently. It grows every time you do a search, and will grow rapidly if you use the live map while driving. The best way to fix that would be to totally remove this hash map and pass the cgSearch objects around as they are used so that they can be garbage collected when they are no longer used.

buginformation.summary: History sorted incorrectly
buginformation.description: History is sorted by the time when the offline log was created, not the date that was set for the log.

buginformation.summary: Calendar add-on doesn't work in Android 4.0
buginformation.description: With ICS, the unofficial methods of accessing calendars no longer work. There is now an API for accessing the calendar. http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/calendar-provider.html Trying it in 4.0 gives following partial stack trace: 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): no such column: displayName: , while compiling: SELECT _id, displayName FROM Calendars WHERE (selected=1) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: displayName: , while compiling: SELECT _id, displayName FROM Calendars WHERE (selected=1) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.database.DatabaseUtils.readExceptionFromParcel(DatabaseUtils.java:179) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.database.DatabaseUtils.readExceptionFromParcel(DatabaseUtils.java:135) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.content.ContentProviderProxy.query(ContentProviderNative.java:358) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.content.ContentResolver.query(ContentResolver.java:311) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at android.app.Activity.managedQuery(Activity.java:1706) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at cgeo.calendar.CalendarActivity.selectCalendarForAdding(CalendarActivity.java:82) 03-06 19:15:23.187: E/cgeo.calendar(770): at cgeo.calendar.CalendarActivity.onCreate(CalendarActivity.java:53)

buginformation.summary: Checkbox not correct if c:geo performs autoswitch to imperial units
buginformation.description: Having tested these builds: (posted in #4097) https://www.dropbox.com/sh/f9nj0u9tnhgnm7t/AACKQQLMrQ0uKfSO71XlcRnVa?dl=0 both JIT and non-JIT exhibit the same problem: freshly installed cgeo (old one uninstalled) starts by showing imperial units on the map. In settings, appearance, the corresponding checkbox is unchecked. I can only get metric units by toggling on then off this setting. The current release version in googe play does not have this issue. (tested).

buginformation.summary: Cache type "GS block party" no longer parsed as event cache
buginformation.description: At my last test (some months ago) GS block party caches have been parsed as event cache which is OK as they are basically events (according to log types, etc.). The current master is parsing it as unknown cache type. Example: GC3X684

buginformation.summary: Select default navigation tool
buginformation.description: As suggested in #828 we should have a setting to select the default navigation tool. Currently the compass has a special role. It is used in the action bar and it has a separate entry in the menus while other navigation tools are all grouped together in a sub menu. If we had an option to choose a default navigation tool (instead of hardcoding the compass), every user could invoke his preferred tool (radar, maps, ...) using less clicks. (Personally I can understand the request from #828 very good. I use maps much more than the compass.)

buginformation.summary: Placeholder [LOG] not working for TB tweets
buginformation.description: With current nightly I tested the [LOG] template. For geocaches it is working as designed. However for logging a TB (discovering) I composed the template: Trackable: [URL]

buginformation.summary: TB from OC-GPX-imports
buginformation.description: If I import a GPX from opencaching.de and the cache has GeoKrets listed they are normally viewed in the TB-section. This is OK, however If I tap them cgeo tries to open a detail-page (I assume it tries via gc.com) and fails. There should be no action associated for tapping on a TB in OC-caches as it is offline only.

buginformation.summary: Concurrent map access
buginformation.description: I often find concurrent requests (here the last three GET requests start before the previous one has returned), which probably explain the concurrent access causing data corruption and exceptions while browsing the live map as the results may be handled concurrently. Anyway, this is a real problem that must be fixed independently of whether it fixes all the map issues or not. D/cgeo (24758): GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx

buginformation.summary: Imperial Units in Compass Speech Output
buginformation.description: I haven't had a chance to test it, but from looking at the code, it doesn't look like the speech output follows users choice for Imperial Units for distances. Assigning myself.

buginformation.summary: TTS volume can only be changed if speech output is active at that moment
buginformation.description: Activate compass "Start speech" As long as the output is running I can change the volume of the output In the pauses between the output the volume change buttons on my device only change the ringtone volume I was not sure, whether this is a technical limitation, therefore I crosschecked with the original GCBabble and there it is possible to change the output volume also during speech pauses. I think this should also be possible within c:geo. Typically when using loudspeaker you may want to reduce the volume before the next output starts (e.g. in case you walk into a crowd of people) but you actually can not do that but just reduce your ringtone volume instead.

buginformation.summary: Working mode of unreliable marker
buginformation.description: I just tried out c:geo NB with a basic member account. If I have seen it correctly all the caches on live-map (except the caches stored on the device) will appear with non-reliable marker. I know, that the reliability can only be checked if the user is PM. Assuming that this functionality will go to the market, I guess that many basic-member users will not understand why the caches are marked as unreliable and will probably not like this feature or even don't trust the app anymore. The change to look-and-feel is to drastic. In fact in most cases the caches shown to basic-members will have reliable coordinates anyway, but we just cant detect that right now. I hope, that I understood the the working-mode of the reliable-check, if not please correct me and/or close this issue. After having seen the look-and-feel for basic-members I would like to suggest to think over the display of reliability in the following way: For premium members only mark unreliable by a orange-circle and reliable without marker (like currently implemented) For basic members only mark reliable by a green-circle and unreliable without marker Doing it in this way each type of user would only get notified by a marker in important cases on his user-perspective and not be overwhelmed by a lot of caches marked in some way. What do you think ?

buginformation.summary: Find count missing for some users including major problems using c:geo
buginformation.description: With the current market version (2012.06.06) some users seem to experence the problem, that the number of found caches are not shown on the mainscreen footer. Additionally the [NUMBER] is not working. I am trying to find out if the is anything special in their usernames, membership status, etc. Will report back.

buginformation.summary: Share function should use http://coord.info/ URL
buginformation.description: Some time ago the "Open in Browser" function was changed to use "http://www.geocaching.com//...". I understood this change but was it intended that also the "Share" function now uses this workaround-URL ? I think it should use the coord.info URL to allow e.g. forwarding via mail and the recipient to open it in c:geo (or another app) again.

buginformation.summary: Special log types on unpublished caches
buginformation.description: We support showing unpublished caches for the owner. That works normal in 2014.03.01-NB. However the special log types are not recognized. This is a minor problem in a special case, but still a bug. Here is a source of an unpublished cache with typical log types "Post reviewer note" and "Submit for Review": https://www.dropbox.com/s/j7bj3ea2j2pby0h/logbook_postreviewernote_Submit%20for%20review.htm

buginformation.summary: wrong icon when navigating to parking lot
buginformation.description: Have a cache with a parking lot waypoint. Open the map for the cache and look at the final and the parking lot icons. Everything fine. Now open the map from the parking lot waypoint instead. The icon is no longer a parking icon, but a reference point icon.

buginformation.summary: TB details empty
buginformation.description: Current NB version Details for TB48JVN are not shown. Other TBs are working.

buginformation.summary: Bad menu item label
buginformation.description: Just installed a new emulator. In the cache list menu I see "Export: %1$s" as last item.

buginformation.summary: NPE in GeoDirHandler
buginformation.description: From the console: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Icon for log images invisible on white background
buginformation.description: Best would be to have it filled with black color and to give it some black outline

buginformation.summary: Missing own spoilerimages
buginformation.description: Hello! I recognized that spoilerimages are not listed in listing of my own caches. Same thing is reproducable on my friends app. Can anyone tell something about it? Thanks!

buginformation.summary: NumberFormatException in SettingsActivity
buginformation.description: From the console: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.settings.SettingsActivity}: java.lang.NumberFormatException: Invalid int: ""

buginformation.summary: NPE when selected image cannot be decoded
buginformation.description: From console: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: return to list after gpx import
buginformation.description: Currently the main screen is shown after leaving the gpx import. Instead the previous list should be available again.

buginformation.summary: log dates not showing
buginformation.description: Downloaded latest version this morning (27/8/11), and logs are showing number of cache finds, but not the date of the log.

buginformation.summary: Event caches not marked as found
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: Copy coords from waypoints
buginformation.description: It is possible to paste coords to wayponts. See #3799 But there is no way afaik to copy cords FROM waypoints. I find a need for this very often when I want to share coordinates with friends on the fly. One possible implementation of this might be to add a "Copy coords" option to the long-press menu of a waypoint. Another would be a "Share coords" option that presents a list of possible Share providers like on the Share Cache option.

buginformation.summary: Crash when adding personal note from WP or Images tab
buginformation.description: Found this strange issue during Russian localization testing. Here is the test case: Store a cache for offline use. Open Cache details Slide to page with Waypoints or Images Press button with 3 dots Press 'Personal notes" Enter some text Press "OK" Application will crash. Some notes: The case is not reproducible from Description or Details or Logbook pages, only from Images and WP I found that I cannot add a personal note to a cache if it wasn't stored. Button "Personal notes" just does nothing. I assume this as a separated FR to allow to write personal notes for non-stored caches (or add error message for such case) My phone is Xperia Z3 Compact, Android 5.1.1 C:geo 2015.11.29-NB1-a4faa8b

buginformation.summary: "Import from android"enabled in history
buginformation.description: That import menu item should not be enabled when looking at the history.

buginformation.summary: Filter "Only non PM caches"
buginformation.description: From support mail: Currently in lists and nearby result you can filter "Status" -> "Only PM". Would it be possible to implement the inverse function "Only Non-PM", which could be quite useful for basic member to hide those from the result. I agree to that, on the other hand I know that the whole filter thing should be reworked. However I think this would be easy to do at the mentioned place as a workaround for now.

buginformation.summary: webcam caches not detected as found
buginformation.description: Tbc Sent by mobile

buginformation.summary: Cannot erase personal note from server
buginformation.description: If an empty note is sent to the gc.com server, it does not affect the previous note. An empty string should be sent as the json "dto.et" component, not null. Due to code changes in this area, this must likely be fixed separately in both: master release

buginformation.summary: Load OC caches in preferred language (OKAPI)
buginformation.description: I had a discussion with some OKAPI people, and we miss to load cache descriptions of multi-lingual caches in the users language. Example German/Dutch: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5177 Example Dutch/English: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5199

buginformation.summary: System information can not be copied
buginformation.description: While on my Samsung S4 I can copy the system information to the clipboard using 2015.01.08-RC I am unable to do so with an HTC One Mini using 2015.01.08-NB3. Not sure whether it is caused by the different c:geo versions or just a bug of the HTC?

buginformation.summary: Array index out of bounds exception on map
buginformation.description: I am sure we already have an issue somewhere with a similar thing (or it is just on Google Play crash reports up to now): Normally this issue happens after using the live map quite a long time (scrolling, loading, and so on). However just now I tested 2015.01.11-RC with all available connectors activated and just after some movement of the live map I got the following in the log. Note: This is no crash at that time, only the exception in the debug log. 23:25:57.409 Error cgeo 3811 [main] GoogleMapView.draw

buginformation.summary: TextUtils.getMatch ignores `last` parameter
buginformation.description: The last parameter of TextUtils.getMatch is unused, although it gives the method different semantics. The method is used with last being true and false, so it is really meant to be used.

buginformation.summary: Hint images not displayed when returning from external applications
buginformation.description: Open GC472ME in c:geo, click on hint images, click on an image to launch an external viewer, press back: images will not be displayed again, only the spinning circles will be shown. Happens at least in nightly of Feb. 19. Does not happen on release. Labelling as "high" as this is a regression.

buginformation.summary: NPE for static maps on "Any destination"
buginformation.description: I just played around and have seen that the Navigate-menu in "Any destination" also contains the item "Static maps". Steps: Go to "Any destination" Click menu and select Navigate -> Static maps or Download static maps c:geo is stuck some time at the menu and crashed after that The log says: 05-15 23:45:22.740 W/dalvikvm(23483): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x40c2d1f8)

buginformation.summary: c:geo crashes when importing large GPX file
buginformation.description: Is there some known limitations for importing a GPX file? I tried to import a 44MB file and it crashes at 99% reading the file (around 1600 caches with lots of logs). If I remove the last few caches in the file (file size is now 42MB), reading the file finishes, but the app crashes when loading the caches (at around 2%). First, I assumed that some strange character or a misformed GPX file would be the reason, yet loading only the last few caches of the file works well without c:geo crashing. geggi

buginformation.summary: Merging of personal note not OK
buginformation.description: I wull precise this problem later by testing, just a reminder until then. I created a note in cgeo like that: a=.. b=.. etc up to f=... I uploaded this note to gc.com Some hours later I refreshed the cache and got this: merged: a=5 b=1 c=4

buginformation.summary: Position not saved on logbook screen
buginformation.description: From support mail: c:geo used to remember the position to which I scrolled on each tab of the cache details. Now this is still working except for the log tab. I tested this with the result: Open cache details Change to logbook screen Scroll down some log entries (and keep it in mind) Change to description screen Chane back to logbook screen Result: Position is still the same Now change to e.g. to details screen (more than one slide away from logbook!) Change back to logbook screen Result: The logbook position has been resetted and is opened at the top

buginformation.summary: Spoiler-images are downloaded in a downscaled version
buginformation.description: Actually it's a gc.com-bug, but it affects our spoiler-image-display. Since the last gc.com-update the url looks like this: http://img.geocaching.com/cache/display/ff090f89-c3e8-474b-9f43-f663e38b97e1.jpg This version is downscaled to 200 px for the long side. You must remove the /display to get the full version: http://img.geocaching.com/cache/ff090f89-c3e8-474b-9f43-f663e38b97e1.jpg

buginformation.summary: New placeholer [LOG] for twitter template
buginformation.description: For sharing in twitter it is meaningful to be able to share the logtext (at least the first 140 characters) by default. This would be a new placeholder (only for twitter posts) as for the signature, inserting the logtext makes no sense.

buginformation.summary: Speech output in compass
buginformation.description: As I believe that the integration and rework of GCBabble is a huge effort, I've now implemented our own speaking service. Can be started and stopped from the menu of the compass (and runs as long as the compass activity only). Currently it updates the voice output every 30 seconds and tells you "11 o'clock, 270 meters". The voice output probably makes absolutely no sense in other languages than German and English, as it will use your locale for the voice, but the English text (as there are no other translations yet). Have fun.

buginformation.summary: Map popup shows earth cache size
buginformation.description: In cache details we hide the size for earth caches. In the map popup we wrongly show it. When fixing this, make sure the same condition is used. I guess we hide it for all virtual caches.

buginformation.summary: Trackable name and type not parsed
buginformation.description: Due to gc.com changes on 28.01.2014 name and owner of a trackable are no longer parsed correctly when searched.

buginformation.summary: Show on Map
buginformation.description: "Showing on Map" is not working, it hangs, then screen get's black, an error message occours (so short so it's not readable) and it returns back to cache. Reproduce: open a cache (nearest, safed, live map....), show compas, menu->show on map

buginformation.summary: Strange date format in logbook
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open Logbook of a cache Actual behavior after performing these steps: Dates are truncated as there is a prepended weekday Expected behavior after performing these steps: Date should fit Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.06 Is the problem reproducible for you? Reported on support mail for the device mentioned below System information: --- System information ---

buginformation.summary: Feature request: Show mapsforge-map "bigger" on high-res-displays
buginformation.description: The Text of Street-, Building-, and Area-Names is displayed very small on high-res-devices. In the moment I help myself with zoom in and try to read the text in that second until the more detailed map picture is shown (with small text again). In that second the text have a nice-to-read-sice. I have no very bad eyes so I think we need a "bigger" map-scale for high-res-displays.

buginformation.summary: Change name of waypoint in relation to a type
buginformation.description: Currently when adding waypoint "name" if before "type". When you start typing a name "Sta" Autocomplete offers "stages of multi-cache", however type stays Reference point. My idea is to move "type" before "Name" and when user changes type and name is still empty the name be filled with default text. What do you think?

buginformation.summary: Selection mode in lists stay on
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Create an empty list Open list with caches and select some of them Move to empty list (cache follow you) Press menu (looks like selection mode)

buginformation.summary: Need maintenance seems no valid log type on OC.de
buginformation.description: I posted a needs maintenance of a OC.de cache OCC696 with c:geo. After updating the cache I do only see a log type note. Looking at the oc.de website it seems that logging "Needs maintenance" is no valid option when logging. I do only see Found, Not Found and Note.

buginformation.summary: NPE in menu handler
buginformation.description: ava.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Include info about debug mode into system information
buginformation.description: With the fix for #2281 it was introduced that c:geo is aborted on log.e when debug mode is active. It might happen that users claim such events on support. Having that cause in mind it would be good if the current setting could be included in the system information in About c:geo -> System like: Debug mode active: Yes/No 👍 1

buginformation.summary: Trackable in hands of cacher problems
buginformation.description: If a trackable is in the hands of a cacher then the TB page says "In the hands of XXX". This text is clickable and should open a menu where "XXX" is used as data. Right now the data is "In the hands of XXX" that will lead to opening invalid links in browser or trying to view invalid data. The problem is that UserActionsClickListener.java is using the full text of the view as data...

buginformation.summary: runtimeexception on emulator
buginformation.description: I've just run into a missing sensor exception. That needs to be handled a bit more gracefully. 08-25 21:40:43.159: E/AndroidRuntime(10445): Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: orientation sensor is absent on this device

buginformation.summary: "Send to" for the text fields in cache details
buginformation.description: Now that we have the possibility to translate several fields of a cache, it would also be nice to invoke arbitrary apps with those texts (maybe a different translation app, the mail app, ...). Therefore we should have another menu item in that context menu of text fields similar to the "Send to" menu of the cache itself (using "text/plain" as mime type in this case).

buginformation.summary: Failure in testEditModifiedCoordinates
buginformation.description: From jenkins after gc.com site update 2013.02.20 [exec] Failure in testEditModifiedCoordinates:

buginformation.summary: Scrolling broken after selection
buginformation.description: Select some text of the description. Close selection mode. Try to scroll the view up and down. It jumps around.

buginformation.summary: Request of offline log only feature
buginformation.description: First, great feature. I love the simplicity when I know I'm going to use field notes. However, I think when logging offline, our signatures that we have set to insert automatically should go into the logs. Currently they don't.

buginformation.summary: Bug in coordinates input
buginformation.description: When type coordinate in DDD° MM.MMM' and MMM' is under 100 is not correct save. E.g. 009 is saving 900 and 99 is change in 990. In Plain mode this is not happing.

buginformation.summary: Spotted field is wrong for GKs
buginformation.description: 2015.05.18-NB Open GKC240 The "spotted" field shows "in GC1HKWQ" but in fact the GK was only visited there and is still with a user (with myself). For a GC trackable the user name of the curent holder is shown in such a case. Not sure whether this is a bug or a different function at GK.

buginformation.summary: Wrong error toast if BM tries to open a PMO-cache
buginformation.description: 2016.02.25-NB (but maybe also in current market release) Login as BM Perform nearby search Open a premium caches from the result list Unknown error is shown instead of the the correct message, that the cache is only for PM

buginformation.summary: GPX-Import fails at name with quotes
buginformation.description: Hello, when I import GPX files created with GeoToad, the import fails if there are any quotes in the cache's name. Example: < name > & quot ; Wunnibert & quot ; < / name > I deleted the & quot ; there and the other filds containing the name manually and then it works You can use this file to analyze the issue: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19803762/Teilen/gt_GC1T3MK_GC2KN6K_fails.gpx https://dl.dropbox.com/u/19803762/Teilen/gt_GC1T3MK_GC2KN6K_works.gpx I use c:geo 2012.06.18 on SE Experia Active ST17i, Android 2.3.4 I would apreciate if anyone could fix this. Thank you

buginformation.summary: My find count not inserted into logs
buginformation.description: When writing a log it does not work to insert your find number into the log. Neither insert->number nor [NUMBER] in signature works. NB1602 used.

buginformation.summary: Please provide help (manual access) on coordinate input
buginformation.description: Currently, the new coordinate input dialog -- which is just great, by the way! -- does not allow users to ask for help. Please add a title row to the dialog containing the usual "?" help action button. The next manual release will contain the corresponding new topic with an identifier of "c:geo-geocoordinate-input". Thanks! -- geocrasher

buginformation.summary: Mapsforge errouts with no sdcard
buginformation.description: We are affected by this Mapsforge bug according to Google Play console: https://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=256 Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: could not create directory: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/org.mapsforge.android.maps/cache/1

buginformation.summary: Existing corrupted databases
buginformation.description: Some databases on people devices are corrupted: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: own: , while compiling: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude, longitude, note, own FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = ? ORDER BY _id LIMIT 100

buginformation.summary: picture for attributes not shown
buginformation.description: The picture for attributes not shown after import caches with gpx. After refresh in detail view its all good.

buginformation.summary: reCaptcha unreadable or nonfunctional
buginformation.description: It might be only me, but while testing basic member functions today, I was not successful entering the right letters as it looks really blurred for me. I will check in the website later, whether it is really that unreadable or we habe an issue while showing it. There is also a chance, that I entered it correct but the function behind is no longer working...I am not sure if the same loc file procedure is called as for premium members or it was forgotten to adapt it at this point.

buginformation.summary: Crash when trying to open lists
buginformation.description: With 2014.06.13-NB I can no longer open the list of saved caches. Log will follow later.

buginformation.summary: Back button in spoiler view leaves the app
buginformation.description: 2016.02.03: Open a cache which has spoiler pictures Open spoiler pictures by clicking on the icon in cache details Use the action bar back button to leave the spoiler picture view Result: Instead of returning to the cache detail screen c:geo is ended.

buginformation.summary: Force close on startup on some Alcatel devices
buginformation.description: For the current RC-version 2014.08.20-RC1 two users with Alcatel devices on FB report that c:geo force closes on startup. Alcatel One Touch Idol for the french provider Bouygues Telecom Android 4.1.1 Alcatel Onetouch Star 6010x Android 4.1.1.

buginformation.summary: TB-logs not shown when date format is set other than GC-default
buginformation.description: Opening a trackable c:geo only shows the "goal", "about" and the photo but not the last logs. In my opinion this feature would be helpful for the user (e.g. to look where the TB has already been in the past, etc.)

buginformation.summary: Add license information for showcaseview in about dialog
buginformation.description: Check other libraries, too.

buginformation.summary: Calendar addon violates calendar contract
buginformation.description: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/CalendarContract.Events.html: If allDay is set to 1 eventTimezone must be TIMEZONE_UTC and the time must correspond to a midnight boundary.

buginformation.summary: PQ-import dont work if "include name" is enabled at gc.com and the name contain a german umlaut
buginformation.description: Hope this is not a duplicate, - i found nothing in the old issues. I created a PQ named "Rügen Auswahl" at gc.com and marked the option " Include Pocket Query name in download file name" there. But I was not able to import it to c:geo. I get the Error Message "Bad bite at 10". It worked with two workarounds: open the zip and rename the gpx-files so that the umlauts are gone create a PQ without this name-option. Here the not-working file: http://db.tt/WUkVQ9Hu

buginformation.summary: Send2cgeo PIN not showing up (finish locale)
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Finish language Use "Register" in send2cgeo service to obtain a PIN from our server Actual behavior after performing these steps: Instead of the PIN ### is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: PIN is shown. Version of c:geo used: 206.03.06 System information: Finish language Other comments and remarks: I suspect the problem might be that the translation is wrong. The english original contains #### as a placeholder while finish misses on # Can someone confirm this reason, then I will correct it on Crowdin.

buginformation.summary: Nearby search does not respect type filter for OX-caches
buginformation.description: Version: 2014.01.14-NB Activate GC and OX Set global filter to e.g. "Event cache" Perform nearby search Result: For GC only the filtered type is shown For OX all cache types are shown

buginformation.summary: NullPointerExceptions when gc.com username is blank
buginformation.description: Steps: Remove username and password from settings Open a stored cache In the logbook (or trackable logbook), click a username and select to send message or view profile (something to get cgeo to not be running activity) Go back to cgeo Click a username again and search for caches found or owned java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: GK wrong log author for logs with attached comment
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GKB3F8 Swipe to Logbook Actual behavior after performing these steps: Log from 2016/01/30 is authored by "kumy" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Real author is "nocybe1810" Version of c:geo used: master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: This log has comments attached to it.

buginformation.summary: HTC One (M7): Compass rotates in 180° steps
buginformation.description: Split up from #4552 Following the above mentioned issue and the reports we get on support mail and Facebook we can break down current compass problem to this specific one: Device: HTC One (M7) Android: 4.4.3 Description: When rotating the phone the compass does not turn steady but will jump by 180° as soon as this angle is reached Same bevavior with the arrow on map Independently of Google Play Service settings Not yet tested if Low-power mode On/Off makes any difference At the same time other compass apps are working normal (i.e. the sensors itself seem to work fine) Current RC-version 2015.01.07-RC does not solve the problem I sent a video from a user showing that issue to the cgeo-dev mailing list on 07.01.2015. @arteos Can you kindly test if enabling "Low power" in c:geo Menu - Settings - System makes any difference for this issue? Can you please fall back to version 2014.11.04 (Download from here: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/releases/tag/market_20141104) and check if the compass is normal in this version? There are also reports with HTC One Mini, Android 4.4.2 but sadly without a clear description whether it is the same problem (jumping by 180°). I will ask those users via support mail to describe in more detail.

buginformation.summary: Circles are hardly seen
buginformation.description: Maybe I'm wrong, but when you started to show circles on map around caches, those for traditionals were red, filled and not dotted. Now they are all black, dotted and very slim, as they were for Multis and Mysteries, because their header-koords mostly are wrong. So they are hardly seen on Google-Satellite-Map. When switching from Google to OSM or otherwise... the Circle-option get lost, but no big problem

buginformation.summary: Extend waypoint context menu
buginformation.description: I would like to have an extended context menu for the waypoints in the new details: compass navigate (and sub items)

buginformation.summary: Spoilers not recognized
buginformation.description: Seems like they are now delivered by https. 👍 1

buginformation.summary: Spoiler image parsing fails
buginformation.description: Due to the recent gc.com site update on October, 16th parsing spoiler images seems to have a problem: The unit test fails and @rsudev debugged it back to GC2JVEH failing to parse the spoiler images. Also for me in the NB neither the spoiler hint nor the gallery is shown for this cache. We decided not to push a notification as we assume it should be solvable quite easy and we could release a bugfix.

buginformation.summary: Ignored cache may persist in DB
buginformation.description: When you select ignore cache from the cgeo menu on the selected cache, it states that if you need to see this cache again you need to restore it from Geocaching.com. However, this doesnt work - i have chose two different caches to ignore, but they still appear on my map and nearby list.

buginformation.summary: Terrain filter goes up to T7,5
buginformation.description: AFAIK the highest T-rating currently is T7. However the filter selection offers the following filters: This is either a issues of incorrect strings or also a code problem?!

buginformation.summary: Test current master branch on 2.3.x
buginformation.description: For me, a class is not found as soon as the application is launched, due to commit d3dc2be: rx.android.view.OnSubscribeViewDetachedFromWindowFirst$SubscriptionAdapter This can be tested with the existing NB.

buginformation.summary: Icon has the wrong size
buginformation.description: Incorrect icon size for drawable-hdpi/cgeo.png: expected 72x72, but was 64x64

buginformation.summary: Show log-images also for TBs
buginformation.description: c:geo is supporting pictures in logs already for caches..maybe this could also be applied for TB-logs ?

buginformation.summary: Hint picture is not refreshed when switching to different cache
buginformation.description: Not sure if this is the same as #4570 but I have a clear repro with the 2015.09.28 (Lollipop on Galaxy S5 neo): 2 saved caches (repro with GC26F8R and GC57JEX), open the GC26F8R, tap the hint picture -> rendered picture is ok go toGC57JEX, open the hint picture there -> rendered picture is still from GC26F8R

buginformation.summary: Own coords not updated in waypoint screen
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open s saved cache Go to the waypoint tab Start creating a new waypoint Tap on the coords to open the input dialog Start moving from your position so that your own coords are changing Press the "Own coordinates" button repeatedly to obtain updated coords Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The coords are never changing in the input dialog, You have to leave the dialog and open it again to get an update. Expected behaviour after performing these steps: The button "Own coordinates" should update the fields with the actual coordinates. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.10-NB (but probably since we introduced the new input dialog) Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Other comments and remarks:

buginformation.summary: Logs gone after online logging
buginformation.description: store a cache log the cache online the new log should be added to the offline stored logs Reality: There is only the new log in the log page, also killing the process doesn't help. Version: Current master HEAD.

buginformation.summary: Log button not visually disabled
buginformation.description: When I am not logged on to gc.com, the log button is disabled, but this is not visible for the user. After the implementation for #200 (toast on failed login) I now might have an idea why this button is no longer reacting...

buginformation.summary: Wrong error toast after deleting cache from list
buginformation.description: Market version 2015.11.29: After selecting delete on cache detail page some users see a toast message "cgeo could not find the cache" (or similar) when returning to the list.

buginformation.summary: New HTML format for spoiler images
buginformation.description: The format for spoilers image seem to have changed during the GC.com upgrade. We do not currently load spoiler images for caches that are not in our database. See GC2QM0K for example (unless you're having Marseille caches in your database :-) If someone wants to tackle this, that would be great, and we would be able to do a new release on the market.

buginformation.summary: Bring back "insert datetime" in logging menu
buginformation.description: C:geo used to have "insert datetime" within logging menu. It's possible to bring it back? Thanks.

buginformation.summary: Support SSL for GK connection when possible.
buginformation.description: GeoKrety.org provides SSL support, but they're certificate is self signed.. :/ Should I try to 'auto-accept' the "bad" certificate, or continue to not use SSL? GeKretyMap.org provides SSL, but our current Network library doesn't support SNI (#4991). Note: Already discussed on #4778 To sum up. @rsudev: I would definitely vote for trying to use SSL, because even with a self-signed certificate we get encryption. @samueltardieu: only if it doesn't make us accept any certificate, because we check the certificate for a number of sites already (extremcaching.com, geocaching.com, open.mapquestapi.com) and I would not want to allow MITM for those. GeoKrety.org GeoKretyMap.org

buginformation.summary: ci job should not install URL in status if empty
buginformation.description: The ci job to install a status message gives an empty URL to the API instead of no URL (when no URL has been entered). This causes a crash when the user clicks the notification.

buginformation.summary: Cannot copy cache coordinates
buginformation.description: I can no longer copy the cache coordinates. The clipboard is empty after copying by long-pressing on the coordinates and pressing the copy icon. I use this build: 2015.04.03-NB-c62c328

buginformation.summary: import gpx from mail
buginformation.description: When a user selects a gpx file in an attachment, cgeo will import that file.

buginformation.summary: Crash when looking for non-existent cache by GC
buginformation.description: When looking for a cache, I missed a character and searched for "GC1F9G" (instead of "GC1F9GF"). I got a FC without any log information or stack trace.

buginformation.summary: Login failed on main screen
buginformation.description: Login failed on main screen but all feature working fine. In settings login shows up as OK Strange behavior, but all is working so bug is not important 😉 --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.31-NB-d137393 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (default state) geocaching.com: not logged in (Login failed) System language: pl_PL (cgeo forced to English) Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

buginformation.summary: List menu becomes invisible
buginformation.description: Open a cache list. All menu items are available. Switch directly to the history list. The "list" menu item is now invisible, correctly. Switch directly to a real cache list. The "list" item remains invisible, wrongly. It only works correctly again when exiting the list activity to the main screen and then reopening the lists.

buginformation.summary: Refreshing stored cache can make it move to default list
buginformation.description: If a stored cache is refreshed from the small popup window after clicking on it in map view, it moves to the default ("Stored") list. Steps: Store some caches offline in a list other than default ("Stored") list View the offline caches on the map Click one of the caches to bring up the small description window Click "Refresh" When refresh is done, hit back to close the window and then back again to close the map Cache list will update and cache you just refreshed is no longer there. It has moved to the default ("Stored") list This does not happen if you choose to Refresh in the full Details tab.

buginformation.summary: Listing background not shown in gallery if hosted externally
buginformation.description: Feature request Hi guys, thanks for your great job! It is possible to display the background-image of a cache-listing in c:geo? If the picture is in the gallery than its shown in cgeo. But often the background is not in the gallery and in this case it will not be shown. I hope that will be possible. Thanks and best regards king-ton

buginformation.summary: Cache parsing fails to parse found status
buginformation.description: Result of site changes. The new URL is now used and I don't how what happend with the old URL. A lot of parsing seems ok but up to now I noticed that found status is not parsed. Steps: Perform nearby search Open a found unsaved cache Result: "Found" status is not parsed. The remaining items seem OK on the first look.

buginformation.summary: Save Box cut off
buginformation.description: When adding a waypoint the Box that saves the waypoint is cut off at the bottom 121912nb http://www.imgur.com/VxXgW.png

buginformation.summary: Unknown trackable if network not available
buginformation.description: Have no data connection. Lookup a trackable code from main screen. A trackable result opens without any details except the geocode. We should show an error instead.

buginformation.summary: Blue arrow over cache markers
buginformation.description: This one from support email: I just have one question. When I select navigate to geocache option, map is shown with a geocache marker and my current location (arrow). When I get close to the geocache, the arrow goes underneath the geocache marker. The geocache marker is big and it is totally obscuring the arrow. Is there a way to have the arrow go over the geocache marker? This would help me (and probably others) to navigate very close to the cache location before we start searching.

buginformation.summary: Filter for "Personal Note existing"
buginformation.description: From support mail: When looking at a list of saved caches I can not see whether some have stored notes. I suggest to have a filter for this e.g.: Filter -> Status-> With personal note From my side I think also the alignment of icons between map and lists (another issue here) could improve the situation.

buginformation.summary: Ask for list on attachment import
buginformation.description: We already ask to confirm the import. That dialog should not only be a confirmation, but also a target list selection.

buginformation.summary: Doubled caches on live-map
buginformation.description: With NB0503 - 12e87a9 I have seen the following twice up to now but not reproducible: A cache is loaded at the outer range of the live-map (with unknown cache-type at first) I move in to this location and the live-map is refreshed At the end I have two icons representing the same cache: The unknown icon stays, the correct icon on the reliable coordinates is still shown besides it. If I click on one of them, the exact same information is shown in the popup (including the correct cache-type) Please see this example where the unknown-icon and the mystery-icon actually are the same caches. As you see also after zooming in and refreshing by moving the map the problem stays. The problem disappeared after closing and reopening the app. I don't know if closing and reopening the map solves it (did not try).

buginformation.summary: Wrong image title in TB-log
buginformation.description: I have just seen with 2014.10.27-NB that the image title for the second latest log entry for this TB seems to be malformed. http://www.geocaching.com//track/details.aspx?tracker=TB121TG To be verified.
