buginformation.summary: Automate download of whereigo cartridge
buginformation.description: Hi, because geocaching.com and wherigo.com logins are the same ... it should be possible to automate download of cartridge ... and starting of whereyougo (or other player from cgeo), am I right ?

buginformation.summary: Wrong initial positioning on live map
buginformation.description: Today I was out caching with 2014.10.09-NB and had the following problem, which I try to describe: Low power mode activated in c:geo I started at home where I had Wifi active in my home network I drove 35km to the cache location Activated the live map The initial position before GPS fix is accquired is still "at home" making the position jump 35km forth and back on each standby and resume of the map Most probably the location provider had no better information, so it took the last available approximated position until the fix is done. What I don't understand is, that this happens repeatedly altough after the first fix the location provider should rather assume that I am on the last known position. Is this a problem/behaviour of the Google Service or can we do anything about that. I never experienced this "problem" in c:geo versions without Google Location Service.

buginformation.summary: Images tab is blank after cache is updated
buginformation.description: Steps: Open a stored cache that has some images for the images tab Scroll to the images tab and you'll see the images Scroll to the waypoints tab Click to Add or Edit a waypoint Go back to the cache details Scroll to the images tab and now it will be blank This happens anytime notifyDataSetChanged in CacheDetailActivity is called (adding to watchlist, add favorite, edit/add waypoint, etc).

buginformation.summary: Popup is empty on live map
buginformation.description: NB2013.05.05 Open live map Click on any cache or waypoint of a cache The popup opens completely empty

buginformation.summary: Problem re-activiting GPS after longer phone sleep
buginformation.description: From the German geocaching forum (translation by me): My current observation is, that after the phone has been in sleep-mode for a longer time, c:geo is not able to re-activate the GPS. Neither the new location symbol from Android nor the GPS symbol is shown. After stopping and re-starting c;geo it works again. (Android 4.4, cyanogenmod 11, HTC one, c:geo NB from 27.01.2014 probably) (Original text from http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=1154170#p1154170): Allerdings, nach meiner bisherigen Beobachtung, wenn das Handy offensichtlich längere Zeit im Sleepmodus war, kriegt c:geo GPS nicht wieder aktiviert. Weder das neue Lokalisationssymbol von Android noch das GPS-Symbols eines GPS-Tools erscheint dann wieder in der Statusleiste. Der Workaround geht folgendermaßen: c:geo abschießen und neu starten, danach funktioniert GPS auch wieder.

buginformation.summary: The distance of the compass mode hangs
buginformation.description: A note in market: The distance of the compass mode hangs on galaxy s2, useless for caching! This has to be investigated

buginformation.summary: Cannot open cache from GK LogEntry waypoint
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Having GKM proxy enabled Open a GK which has been placed in a cache (like GKB988) Swipe to the Logbook tab Tap one of the geocode just behind the date Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast say "c:geo failed to download cache details" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The corresponding cache should be opened (like done for TB) Version of c:geo used: master w/ #5847 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: The LogEntry only store cache name and GUID. In the case of GeoKrety, we don't know the GUID, only the geocode (or coordinates). This will also be necessary if cache is from opencaching (no guid info there?)

buginformation.summary: Cache not stored if setting for list selection is disabled
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Disable Settings - Offline Data - "Ask for list" Open unsaved cache Select "Store" Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache details do not reflect that the cache has been stored, the cache is not stored to the default list Expected behavior after performing these steps: Cache is stored to the default list Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.07-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: We might also decide to remove the "Ask for list" setting as it is contrary to the desired tag/multi-list feature

buginformation.summary: User with one cache found is shown wrong
buginformation.description: In logbook view users with one cache found are listed with “1 Ein Cache“ (german version).

buginformation.summary: Opening saved caches lead to crash if "Last Page" is active
buginformation.description: A handful of users on support mail and FB are reporting that they experience force closes regularly when trying to open saved caches. It helped to reset c:geo to factory defaults in all cases, however one user investigated a bit more and reported this: If the option "Last Details page" is active, those crashes are happening. Switching that option off everything is OK. I can not reproduce this using the current market version, but the explanation is somehow trustworthy. Any idea ?

buginformation.summary: Mass operation for uploading notes
buginformation.description: Today I did a cache tour with bonus mystery. So as always I noted down all bonus numbers in each cache personal note, without any uploading while on the tour. Now it would be nice to upload all those notes together.

buginformation.summary: Smaller wait time for proper coordinates
buginformation.description: This is related to issue #375: I used to disable GPS to save battery power on bigger trails and while its relatively easy to switch it back on, c:geo takes lots of time to notice that new coordinates can be queried. I wish there would be a "query now" or "update now" button in the compass or - which would be most preferred of course - enough intelligence that c:geo picks up new coordinates much faster than it does now. Most of the time its quicker to completely force quit the app, restart it and open the last cache than to wait for it to get new coordinates...

buginformation.summary: Storing cache from details downloads again
buginformation.description: IIRC this bug was fixed some months ago, but now it is back again. When you open a not stored cache and store it with the button from the detail activity, the data is downloaded again. It should use the already downloaded data.

buginformation.summary: Inconsistency of pictures in image tab
buginformation.description: I was happening to me recently and two users on support mail reported that: Opening a saved cache and looking at the image tab sometimes shows pictures of a different saved cache. On next access (or on next refresh) it is solved (not sure about the conditions).

buginformation.summary: Nightly build 2016.02.29 not starting
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Users reported on support and FB report that the NB is installable but crashed immediately after starting. Could be related to #5489 Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you: To be checked Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Will attach log this evening (or someone can help out please)

buginformation.summary: Crash when opening cache link from cache description
buginformation.description: Open GC1BABN Click on the first link to the listed other cache in the cache description ("Respeitem...")

buginformation.summary: Inconsistencies between lists
buginformation.description: Starting with 2015.05.22-NB1 I seem to have extreme inconsistencies on my lists of saved caches. Example: I open a list named GdH with 15 caches I open one of them and close it again Returning to the list I do see that all caches shown belong to the history list but not my list The header still shows GdH as name but a count of 81 caches (which is the amount of caches in the history list) Leaving and reentering the lists solves it Trying to explitcitly reproduce it was not succesfull, but it keeps happening in various ways.

buginformation.summary: Turning compass on/off is counter-intuitive
buginformation.description: Turning the compass on/off is counter-intuitive in the compass activity, as you have to click on the "compass" icon and gets no visual feedback. This setting should never be placed onto the action bar.

buginformation.summary: Field note upload "since last export" should be controlled by c:geo
buginformation.description: Currently the option "since last export" in the field note upload dialog will only activate the appropriate checkbox on geocaching.com fieldnote page. This has some disadvantages: The checkbox is only existing on the webpage if there are still pending logs (it can be used to add more notes to an already exisiting list of pending notes only). If a user exports field notes from c:geo, logs all the notes on gc.com and later exports again as he has new offline logs, all stored offline logs will be again shown on gc.com (old ones and new ones). We could delete the offline logs in c:geo once the export and upload is OK, but as exporting them does not mean logging them, this might raise other problems. So saving an own timestamp of the last export (not use the gc.com feature) and exporting only logs newer than that sound like a better way.

buginformation.summary: New Map: NullPointerException
buginformation.description: From Google Play with beta version 2016.11.21-RC: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: EC terrain rating misses stars in cache details
buginformation.description: extremcaching.com uses a 7 star terrain rating. AFAIR c:geo also shows seven star icons in the cache details on EC caches. With 2015.05.29-RC open EC1043, it shows T5/7 but only five red stars, no grey stars.

buginformation.summary: Compass freeze when talking compass is active
buginformation.description: 2016.02.03 (reported on support mail and reproducible for me): starting compass starting talking compass function switching to another app or blanking the screen by pressing the power button switching back to c:geo now the compass is frozen and does not react when changing the bearing of the device the compass and talking compass react to changes in distance but not to changes in bearing This behaviour ist 100% reproducable but does NOT appear, when using compass wihtout the talking function leaving the compass screen on while using talking compass (i.e not switching to another app) downgrading c:geo to v2015.11.29

As my SGS3 was OK with the same build I guess we have the same problem now with one higher resolution step. Remark; For the SGS3 it was solved with this commit: a0566f5

buginformation.summary: "All caches" list not remembered

buginformation.summary: Crash with invalid listid
buginformation.description: If a user has a 'last listid' that is no longer valid (e.g. after a database restore) c:geo crashes when accessing the stored caches. No chance to switch to an exising listid. Only cure is to remove and reinstall c:geo

buginformation.summary: Exception when backuping the phone
buginformation.description: From Google Play console: java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError

buginformation.summary: LOC files always imported to standard list
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Create a new list Select import and select a loc file (in my case it contained 25 gc benchmarks) Actual behavior after performing these steps: Waypoints are imported to default list Expected behavior after performing these steps: Waypoint should be imported to active list Version of c:geo used: 2016.11.26-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

buginformation.summary: New date formats on gc.com
buginformation.description: According to our FAQ and my experience we support all of the date formats of gc.com except dd/MM/yyyy as we can not differentiate it from MM/dd/yyyy So we support and detect: yyyy-MM-dd yyyy/MM/dd MM/dd/yyyy dd/MMM/yyyy MMM/dd/yyyy dd MMM yy See: http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_6 Right now the amount of people having problems with log dates and contacting us has raised. I checked the website and have seen the following new(?) date formats: dd.MMM.yyyy dd.mm.yyyy Seems gc.com introduced '.' as separator as well. At least four users gave feedback, that they were actually using one of these but did not actively change to that. So might be, that they changed some defaults based on whatever rule. Shall we do anything for that? dd.MMM.yyyy should be detectable and usable, but dd.mm.yyyy is not usable I think (due to the existing mm.dd.yyyy)

buginformation.summary: ANR on map
buginformation.description: I experienced this three times today with 2014.06.14-NB. Last weekend there was nothing like that in a similar usecase. As read on IRC @SammysHP made a similar experience and managed to make it reproducible and take a log.

If I use it for ie 10 caches all is OK. If I use it for ie 200 caches, I haven't tab Listing in Locus. I guess there is some limitation in the amount of data we can hand over?!

buginformation.summary: Calculating Coordinates
buginformation.description: Hello, I'm using a navigation system in my car, which only understands Decimal or DDD MM SS.SSS GPS coordinates.. [1] It would be very nice, if you could make it like de/encrypting the logs by clicking on them, we could change the GPS style by clicking on the coordinates. Automatical show the other format is not good, because a lot of caches requires calculating for example +123, but to the original GPS format :) Hope you understand, what I mean.. [1] http://www.geocaching.com/wpt/​?lat=47.05985&lon=15.4289

buginformation.summary: Map position is not always saved
buginformation.description: If a map view is restarted after having been removed from memory and the map provider has changed, the location and zoom information are lost because they are not stored in the Bundle. Also, if a map restart is needed because the map provider changed, this information must be transmitted to the new map through the Intent starting it.

buginformation.summary: Switch signature-auto-insertion on/off
buginformation.description: From facebook: George Markusic I would like to say that I am so happy that someone picked up the support of this application. The only issue I have since the change is my signature. Now when I try to log cache it automatically loads my signature first. I always enjoy putting in a story of my adventure first then add my signature to the bottom. Is it possible to add a feature in a future release where it is an option to have the signature automatically load or you can add it when you want like in the older version. I'll add this functionality.

buginformation.summary: Support links encoded in some GeoKrety QRCode
buginformation.description: GK labels sometimes contains QRCode, with encoded http link (of course I didn't talk about scanning inside c:geo, there are tons of good dedicated applications out there). Link gives access to a page, where user can choose to 'view details' or 'log grabbing'. Format is: http://geokrety.org/m/qr.php?nr= a) We could support those urls as an intent to LogTrackableActivity having Tracking Code pre-filled with value of nr. b) GKM Api provides a conversion tool to obtain GK number from Tracking Code. http://api.geokretymap.org/nr2id.php?nr= Response contains only an integer (the GK number), or 0 if no match is found. We could use this to do a lookup then open the TrackableDetailsActivity (and remember what was the Tracking Code). The user can view the GK goal and decide to take it with him. He could then hit the log button, LogTrackableActivity will be shown having Tracking Code pre-filled with (remembered) value of nr.

buginformation.summary: Clearing saved log doesn't update cache details view
buginformation.description: Steps: Enable offline logging in settings Open a stored cache Select Log Visit Offline from options menu and select a choice (such as Write note) Screen will update immediately showing "Status: Saved Log" Select Log Visit Offline from options menu again and select Clear It doesn't appear anything happens and status still says Saved Log Go back to list and offline marker is present Reopen cache and Saved Log will be gone and when returning to list, marker will be gone

buginformation.summary: Save from popup does not update icon
buginformation.description: Since some weeks in the NBs the popup from live map is closed right after selecting "Save". (It seems the saving is now done in the background). Thats quite OK, because it does not block the app during the cache download. However the icon of the cache to be saved is not updated afterwards. It stays marked unreliable, does not "jump" to the precise coordinates and the disk-overlay is not shown. You have to close and reopen or reload the map to make the change visible. @rsudev: That's the issue I talked about on IRC some days ago.

buginformation.summary: GPS exhibit not recognized as event cache
buginformation.description: No description provided.

buginformation.summary: opencaching: use language instead of country to retrieve descriptions
buginformation.description: In the OKAPI you can set your preferred langauge for retrieval of various strings, because e.g. cache descriptions can be availabel in many languages. We currently use locale.getCountry() for that, instead of locale.getLanguage()...

buginformation.summary: "Import from Internet" does not open
buginformation.description: 2014.01.17-NB This issue happens also in other scenarios but this one is reproducible for me : Open a list Select Manage -> Import from internet "Waiting for caches" dialog shown Cancel Select again Manage -> Import from internet Nothing happens I have the feeling this also happens on the first try if other operations to that list (e.g. delete, move, refresh) have been done before. Leaving and reentering the list makes it work again (for one time).

buginformation.summary: errors in unit test
buginformation.description: When running unit tests, the log shows that loadLogsFromDetails() throws an error for some caches ("... status is error"). Could someone look into that who knows the log reading code?

buginformation.summary: *.loc from waymarking not imported
buginformation.description: The problem listed in #1987 seems to happen again but now for waymarking.com which used to work before: 2013-06-05-NB If I try to import a *.loc from waymarking.com the problem is like described before. The caches are imported and static maps are downloaded. But after returning to the list no caches/waypoints are shown. Import from waymarking.com used to work before. REMOVED (testing fault - import from geocaching.com is OK, my database was corrupted)

buginformation.summary: "put a cache on watch list" with c:geo
buginformation.description: Have a button in c:geo that put a cache or trackable to watch list.

buginformation.summary: Visually disable nearby button in main screen without GPS fix
buginformation.description: This is similar to issue #66 but I'm logging this separately as this is about visually disabling the nearby button as long as there is the GPSr either switched off or there is no fix. In fact, the button is currently already disabled, yet there is no visual clue to the user. As a possible visual clue I would like to suggest to cross out the button instead of grayingit as this should be more visible even in bad lighting conditions. For instance, it could be crossed out in red.

buginformation.summary: Bad dialog entries when user cannot be located
buginformation.description: If the user cannot be located at all and uses "search / coordinates", the initial dialog presented to it ignores the mode of coordinates selection (plain, degrees, deg+min, deg+min+sec) and display the wrong fields. I'll fix this in the release branch.

buginformation.summary: Enable personal note editing for unstored caches
buginformation.description: As users have trouble finding out why there is no "edit" button. When using this on unstored caches, simply ask for storing first.

buginformation.summary: NPE - Attempt to get length of null array (DirectionDrawer)
buginformation.description: Beta feedback of current beta versions on Google Play: Crash when opening the map for a cache java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to get length of null array

buginformation.summary: Geopoint Parse Exception
buginformation.description: This error started to raise just yesterday on GooglePlay. Can that be caused by a website change? Version 2015.06.19 Several Android versions, several devices Message: Crashed while loading/opening caches java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fatal Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread.

buginformation.summary: Wrong coordinates after storing cache
buginformation.description: Today I had a preety bad experience with some caches, after using the nightly build (Version: 04.03.2012) I stored some caches from the live map, and each and every one of them had wrong coordinates. I was logged in successfully in the app. Example cache is this: http://coord.info/GCJ1YZ Coordinates on the cache page are: N 45° 59.783 E 014° 21.617 But coordinates STORED in c:geo are N 45° 59.818 E 014° 21.548 Even after clicking the refresh button, coordinates are still wrong, same as before - not the same as on the cache page. On the field I was sure that coordinates should be exact if I refresh the cache, only after checking the situation back home I figured out why I had problems with navigation.

buginformation.summary: Many exceptions in log in offline case
buginformation.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have new map as default Be without network connection when starting c:geo Have debug mode active Open live map Actual behavior after performing these steps: The loading indicator is flickering on the action bar indicating loading activity in rapid cycles The log shows nearly endless exceptions Expected behavior after performing these steps: Offline condition should have no negative effects, comparable behaviour to old map Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.08-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: 22:41:30.521 Debug cgeo 23982 [looper callbacks] RotationProvider: registering listener

buginformation.summary: show 'Import from web' even without proper send2cgeo registration
buginformation.description: It may be confusing for users that they can't find 'Import from web' entry in menu, when they don't have registered send2cgeo service. I suggest to have the entry there and show error informing user that send2cgeo is not ready to use and maybe even contain link to registration page.

buginformation.summary: refresh missing after circles setting has been changed
buginformation.description: If you enable/disable the circles around caches from the options menu of a map, then a refresh is missing. The change only gets visible on next interaction with the map.

buginformation.summary: NPE in speech service
buginformation.description: From Google Play console for cgeo 2015.07.08: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. Add `onError` handling.

buginformation.summary: Links in logs not clickable
buginformation.description: Links in Logs which have not the url as text are not clickable, e.g. my log in http://coord.info/GC4H0P6.

buginformation.summary: Endless wait when reseting cache coords just locally
buginformation.description: Related to #2271. Steps: store a multicache offline modify the coords on gc.com refresh the cache in cgeo. Note that the new Original waypoint has been added and coords have changed go to the Original waypoint and chose to Reset and choose just locally I get a dialog that never ends with title "Cache" and text "Reset cache coordinates" The last thing in log is: Loading GCXXX (1) from DB Edit: After forcing cgeo to quit from Eclipse, when reopening the cache, things look ok (Original waypoint is gone. Cache coords back to original. gc.com not modified) @triakcz

buginformation.summary: Upload of personal note not working
buginformation.description: 2014.08.10-NB: Compose a personal note for a cache Upload the personal note to g.com c:geo reports "Succesful" but in fact the note is not shown on the website. Release branch is OK according to @rsudev tests.

buginformation.description: After a site update on gc.com the nearby search does return incomplete results. Cache type is unkown.

buginformation.summary: German umlauts not uploaded correctly in picture text
buginformation.description: I tested the picture upload today and used "Test Überschrift" as picture caption. Once uploaded it is shown in c:geo and on website as "Test ?berschrift". I guess it will be the same problem for the picture description.

buginformation.summary: Can not authorize to oc.pl
buginformation.description: When trying to start authorization I get the toast "c:geo could not start the authorization" 2014.02.24-NB I was about to retest an issue of a user which has problems to post a log to oc.pl (will open a separate issue for this). Maybe this has a connection Log: 22:44:55.225 Error DatabaseUtils 2392 Writing exception to parcel

buginformation.summary: Reliable check in search result
buginformation.description: I have seen the following issue today with NB2301 0e9faa4 but also with older NBs: Steps: Search for caches e.g. by adress (Example: Gotenstraße Hamburg) On the result list click the map-icon (upper right) to map the search-result On the map all the caches are shown as unreliable although they are online requested in the search. Only after opening the detail for a cache, returning to the search result and displaying the map again the specific cache is shown as reliable. Is there no possibility to check the reliability in the search or is the check just missing ?

buginformation.summary: Live Map Show As List shows last search not caches shown on the map
buginformation.description: When user selects Show As List from the menu on Live Map, it shows a list created from lastSearchResult which doesn't necessarily match the caches shown on screen, just the last batch downloaded. I think this is leftover from the old live map where a single search populated the screen. The implementation should be more simliar to how the list for storing offline is gathered. I assign myself.

buginformation.summary: live map from search
buginformation.description: when doing a search and then enabling live map you have to press meme enable live and then menu enable live a second time before live map works Sent via Hubroid

buginformation.summary: Show map from a list display all caches
buginformation.description: From what I remember, original cgeo were able to display only caches from a list. Now when you show map into list, all caches are displayed. Reading is then complex (I got a few hundred waypoints stored, because i use offline a lot). May be a new button "show all" / "show list only" could be valuable ( like enable/disable live ) ?

buginformation.summary: have link from hint section to spoiler images
buginformation.description: If spoiler images are available, there should be some kind of link to open them from the hint section of the cache details page. I suggest to have a right aligned picture/photo icon in the cache section, if spoiler images are available. Tapping that icon would then open the spoiler images activity, similar to the options menu. The user experience would be better (I regularly miss spoiler images), and for typical hints the additionally used space on the screen would be neglectable.

buginformation.summary: "Modfiy coords on website" not hidden properly for OC-caches
buginformation.description: When I create a waypoint for an opencaching cache the checkbox for uploading the coordinates to the website are not shown (which is correct) but the text string is still shown:

buginformation.summary: TB missing in inventory if name contains special characters
buginformation.description: From support mail and tested by temporarily grabbing the affected TB: 2015.10.30: Have a TB in your inventory which contains the character ² (Example: TB5AHKB) Start logging activity for a cache The inventory list is populated with all TBs in inventory except the problematic one. It is completely missing. No error or info shown in adb log when starting logging.

buginformation.summary: Filter lost after opening cache details
buginformation.description: Hi, Steps to reproduce: open stored caches list apply a filter (in my case Status > With trackable) open a cache to display the cache details when going back from cache details to the list of caches ... the filter is gone (ie all caches are displayed). It seems to be a regression link to the introduction of the new "categorized filters". best regards,

buginformation.summary: GPX-export improvements
buginformation.description: From support mail. I have not enough understanding of GPX to decide whether they are justified: Thanks for GPX exporting functionality. Here are some ideas for further development in that area: possibility to configure the folder where the GPX files are exported Include following data to GPX file: Link to cache webpage Cache terrain/difficulty ratings Cache size Cache hint
